IJnkiRwuVUsLKekc-DNrlA.text: Pizza Rock is a great restaurant. I would recommend it to everyone. It's got a great vibe and always clean.   The food is awesome. Their pizzas are very unique in name and flavor which I like because it changes it up from the norm.  Customer service always seems to be spot on. I've never had any issues with service.  The only reason why I give it a 4 star is because of the volume in the restaurant. The music is too loud. 9 out of 10 times I can't hear the person next to me.  Love Pizza Rock!!

XA7NSGxr_eWSvagHIW08LA.text: Stack of plates: top clean, 2 beneath COVERED in someone else's food = gross. Delivered pizza to table and it slid off plate onto table. Normally I'd be fine because I'm not neurotic but having been given plates encrusted in dirty food I was grossed out so asked for a new pizza. The response from server: "it's going to be a while since you requested a new one."  I assure you I'm neither demanding nor rude. If I wanted to eat unsanitary food off of unclean plates I would eat on the streets.   Sad experience. Spare your efforts.  The pizza rock downtown at least embraces quality service and standards.

oPexkk_VkQB4cTTLoIObKQ.text: I went to the location at The District. Pizza Rock has sooooo many different flavor/ crust combinations. It's unlike anywhere else.   They also have happy hour and reverse happy hour with great drink specials! :)

-VBLB_kfO1n8QVm_mCcNlA.text: First of all, I don't like restaurants with celebrity chefs.  Just because the chef has his/her name on it and the recipes are theirs, doesn't mean the QC of the food is there.  Tony G has brought his recipes and his attitude to Vegas and it works.  Very well.  That being said, forget this restaurant has the word "pizza" in its name.  Yes, the pizza is the best in town (most probably the best in the US), but it's the Italian food that makes this place the best west of the Mississippi.  The pasta is made in house daily, the beer selection is top notch, the portions are enormous without sacrificing quality, and the taste will send you into a frenzy of singing "Santa Lucia."  We started with the deep fried artichoke hearts and the salumi and cheese plate.  The artichokes didn't survive the first 30 seconds on the table, and there was so much salumi and cheese and fresh foccacia that we had to bring it home.  Next we ordered the sausage and peppers dinner and a Neapolitan Margarita pizza.  Forget everything you know about Neapolitan pie.  This will make you reevaluate what you did with your life before you tried this.  The sausage and peppers was likewise delicious.  The prices are reasonable for what you get.  We went to the one in GVR, but there's the first one in Vegas downtown on 3d street.  They also have a Chicago-style place in Palace Station, and that's next on the list.  Finally: go. Go today.  Go now.  If they're not open yet, stand in line until they are.

46F9un93177JkCKntx3i-Q.text: Excellent pizza and service. Had the Red Stripe and loved it. Crust was tasty and crispy with lots of cheese. Definitely will come back!

OHhZtSNFwKkrrS2K3okwVA.text: To be fair, I am not a huge fan of pizza. I don't typically eat it more than once every month or two.  I ordered a pepperoni pizza, and my friend ordered their famous margherita pizza. The server first brought out the pepperoni pizza, and said the margherita pizza was on the way out but it was about 10 minutes for the other. The pepperoni pizza was pretty good, and the margherita pizza was just good, certainly not this spectacular thing that I've heard it was, and absolutely not worth the price.  All in all, service was slow (although it was football sunday), and while the food was good it wasn't worth the price, or the drive all the way to Henderson.

3Az8OuIbVhugqCvdEwLQOg.text: Another delicious dinner with Jesse as our waiter. His service was impeccable and he is a very sweet gentleman! He showed us the Happy Hour Menu that we had no idea about and recommended the Gorgonzola Fries which were OUT OF BOUNDS! Thank you, Jesse, for your outstanding service and thank you, PR, for your amazing dishes!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. Gorgonzola Cheese Fries - YUM!!
Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. New Yorker Pizza
Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. New Yorker = divine!!

UNsLj43LYMbFmiBsewcJLw.text: The meatballs compare to no other. They have 2 happy hours everyday where you can get them for $1 each! There are thousand of restaurants in Vegas, but we go to Pizza Rock, at the Green Valley Ranch location, several times to eat when we are in Vegas. We should explore the menu more, but our favorite is the Tomato Pie and an order of the meatballs. Pure excellence is all I can say. The staff is great. They're all very attentive and friendly, very helpful with the large selection of pizzas they have on the menu. They also have a large variety of beers as well. We love sitting at the bar, to the far left, and watching them make pizzas in ONE of their many woodfire pizza ovens.  I seen on Amazon that Tony Gemignani has 3 books. I added them to my wish list and can't wait to order them and try some of his dishes at home when I'm craving me some Pizza Rock back home in Wisconsin.  I think our next trip to Vegas we will switch things up and head to the original Pizza Rock location downtown to try! :-)

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. The Tomato Pie

XXPU3TSNYDw5heaFg2H4mg.text: After waiting months for this place to open, our first visit was a bit anticlimactic.  We had the Mob Boss pizza and, wow...nice array of toppings but what a chunk of dough!  It seems like the pizza will be the strong suit here, but I saw other Italian entrees at other tables and they looked good and artfully prepared.    So...why do I give it three stars?  1. Uncomfortable cheap seating and tables. 2. Outdated Ed Hardy-esque douchy decor theme. 3. Music playing WAY too loud, as in you have to yell at the servers and anyone you wish to talk to at your table.  This is a cheap poorly done audio system with just a bunch of speakers set at high volume...not the way to do audio in this type of setting, they really need to consult an audio engineer and get this fixed. 4. It took over 30 minutes to get our pizza...and it was not crowded.  Hopefully #4 is temporary and a product of being new, but 1-3 May never change.  This is a real shame as GVR is my "home" casino and I'd really love it if a fantastic restaurant were here as we eat out every meal and I'd heavily patronize them if this were True.  As it sits I'll be lucky to talk my girlfriend into coming here again...

f-WrGBkAMk5_ENShZ1Pw7Q.text: Jonathan the manager is awesome,  the service is great, good beer selection and delicious pizza, if u want to order gluten free pizza just know it's $5 extra.. As it does not say on the menu and the waiter might not tell u.... And Fridays are cray cray, takes forever to get your check so I'm gonna ask for it early if I ever come back here!!

g1Dvx1GzpdAEVcTSrYIT2A.text: Last year we came up to Pizza rock about a half a dozen times for Monday night football. From my previous review you can see we enjoyed coming here.  Fast forward to first Monday night game of the season. Steelers Vs Redskins 4pm. We arrive at about say 3:40 I tell our hostess as she's walking us to our table we are here for Monday night football the steelers are my husbands team she completely ignores me and says is this booth ok? Yes it's fine can we get the game put on this TV ? Mumble mumble and off she goes. Waitress Rachell takes our order meatballs,zucchini fries,garlic bread and a pizza and a beer. So Rachel can we get the Football game on this TV that has baseball on and nobody but us to watch it. I'll ask shouldn't be a problem. Time goes by water arrives can we get the tv changed. I did tell her. I'll ask again. so we have been sitting for 20 minutes still watching baseball.Rachell drops off the beer it's 4pm can we move to another table we came to watch the game. She (guessing SHE is the hostess) should be by to change them. 5 minutes later meatballs are out, still baseball. We're gonna need to change tables. Waitress clearly annoyed tell me she has asked 3 times to have it changed. Allrighty then we are gonna need a new table. Waitress takes off, I pick up the meatballs in passing I run into the delightful Taylor who has evidently been given the small responsibility of changing channels. She snaps at me the game does not even start until 4:10. really? As she flounces and I mean flounces with attitude away. I set the meatballs down I thought really I'm paying to be told off by a 20 year old with a remote. Ugh. The meatballs? well not as I remembered them. the garlic bread was horrible very little garlic or cheese but a distinctive chemical or soapy taste. garlic would've been better. The pizza arrives way way to much sauce. The crust was as divine as I remembered although the bottom was a bit to charred for my liking. Zucchini fries never made it. do you still want them? No no. check please. I think this year we will be searching for a new Monday night football spot.

yLaCQeYM-J0YixR1u0EA2g.text: The hostess up front  went out of her  way to help me answer all my questions..  (I am a vegatarian and allot of cheese has animal renent ,  NOT from the milk , but they add animal fat to hekp cheese stay in form , and she researched it for me , to make sure the cheese was ok for me to eat).  The pizza was a little burnt , but coming from a brick oven I was semi ok wirh it. The sauce was fresh and cheese good.  I WAS AMAZED, FINALLY a restaurant with fresh cut fries .. NOT FROZEN. (Frozen fries have dextrose a BAD form of sugar).  Waitress was on que. And never had to ask for anything.

JK1vVgPceuEVtePICGpoWg.text: BEST pizza Ive ever had . Hands down. I have traveled the world including Italy many times. Its truly amazing they can master that many styles.   Be sure you know what you like so you order the one you will love.   The beer selection is large and well thought out.  Oh did I mention they have a full size Peterbilt with collectable rare beer cases and its a frickin DJ booth to boot.   Great sound for a restaurant.  We will be back often

pNXe9qHSzGzuHDjSnJMiWA.text: Our Uber driver recommended Pizza Rock and it absolutely exceeded our expectations. Our waiter, Darin, was fantastic with attentive customer service and suggestions on what style of pizza to choose. He also connected with our table on a personal level, which created an even better experience. When we come back in April, we will certainly go back. --South Dakota and Montana archers

Tcv5tOM7fcwzx_aiUqbcog.text: Please don't miss this place when you are in Las Vegas! Best Pizza ever and we are New Yorkers!!! Service is top notch! Thank you Rachelle...you rock!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. The New Yorker!!

a03bvm3-Yc6jUN2pwJMy2A.text: Oh my gosh!  Pizza Rock is excellent!  Some of the best I've had in my life.  Ultra-thin crust (because we asked about the crust options), and so, so tasty.  I usually add a little salt & pepper to any pizza I eat, but didn't have to here.  So delicious, and the prices are actually fairly reasonable on the food.  They get you back for the drinks (very spendy beer/wine/liquor).  Atmosphere awesome!  Noisy, but it's also inside a casino; so, there ya go.  I'll be back when visiting my family again.

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. House salad with Gorgonzola dressing (similar to bleu cheese) and ultra-thin crust pie with sausage, onions, and mushrooms.

Yl6qyFgoctdn7Ua7CRY04Q.text: Been back here three more times and the two stars is for service. All times they switched servers on me so the person I was leaving my tip to wasn't the server who originally waited in me. This last visit my I had missed orders because the lady was in such a rush to get out of here she didn't bother writing down my order and when I asked her, no apology. Just I didn't hear you. Maybe you should have written it down, is more like it. The server who took her place left the bill, didn't bother to look that we had leftover pizza for takeout. So we had to get our own box. Disappointed.

U2tiZHrt-WELH7Ys2m7kJA.text: This place is wonderful, the food is amazing and at the place I went to the waitress was amazingly kind to all of me and my friends. Our wait was not long despite the traffic going in and out of it, they get the job done, but it definitely didn't take away from the quality of the food. WOULD SUGGEST.

giEtWJFFCYyWhGBLO6XHuQ.text: After 8 days without a beer (Passover!!!) my guy was very excited at the possibility of having a couple of beers at Pizza Rock.  We had visited the GVR location at their soft opening but only stopped in to look around.  Being a beer snob, he was salivating over the expansive selection of draft and hydro beers.    We arrived after 8pm on Saturday night and there was a 75 minute wait for a table...  just as we were thinking of leaving, 2 spots opened at the bar and we were lucky enough to grab them.  The bar staff was so friendly and quick!  Before Perry decided on what beer to order first, the server offered him a sample.  He was so happy with his choice!  We ordered a caesar salad and while we waited for the food, we enjoyed the video's from the live VJ (stationed in the MACK Truck in the dining area...  yes, it's an amazing feature!  We couldn't stop singing all the songs and watching the vintage music videos...!  That was definitely a high-lite for us!    The salad came out pretty quick for how busy the place was.  It was a big portion, super fresh with a lot of delicious parmesan and crispy croutons. Perry ordered a different beer and was super happy with his second choice.    This place is a little loud, but - hey, it's got a great vibe, good food, great beer selection and the waitstaff was super friendly and fun!  We will definitely be back.

meHzE-B-MUJVl6nSpDK5sg.text: We live across the street and have been wanting to try pizza rock. We tried the New York style pizza that we enjoyed, my daughter had a cheese pizza, we also had the garlic fries as an appitizer, this was the only thing we didn't like, the flavor was good but all of the fries had rotten ends. All in all, we would probably go back, but we won't order the fries.

drNsr4f1G4D076ZF8uIC_Q.text: 5 stars. Only bother writing reviews when it's 5 stars so you know it's gotta be good. Jessica 5 stars. Last time was Cat 5 stars I love pizza Rock

lBz6yWN-HTJgX0Nugzn6BA.text: My husband and I ate here for my birthday the service was great and the pizza even more Amazing! We ordered The New Yorker it was sooo yummy I cannot wait to go back and try more pizza!

178Y9b9VxgjjdrVpWVS2WQ.text: So I've been to the downtown location and absolutely love it every time I go there. When they opened at GVR, I was extremely happy that they would be closer to my house and more convenient. Visited with my parents and friends on Friday night.  Menu is pretty much the same as downtown. Ordered their margherita pizza which they only make 73 of per day and it's been a winner in Naples, Italy. Has to be fantastic right? Not impressed.  We each took a slice and it was cold. Advised the waitress and she happily advised the kitchen staff and came back out to advise they were remaking it, but we had to eat it right away as it's not recommended as a to go pizza, and it's not to be eaten after it cools. Understandable, but still....we didn't wait very long the first time, maybe 5 minutes.  The second one came out and it was piping hot so we quickly grabbed slices.  IT was ok. I wasn't a fan. I didn't like the charred/burned taste throughout the crust, even though it was only partially charred which is how it's made. I mean, 900*, yes some parts will burn slightly.  I'll stick to the New Yorker, Artichoke Joe, or Cal Italia.  Service overall was lacking. We had to flag down our server multiple times, but in her defense, she had gotten a large group behind us to take care of with people ordering at all different times.  I will probably go back because I love their food.    Also, we tried Slice House in the food court, and that was a disappointment too. I think I'm just spoiled by the original location. Downtown, those slices at the window are constantly being made, served, etc, so they're fresh all the time. Here, it seemed the slices were dried out, sat out too long, not flavorful as downtown.  :(   I still love you Pizza Rock, and I know it takes time with a new location to get on your feet.

MEIeyTpRnTtvaQa_zx5Psw.text: Stopped in on a Tuesday night. Detroit Red Top pizza was delicious, husband and I added pepperoni (which they were very generous with). Meatballs were good, but not spectacular. Only issue I had was with out server. She seemed very aloof and not attuned to what her tables needed. Maybe she was just having a bad day but it still left a sour taste in my mouth, especially since it was our first time there. She attempted to remove my child's plate without asking if he was even done (he still had food on there), and she brought our bill without asking if we were interested in dessert (we were, and we tried the mud pie). Even after ordering the dessert, she brought the bill back before even returning with the dessert. I was not impressed with the hostesses, they seemed to lack basic customer service skills, however, they were much nicer than our server. I will likely return, but will ensure that I don't sit in a section with the same server. I've saved this receipt to make sure I don't make the same mistake twice.................

Ejs6Excsf4c9PHS8GV-wtw.text: If you like thin crust, get the Michigan Ave! Simple and delicious! We get carry out often to take home and enjoy for a few days!!

cD_KGID57SKNvA5JGa6FUg.text: I live in the green valley, i first tasted tonys pizza in downtown vegas, there is nothing like it anywhere. I was so happy he came to green valley ranch, both slice house,and pizza rock is a great addition to the district. Its all about that crust. Its simply delicious, this is a whole another realm  in pizza, and pizza guys in vegas and across the country better step up there game.  Chef victor a parise C.E.C. C.C.E.

RMkeK8_6Do7w_6_vp0qbRg.text: After reading reviews from the grand opening I wasn't sure what to expect. However, the service was outstanding and the food was beyond outstanding.  There were six of us and the wait staff was very attentive.  We had the Margherita 17, Frank Nitti (yum), Quattro Carne, and The Henderson ("Of Course") also the Gorgonzola and Truffle Italian French Fries.  Vinny was outstanding. Cannot wait to get back to the place.  A great addition to the GVR property.

nVXpvIBwHpMnurRZ_wShLw.text: I haven't tried many dishes but since trying them I always get the steamed clams with focaccia. I mention them here because I want them to stay on the menu. I did try their pizza, but still go only to nearby Settebello. Go in the off hours if you want to avoid lines and screaming rock music.

xG6e2ZRb0qirfr0WlbuYkw.text: By far the best pizza I've had!! This place just opened but everything was great from beginning to end. Love love the atmosphere! Feels fresh and exciting. Awesome music. Will be back often.

H4-nrXZNUwU7ZcK3QH3bAQ.text: Amazing beer selection! 40 handles from all over. The pizza was great as always! So glad to see that they are in Henderson! I look forward to eating here in the near future.

33ZkKUmR2aVeXAOBRg_0DQ.text: Its busy and the service kind of lacks because of it.  The pizza is good, and there's more life here than the one downtown.  I'll for sure be back,  but the service was very blah for me to give it higher than 3 stars.

wDbaG8BYjXE3To8EJ1d-wQ.text: Absolutely amazing! Large portions, craft beers, and a wonderful staff! Great place to watch a game too. Nice to have a place like this for us locals! We will definitely be back

OV9-3WDkFdR-GVMFrR04eQ.text: The New Yorker is a must try. The Rosemary-garlic fries are the best. Solid happy hour from 3-6 M-F.

6Gf2l8jTofthK6FuIAoupg.text: The music is SOOO freakin loud. I spoke to he manager and said "we love he food here,  but we have to scream at each other to talk". He said "yea, we get that all the time, but the owner wants it this loud". They are big on customer feedback. Get there early for a good happy hour and before they start bursting eardrums.

ZBv4rWEmdswvqggSQaKH1w.text: Favorite place to come to on Sunday's for brunch. Love the atmosphere and the live band on Sunday's. Harmony is amazing! Always made sure we had fresh mimosas and engaged in conversation with us! Favorite bunch place by far.

ZmN0Tpllnbkgx2xgLQLy0A.text: Food was absolutely great. Will be going there again. Staff was nice. Only down side was the wait time. Still a solid four stars.

pZV5IrwfkAgXQgIHlJX01Q.text: They put too much salt on the calamari and almost all of our food.the service was so slow, we sat in the table for about 10 minutes.until the server came.and our bill was overcharge for 10 dollars and manager said it was not printed on the check and we only order 6 items, but anyway this will be our last to eat at this restaurant.

VdiKBEVaZrNE7J_D6fiqrQ.text: Pizza this damn good should be a crime.  If I could eat the whole damn thing I would!!  ;) My sister and brother raved about the opening night that they got to attend and how it was just a tease because the pizza was so phenomenal and the setup was amazing and customer service and the bartenders were exceptional. They've got every kind of pizza any pizza lovers brain could think of! Some vegetarian to meat lovers, definitely pizza that I would never think of but that is absolutely delicious and mouth watering. We have been here a few times and have tasted maybe around six different kind. The names are so creative that I probably can't name all of them but.....I  do know that whatever you order you  will not disappointed!! The calamari is delicious, salads are delicious, the ranch is the beat ranch I have had in my ENTIRE life!!! (True story) service is great, atmosphere is even better. They actually play better music here than at most bars! You'll just have to try it out for yourself. PIZZA ROCK is where its at!

64Ihl10yh4kM_fd-U5KYJQ.text: I struggle with giving pizza rock a two star rating for two reasons. One the food is good. To it was my second stop on restaurant week and so I do like any restaurant that participates in restaurant week. Now listen I know it was Friday night . But in my opinion that doesn't excuse the extreme wait that was happening the entire night. Now if you check my tip for the downtown pizza rock they have a similar issue, they put you on a wait when there are tables available. I really don't understand that. So why the two star rating ? Well I'll tell you and you can tell me if I'm being a little rough. The two star rating is based on the fact that the service was not only slow and terrible but our server was so rude she made me and my two girlfriends incredibly agitated. We finally did tell the manager and I have to tell you he comped our entire meal including alcohol. So did he make a right? absolutely he apologized profusely and said that is not how guests at pizza rock are treated.  And again the food? It's just great. We had the meatballs we had a ricotta pizza and we had tiramisu. And it was all good . I wish the service was better .

X3VRNz0d9jcQlW1rzPK7dg.text: I have been a Vegas/Henderson resident since 2000. I'm from the east coast. When I first moved to Vegas the Pizza was not very good, now I can honestly say that we have great pizza in southern Nevada :). I was excited when I learned that Pizza rock was coming to GVR. I love the downtown las vegas location, The pizza is always a fresh, hot slice of cheesy goodness. My personal favorite is the purple potato pizza. I waited months for the GVR location to open in the food court. I stopped by last week and ordered a slice of the Grandma Pizza, a square shaped slice with a thin layer of cheese. A top the thin layer was three strips of a tomato paste like sauce with herbs sprinkled on the top. There were also very cute tear drop shaped small tomatoes on the top. The slice was fresh but not hot. The sauce was a little bland and the layer of cheese on the slice was very thin. They don't have the flavor options that the downtown location has and I don't think they are getting the turn over. The pizza looked a little dry in the display case, I will return to the downtown location, I will not return to the food court location. I might try the restaurant inside the Casino-not sure yet

e1osecL59g2yRp0IsvOMtQ.text: What a cool hip place to go eat. Pizza was amazing. Zucchini Fries made a great appetizer and their chopped salad was perfection.

Oi6xC6Bp_lls1dJqbPgzkQ.text: This place is so amazing. I am a pizza fanatic and its hard to find good pizza in Henderson. I love the sauce it's the best. The pizza is amazing and now after this review I want some lol.

H1J5pw_TywzB5coW4lM1tA.text: I paid over $17 for a plain really small cheese pizza. It was so burnt I had a hard time folding it in half to eat it. Yuck .. couldn't eat any crust !!  Is there anywhere in Vegas with decent  NY style pizza?

I8oZtI7RuYWbJ0y8eNmGjQ.text: Saw it on USA today. Rated number 1 pizza in Vegas. Maybe the expection is too high. But, nothing impressive. Service is flat as well.

BeR8UYugj-OnB_PN5nV3Pg.text: Five stars!!!.. always amazing... food is by far so great... drinks and good .. lovehalf price wine Wednesday.... service is ok.... at times could be better but the pizza is the winner in the review!!!! Bravo Tony!!!

UQsYz-O2_4JmatIhSJTRHA.text: Pricey (for pizza) but I am still giving 5 stars because of how good the food was. If you don't mind paying for quality, this is the best pizza you'll find in GVR

NBdmY8B3h9bBZSYhdpgpvQ.text: The 1st experience here was on a busy Saturday a few weeks back.  Hostess said 35 minute wait for main area, but only 10 for the "air conditioned" indoor "patio area."  They conditioned the air... to a cool 93 degrees. Yeah after our food was on the way, the server said it was broken. Would've been nice to know! Why would the hostess team not know? Hmmm, maybe they didn't care. Either way...management failure.   Then we tried last Tuesday during what could only be described as "leftist conservative/Christian-bashing trivia night!"  Maybe the management geniuses need to know they are offending at least 1 out of 2 patrons.  I wonder if as a Las Vegas native, I'll be telling every person I know about my experience?

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. Here is one of the less offensive &#34;fun&#34; trivia questions. At least the emcee was really loud and only 7 feet from us!  Kudos gang!

Q0Od7ATgiY-TFquAhcVfXA.text: Am I the only one who thinks this pizza is too spicy? The last time we ate there the pizza was spicy also. We decided gave it another chance and ordered the New Yorker to go. It was burnt on parts of the crust and there wasn't hardly any mozzarella and it was dry. If a patron wants spicy pizza there is always red pepper, why ruin it.

eCnINXTTXvJYElAfOpMTMw.text: Service - check Food - check Ambience - check Price -$$  Honey pancetta fries was delicious, spaghetti and meatballs was delicious, calamari was good too. The spinach calzone was ok, and the brown butter pancetta bacon pizza sounded better than it tasted although my daughter did like it. Overall it was a good dining experience and the food was definitely of high quality ingredients. A bit pricey but the portions are large. So order accordingly.

0WxQ4MkRak_mG4uxSd6fGw.text: New Yorker pizza.  Nothing more needs to be said. Look at the stars and look the above pizza name and order it. Its their award winning pizza and rightfully so!

Q5-TLFGseNtErW3MBEvsOw.text: Everything I've had here is amazing from the pizzas, appetizers, to the Italian food.  One of the best restaurants in vegas

_huV-ykATx21UYw3ZCz0ig.text: I didn't even eat here...went because my yoga group had a gathering after class and when I checked the menu there's no option for vegan cheese and what's pizza without cheese??? Times are changing and there are a lot of folks that are vegan or are lactose intolerant and this place just doesn't cater to that group. I decided to hit the Mexican place called Borracha instead because they had a full section of vegan options on their menu and it was delicious!!!

FCfh_tfUrlD0N3LWQ_pZhg.text: Amazing wine selection, calamari, and the boss pizza. I came with family on Tuesday where they were finishing trivia night with sports on. Then music after was spot on, classic hip hop but edited versions. Our table was clean, great menu representations in a vinyl record album format. The wine was great. We started with calamari, half mild half spicy with two dipping sauces it was fresh and crunchy. The pizza was a lot for 4 but great for 5-6 people with 12 square slices of pepperoni, bell peppers, mushrooms, and grape tomato sliced halves. It was one of the freshest right out from the pizza fire oven, crispy, doughy, airy and perfect balance of flavors and not salty or cheesy. It was a great find that night!

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States

wr3G3N_yBFSGZceWgCPJdw.text: The food and service were fairly good.  I won't be giving it a second chance though. I am very allergic to cow milk, and asked if I could exchange fresh mozzarella with goat cheese in a salad (one of the few items I could eat without burdening the kitchen). They did, but they charged me $2 extra- for an allergy. Plus I was served maybe an ounce of cheese, which was hardly worth it for the up-charge. Lesson learned. Oh, and the waitress offered us the dessert menu (all dairy-based) and seemed annoyed when I declined.  This place is great if you have no allergies. They seem unable to work around simple substitutions without making you pay extra for it. Shame because my companion liked his Stromboli so I probably would have given it another go. Oh well.

aIm-Lp_WzcB9lZ-Cjb9HfA.text: The draw of Pizza Rock for me continues to be the wide selection of pizzas and beers. If you want to get away from your usual go-to pizzas and want to try something new, Pizza Rock is the best place to go. And for us, it's just a hop, skip, and a jump away. This is also a good place to play the beer pairing with the pizza game. If you find a winner, it makes your meal that much more enjoyable.  My wife and I came at the end of March looking to use our $15 monthly Station coupon before it expired. Beware, there is a $50 minimum to use the coupon, but oh well, I guess that meant more food to try. There was no wait for a table at 8:30 on a Wednesday night. We started with the beer battered artichokes ($9), my wife had her usual linguine and clams ($18) and I ordered the Old Chicago ($23).  The beer batter on our appetizer was light and didn't overwhelm the artichoke and the horseradish aioli provided a little bit of a kick. I thought the Chicago cracker thin pizza was great. The saltiness of the cheeses and meats was balanced by the sweetness of the ricotta on the pizza and the roasted, chocolaty flavor of my Deschutes Black Butte porter ($7). The only problem was that I ordered my beer when the pizza first arrived and didn't get it until I was stuffing my face with the third piece of pizza. Someone dropped the ball there because neither the bar nor the server were overly busy.  The consistently slow service on every visit that we've had is our only gripe. The pizza and beer will always have me coming back and Pizza Rock is quickly shooting up the leader board. We haven't been disappointed by any of the pies yet and there are still many more yet to try.

T3t3CsRbdKoJq4O5izN-GA.text: Ok I've been meaning to come here since my hair stylist suggested it. However we kinda already had our go to pizza place and really.. How amazing can it be?  Well. It can be freaking unicorn magical.   I Have this weird theory of trying the special or suggestions or everything when I go places new. It's like I'm afraid I'll never be back and if that is the case I need to experience it wholly.   I debated over appetizers then just asked our server her suggestion. Calamari. Hmm well that wasn't on my debated list, but if the lady says it's awesome, I'm going to try it. I like calamari, don't get me wrong, it's just taste to find GOOD calamari. But.. When in Rome... Or Henderson. Calamari it is.  Good choice. The sauces they give you are fantastic and you can get it spicy. Oh yes. You are speaking my language. Spicy it is. And this was probably in the top two if not the top squid I've ever had. I feel this will be a great meal.  They have a fantastic beer list too. I don't remember what I got but it was different and deliciously refreshing.   Pizza ordered. An all meat one which I can't remember the name, and the Guinness sausage pizza. I loved that Guinness pizza so much I would marry it. Yep. . It's freaking awesome. It's different enough to be interesting and delicious enough to not regret ordering it. (You know what I'm talking about... Pulled pork pancakes..epic mistake) the crust is freaking fabulous. I would eat just their crust if they made it. The pizza is high quality ingredients and I love their thorough explanation of the flour and temps for each type of pizza.   Honestly? I can't wait to go back. I'm sure you are wondering what the neck I'm doing with 4 stars instead of 5.. Well it's pretty expensive for pizza. I realize ingredients cost money do you are getting much better meats, cheeses, well everything compared to pizza hut, but our lunch was almost a hundred dollars and that wasn't much to go.   I do highly recommend it if you want to splurge. It's damn delicious and I might apply for a job just to get the perks.

eDUiZdRhO82yV5rJSrxwcQ.text: Great place to drink some quality beers and get a pizza. JoJo is the best bartender! She works harder than everyone else here so tip her!

U9Y6j-Vg9Kcw35_Xh7TNnw.text: Just eaten at the walk up/by the slice location inside Green Valley Casino.     Simply FAB pizza!!! Ordered the thin crust sooooo perfectly cooked! Nice crispy, not doughy bottom, g8 sauce, deeelish stringy cheese.     Can't wait to go to the actual restaurant also located inside Green Valley Casino, sit outside, enjoy one of Tony's Award Winning Pies with a glass of wine  Sounds like a G8 way to start the weekend

3Nt1_LOL1g6SfUEceFg16A.text: Very disappointed.  Possibly the worst pizza we've ever had.  Crust was so tough that we had to use a knife to get even a small bite.  First visit there and won't be returning.  Had a regular pepperoni $17.

CqCcI-CYNmidjxclChio3Q.text: I'm a fan of the downtown Pizza Rock but was let down by Tony's slice counter on site here at GVR. I finally gave the sit-down restaurant a try when friends set up a happy hour visit, and was pleasantly surprised. Note that there are some dishes that are only available at the downtown location (no salted dough burrata app here!) but the pizza menu seems to be the same.  HH is 3-6PM and then again after 10PM, featuring $5 and $7 personal pizzas (single-topping, Cal Italia, Pesto Paradise, and Tony Two Times), as well as a handful of apps. Our group tried just about everything offered and overall the quality was very good for the under-$20 average we paid and everyone left full.  The Tony Two Times pizza was my preference, loaded up with meats, while the Cal Italia I shared with Chris V had a huge crust-to-pie ratio that seemed inconsistent across the table and took away from the otherwise quite appealing sweet and savory flavor combo. The classic meatballs are always a hit (and at 3/$4, everyone can have their own order!), but the zucchini fries (with Calabrese ranch) and soppresata sliders (with tasty garlic fries but lackluster bread) were just okay.   Our server Paige was super sweet and more than accommodating for our large group with complicated orders, split checks, and last-minute additions (both to our orders and our party). She's a gem. Looking forward to coming back for the New Yorker pizza and the burrata burger!  TIP: As soon as you're seated, locate a bottle of Tony's Hot Pepper Oil. Dip your crust in it. Spicy deliciousness!

6ZPbGET3RmSIo0Hzzlhs4g.text: My boyfriend and I went for a late night meal after work. It was our first time, and it was quite busy with only one server one, felt bad for the guy, especially since there was no management on the floor helping him greet new tables or attend to current ones. I do commend our server for briefly advising that he be over shortly, that way the guest feels acknowledged. However, when ordering, our server didn't even ask us if we wanted the personal size pizza or regular....So when my boyfriend's pizza came out, it was entirely small. All we could think was $20 for this? We later found out ot was only $7, but my boyfriend received an extremely small pizza, in which in them had to take slices from my regular sized one, which kind of ruined our experience. Also, the personal pizza was almost 50% crust, so it wasn't very filling, especially for a 260lb man. It was a one-bite pizza. Loved the pizza crust though. The mud pie was delicious although the crust was a nuisance to get through.

2D1xNzYMDj6EGP_vL8xkLA.text: I'm almost certain that this would've been a full 5 stars with full-sized pizzas. Based on this visit, there's room for improvement. Pizza Rock has garnered rave reviews ever since its inception in Downtown Las Vegas four years ago, and I've slacked heavily on making a visit to the more convenient (for Henderson residents like me) and accessible (because Downtown parking sucks) location at Green Valley Ranch, which has been open since 2015. I don't even have a review of Pizza Rock because my only real visit was at a Yelp Elite Event last year (yelp.com/biz/yee-greed-a...). In short, this visit was way overdue. I met up with Yelp friends for aforementioned happy hour, which is 3-6pm and 10pm-close nightly. We did a 5:30pm visit, although I had to slip in a little late due to an unexpected work call. Huge shoutout to Christie L. and Stefany V. for looking out and ordering before 6:00 for me! I wish I'd properly located the Paseo Verde garage or at least the valet escalator, given that Pizza Rock is on that side of the casino, but I parked at the nearest edge of the District instead and took the movie theater entrance and escalator. I didn't even plumb the depths of the happy hour variety due to my rushed circumstances, but the Pizza Rock meatballs ($4 happy hour pricing, 3 pieces) are as fantastic as I'd recalled. Huge hunks of properly seasoned and moist ground meat with an unparalleled tomato sauce were delicious hot and even remained enjoyable at room temp. I also sampled the Zucchini Fries ($5 HH), which are pretty good and come with an addictive Calabrese ranch sauce. A photo of the full portion leaves a bit to be desired though, even at happy hour. Also, I wish that I'd checked my review which I'd linked above and ordered the fried green beans, another happy hour app, but I suppose that can wait until next time. Personal size pizzas are $7 at happy hour, and I managed to have at least a slice of each. The award-winning Cal Italia was the most impressive, with prosciutto, sweet fig preserve, and balsamic reduction standing out above a bed of cheeses. The Tony 2 Times was quite a good meat lover's pie, but didn't have the variety of cheeses and accompaniments that their standard menu New Yorker does. The Pesto Paradise was a simple but very effective vegetarian option. My issue with these happy hour specialties was the uncomfortably high crust-to-middle ratio, especially on the Cal Italia. Imagine a full-size pizza and visualize shrinking the diameter of the topping-filled area to something more like 6 inches while keeping the same width of crust. It's inevitably disappointing, even if the crust is as fantastically crispy as theirs. The serendipitous consolation was that I had makeshift breadsticks for the leftover meatball sauce, but you simply don't buy pizza just for just the dough. I didn't get any dessert myself, but I tasted a bite of the Mud Pie ($9) of a generous visiting elite from New York named Tom. This dessert is gargantuan and might be enough for even three of me to share. The Oreo cookie crust is a bit tough to break even with metal spoons but crunches awesomely, and the coffee and vanilla ice creams along with the fudge and caramel sauces make this a rich craving-satisfier type of dessert. The restaurant was crowded, but it wasn't too loud for standard conversational volume even with TVs showing Monday Night Football and playoff baseball. I also appreciated the server's willingness to split checks item-by-item. No observation from me on the speed of service because I kinda fast-forwarded through that. I'm glad that I finally got the opportunity to review a Pizza Rock. Now it's just a matter of making sure that I visit more than once a year and using those opportunities to try their real pizzas. Anyone here wanna join me?

xppRrTiQpYd9ihYrHcx3Ng.text: Based solely off of the food, this place is a 5 but because of slightly slow service on a slow night, a disappointing cocktail, and high prices, this place gets a 4 which is still really good and definitely deserving of a visit from everyone.  We went here for my friend's birthday and were glad we did!  The four of us each got a cocktail, all of which were a bit disappointing to be honest, three appetizers, all fantastic, and a pizza, also fantastic.  They also surprised us with a free dessert for my friend's birthday!    For our appetizers we got the rosemary garlic fries (great), the calamari (half spicy, half regular) (fantastic, also, the yellow spicy sauce was out of this world), and the coccoli which is fried bread with burrata cheese and prosciutto (great).  For dinner we got the Giant Sicilian Fratellanza which came on focaccia and was topped with tomato sauce, mozzarella, oregano, mushrooms, Italian sausage, pepperoni, and genoa salami (fantastic).  They then surprised us with a free dessert which some of my party liked and some didn't.  It was lady fingers with some thick cream and other stuff.  Not sure what it was entirely but I enjoyed it nonetheless.  The restaurant is quite appealing to the eyes yet it is quite loud and quite expensive which area bit of a turn off.  I always say I will pay for good food but this was pushing the boundaries a little bit.  That being said, it was so good I will definitely be back.  We also had to wait quite a while for the check but it was fine as we were all having a good time chatting.

54JJb0BOqCLaQf7HYtxoSw.text: Kat & Cat are the best!  Today I tried a few apps instead of pizza.  The Fried Green Tomatoes are always fantastic so that was a definite!  I also ordered this delish Honey Sausage app, added a bit of red pepper flakes & viola!  Mmm! 7NLLb-ta_ZFr638NL5DTQA.text: Wow! The margherita is amazing.  I can eat an entire pizza to myself.   The atmosphere is great with djs and cool videos.   This is my go to for pizza spots in vegas.

aS73TfIlY6_lVV4K8xe9Vw.text: I honestly would have never tried Pizza Rock if not for circumstance. We found ourselves wandering around Green Valley Ranch on Thanksgiving looking for a place to eat. Pizza Rock had no wait at all so that's how it was chosen.   We were soon greeted by our server. "First time in?" He asked. I nodded. "Great! Welcome in!" he said. I was expecting him to tell us about the menu, recommend items, something along those lines, but he didn't. He left us to review the menu.  There were a lot of different menu items.   We finally settled on two dishes to share, the garden salad and the tomato pie.   The garden salad came out and the portion size was rather disappointing. There wasn't much to it, fresh greens, cherry tomatoes, onions, mozzarella cheese, tossed in a balsamic vinaigrette. The salad itself was fresh and flavorful, it was the portion that was underwhelming despite having ordered the sharing size.   The tomato pie came out shortly after and was full of flavor. The tomato pie consisted of Sliced Mozzarella, Tomato Sauce, Garlic, Fresh Basil, extra virgin olive oil and romano. The pizza was perfect, not overly greasy, crispy at the crust. The basil and the garlic complimented each other well.   For what it was, it was a bit pricey in my opinion. The salad came in at $11 and the tomato pie came in at $21. The portions were barely enough to feed two people. The good news was we left with room for dessert.   I can add this to the list of places I've tried though I don't think I would go back.

ZsO0DHIO46ctF1TszKunBg.text: We have been here several times and usually order the New Yorker. I decided to try the margherita for a change. Huge mistake!  I was so disappointed. The crust was almost nonexistent on the bottom. It should have been labeled as a sauce only pizza. There was very little cheese and maybe 3 small pieces of basil.   My husband ordered the Italian Trio Sub which looked delicious but was tasteless. With all the ingredients you'd have thought it would be flavorful. Needless to say, we left hungry and most likely will not be returning.   The noise level is also annoying as it is very loud. It seems all the tables are in direct line with every speaker.

QV-osixjZNRufx45u4KsoQ.text: This place is the best!  Pizza, and we've had several, are the best. Ingredients are quality. Probably the best meatballs you can buy in Vegas. Service is always spot on and the Happy Hour menu is very good.

0mWXRQkIs8Ll1L2WHi3wbg.text: Came here with a large group for dinner. Big restaurant located inside of Green Valley Ranch. Cool menus with vinyl records inside the pages.   I had the Freaky Tiki drink. It was very good and not too sweet. We ordered pizzas for the table and I was able to sample the Old Chicago which was sausage, meatballs, and ricotta dollops on a cracker thin crust. Really good pizza and loaded with toppings. Also had a slice of the River City Ranch which had chicken, bacon, tomatoes, scallions and ranch drizzled on it. This pizza was also really good and loaded with toppings and of course who doesn't love ranch?   We also ordered the meatball sub. Pizza Rock has really good meatballs and on past visits I have ordered the meatball appetizer for a meal. The sandwich was served with rosemary garlic fries which were so delish! I think I found a new craving. Crispy fries tossed with rosemary and fresh garlic bits.   Really good food, great service, and a laid back casual atmosphere. I'll be back. I see myself craving those rosemary fries probably on a weekly basis.

bUGTx3-OtdpNFKba2B5zDA.text: I have heard about their pie and was looking forward to trying it at their downtown location. When plans fell through, I was bummed until I found there is one at GVR. Mostaccioli was the first thing that caught my eye. I love mostaccioli since my teenage years when I dated an Chicago Italian. It was good but the mostaccioli pasta was a bit larger in diameter  and was even elbow in some cases. I enjoyed it, but was no where near Grandma Onofrio's  Now, the purpose of the visit- the Pie! When was a small wee child in Las Vegas, there was the pizzeria located on East Charleston near Bruce named the Pizza Palace. This was so incredible, that all pies, from here on out, will be judged by this high bar.  This is place can do pies New York, Chicago, Detroit whatever. I have been here twice and I have ordered The New Yorker. Sliced mozzarella, tomato sauce, sliced house link sausage, garlic, pepperoni, ricotta. RICOTTA!!! OMG the Ricotta. So rich. you may want to ask your server to go easy on the Ricotta, but damn! Before you leave this Earth.....try the New Yorker.  The place is raucous. I took my mother here. Great pie, not sure if it is great for my 75 year old mom. She is not dowdy, she has been to 10 Rush concerts, but still, the noise level is a little below yelling level. IF you want a good pie and a great atmosphere to people watch go here. If you want a good pie, but a little more low key, this is not it.

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. The New York pie

TvoJijNEQA4G48ercOjNvw.text: Pros: Good beer, sometimes rare beers. Lots of different kinds of pizza, and something for everyone.  Cons: Price. It is stupid expensive for what you get. I'm not sure if I can get totally behind the atmosphere, it seems a little too "Guy Fiere (Fieri? Fierie?)" for me, but I get what they are going for.  I'm not familiar with the chef that started this but apparently he won some sort of cooking show. Honestly, I came here for the beer selection when we first moved to the area, as it is close, has a good local tap selection, good rotating list of beers, and the servers (so far) have actually been able to describe a beer without saying "It's kind of like a Blue Moon." Why does everyone say that when they don't know how to describe a beer? I digress...I think I was most impressed when they had bottles of KBS and weren't charging $12 a piece like they would in the MidWest. I have to say, the pizza is pretty good too, a little heavy on the olive oil but that's just a minor complaint. Three stars just for the beer selection, give 'em one star for the food and overall it's wort a visit.

4fuLPSKAkFp_UouTLgXl8w.text: Made a reservation, and we were seated with a quickness.  This places is located IN Green Valley Ranch casino.    There was a good amount of people here for dinner, but it wasn't ridiculously packed.  Loud atmosphere.  I felt like I had to use my outside voice, but I didn't care because that's my normal voice anyway.    There were TVs everywhere airing sports when we first arrived at 6pm.  Then later in the night they were playing music videos.  Since this place is called "Pizza Rock," I thought they would play rock music, but they were playing a variety of music instead (which is awesome).  They played everything from pop 60s - today, hip hop, and R&B.  Fun to listen to and watch on screen.    On to the food:appetizers were meatballs, gorgonzola fries, and clams in wine and butter sauce.   The meatballs come in (I think) 6 big pieces in marinara sauce.  They're big enough to share 1 with another person.  Marina sauce was good.    Gorgonzola fries: parmesan cheese, blue cheese, and garlic.  I love how there were chunks of blue cheese on these fries!  Super addicting...I ate this with a quickness.    Pizza: I like how they have every variety of pizza from deep dish to thin crust.  I got the Michigan, which is a thin crust pizza with pepperoni.  I thought it was a little bit on the salty side, but not too bad.  Came in this huge portion shareable for 6 people.    This is a great place for groups.  Just make sure you make a reservation.

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. Gorgonzola fries
Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. Clams

KYGnh0XhxRdgQEOeiHLSCg.text: Pizza, location and service are great! Happy hour is really awesome too - get the meat balls and rosemary garlic fries. Every time I have been I've been seated quickly and food comes fast.

rYHArchgrTJX0jbE9cUYbQ.text: Best Pizza I have ever had anywhere!!!  We tried the New Yorker Pizza, it was seriously the best Pizza I have ever had. The Ricotta Cheese really added something and the Sauce was great. Also, by having the Pizza cooked in a very hot oven made the Crust crispy and not doughy. The atmosphere is also fun and a great place to watch a game.

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. The New Yorker!  The Best Pizza Ever!!!

VCBLoCZaeq1vz3OejXoVpQ.text: Jesse & Andrew are rockstar bartenders. They are hands down the reason we come to enjoy our pizza and beer. These guys attention to detail to our preferences to beer and food. They also know a lot of things about their different beers and I love that. Anyways, please go check out pizza rock in green valley ranch casino, these guys rock! Now, I know why they work at pizza rock! Awesome place, awesome guys can't say it enough.   Cheers,  Christian and Chelsea

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States

8EvDzwfamtHcMGCPk52lQQ.text: THE best Pizza in Vegas!  "Detroit Red Top". Thanks Nick for the great service.  Once you taste this bad boy you won't want to try anything else.

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. Detroit Red Top

ERnL-gRTUcYhWaAylv5SWQ.text: Amazing! Amazing!! We had the Margarita and the New Yorker.  Both amazing!  Be warned the margarita is cooked in a wood oven so "charred" around the edges is definitely there!  Our server was Jesse, he was so friendly and so helpful. He checked in a perfect amount of times, kept our drinks full and gave us honest reviews of the pizza and came back to check just what we thought of the pizza and his reviews!  The atmosphere is loud, there's a dj. It's Friday night so it's pretty busy, each table although it's loud it feels intimate it's my family and I don't feel like my kids are bother the booth right next to ours!  Definitely recommend coming here!!

hqNdNu094y8cXmaObJdl9A.text: Food: We ordered the meatballs to start, which were saucy and delicious. Then got the cali Italia which is fantastic! The fig preserve is tasty and compliments the pizza well.  Service: service was good overall. We sat at the bar and it was pretty busy but the bartender was still very friendly and attentive. Only lag on service was at the very beginning when we sat down, it took awhile to be greeted and many people walked by us.  Atmosphere: a little loud for my preference but the DJ was good and played some good hits.

aILtwLUw_dKmISZ7VOn2Uw.text: Delicious pizza! I had always heard of pizza rock but was weary to try because places with a lot of talk can tend to be overrated. But not pizza rock! The pizza was actually delicious. Had the veggie pizza and it was amazing! Best pizza I've had in Vegas

a98KUKUnow7IAwwSByaPAw.text: Hang out with friends for happy hours go for pizza with spicy pomegranate margaritas is yummy..have a good time on my days off !!!

3-zWZu9PCtM-SfDbwl8hdA.text: Walked in, they took us right away on New Year's Eve. They were busy but I'm glad we came here. Server was really down to earth.. we got the Chicago style pizza "Michigan ave" added some onions on. Perfect size for two people 16". We also ordered the very garlic garlic bread. Both was bomb! So much flavor... definitely was delicious. We also bought some drinks. We also love the truck scene since my husband drives a truck. Loved how they had a DJ inside the cab. Great place!!!

bgD3cXl4PcIdwlhEfBpfQw.text: Kat was a wonderful bartender that made us feel very welcomed , being new in town. We have had the Margerhita, Cal Italia , Mob Boss and New Yorker so far! All delicious. Friendly, fun atmosphere!

s2Ssm2FfexweRufyhXj0qA.text: I am a frequent customer at Pizza Rock and my order rarely deviates, quail egg pizza no meat and add caramelized onions and roasted garlic. Simple! Nope! It seems to be a 50/50 chance...take a gamble. Today's experience ...inattentive server (Eric) . Pizza came with no onions or garlic....Round two pizza came with no garlic. Once I complained about the first pizza not having what I asked for Eric's service went from bad to worse. No one came around to check on the second pizza so I sat there with a pizza I didn't want and then got charged $41.00 for crappy food and bad service. Way to go Pizza Rock! Another disappointing experience....clearly you are not concerned about your customers, especially the locals that frequent your establishment often.

tu9lcq1zAwPxilaNXsPFxw.text: Oh MY GOD. I loveeeeee this pizza! This is one of the best pizza places that I've tried and I've had enough pizza in my life to feed all of Italy. I've been dreaming of this pizza since I left. The waiter brought me a new list of beers since the last one didn't have a good selection of IPA's. I forget the name but it was great with the pizza. We used all the parmesan cheese (sorry guys) but it made the pizza taste even better! Not that it needed it but my taste buds screamed MORE CHEESE at the moment. We're definitely going back, but in the meantime, ill be counting pepperoni in my sleep.

7_mhgX6DX3nfSkeBe1G93Q.text: New favorite pizza right here!  Delicious and fresh is an understatement.  Awesome atmosphere and Rob took great care of us!  5 stars for sure

X1pdS1ltNtw1XIb9FZONeA.text: Don't look any further. Go to Pizza Rock. Get the Godfather. Eat it all, go home. You're welcome!

xsHPPKlvkC5ri8ZLrUfiIg.text: Terrible service waited nearly an hour and a half to get a pizza. Would've been happier with a 5$ hot and ready and I hate Little Caesar's

-Lb2Ht3U3gmGpVVya1avNQ.text: As locals we went to Pizza Rock here at GVR. We had been to the one downtown Fremont before and loved it. This time however the food was just not food. The crust was soggy yet tasted burnt and the salad was dry and has very little dressing on it. The service was good which is why they get 3 stars. The restaurant and atmosphere is nice. But the margarita pizza was just not good. I was hoping this would become a go to for us since we live close by.

IN5J5uIzBPLXF4BVWBfUrw.text: Owned by the same famous Tony's pizza in San Francisco pizza rock delivers the same variety of pizzas on a vast menu however in Vegas the restaurant is a more casual atmosphere in both locations. I love the fact that their menu offers so many different types of pizza to suit any pizza lovers dream. My only experience at GVR has been sitting at the bar to eat. The bartenders are very friendly, excellent at making drinks, and deliver prompt service. My only complaint is it was loud on both occasions I visited. One particular night they had a trivia night that made it difficult to converse with friends I haven't seen in a while. Instead of using only a portion of the restaurant for trivia night the host was on the microphone blasting the entire restaurant regardless of who was or was not participating. I recommend they section off a Portion of the restaurant for those who want to engage in trivia.

3BsQUs4iWUlV7Lm2ZguisA.text: I have been hearing good things about Pizza Rock so I was excited when I heard they had opened at GVR since it's close to home. We ventured over a couple hours before the 4th of July fireworks. There was a decent wait for a table which was to be expected, but the bar had two spots right away. Dining at the bar was enjoyable, seats were spaced enough that it didn't feel cramped and the bartenders gave us great service.  I had the pomegranate serrano margarita which was mostly hot and just a little sweet. If you like serious heat then this drink is for you. For an appetizer my husband I shared the fried tomato caprese salad. The idea of frying the tomatoes made it a little unique and the cheese tasted really fresh. All of the flavors went well together. For our meal we shared the St. Anthony pizza which was both unique and delicious. It had large slices of sausage, the right amount of egg and the perfect amount of ricotta. We loved the combination. I didn't even have room for dessert which may be a first.

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. St. Anthony pizza
Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. Fried tomato caprese salad

AjWGQA5ue1-TQyHf3DG2Dg.text: Veronica was an AMAZING hostess who helped us understand the vast menu. The drinks, pizza, and appetizers really were above the mark. I'd recommend the El Hefe beer (subtle jalapeno taste without the heat)  Would come again!

FqrmfFTIh9rO-AG_VIODPQ.text: We took the suggestions of our waiter, Tony. The Meatball & Ricotta, and the Balsamic Prosciutto. Both were over the top delicious. Tony was an amazing waiter, he took great care of us, has a fun personality, and made us feel like we were his only customers.  Be sure to ask for one of his tables.

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. Our camera shy Hostesses, Cloe and Anna!
Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. Thanksgiving at Pizza Rock, with our waiter, Tony!

GYhCH6Obqf2nISATdL_xHQ.text: Awesome happy hour! My server Paige recommended the Tiki drink.  The personal pizza was just enough for one and only $7! I'm definitely coming back here!! Thanks Paige!

j1CL8dR3jkBFUFUhxFslUA.text: Happy Hour here is fantastic!!! Everytime I come here, I always get the personal pizza and I always sit out on the patio. I like trying different alcoholic drinks here as well. This location is better than the one in Downtown Las Vegas because we first discovered Pizza Rock there and we were told that there was going to be an hour-long wait without reservations. This Pizza Rock location is the best and is highly recommended!

Hz2QhqSrhuGbt6aEk9eITQ.text: Delicious pizza, amazing beer selection, and exemplary service! Who could ask for more?  My husband and I have had date night at Pizza Rock a few times and have left impressed every single time. Everything we've tried on the menu has been top notch. We especially love the Mob Boss and always recommend this to others. Be prepared for left overs if you're not with a group. They have an extensive menu and if you're lucky enough to get Brandt as your server, you're sure to have an excellent time.

-8UxfzBBgSF8iXU0rGdHsg.text: This was a total sleeper hit! We stopped by here as a late night pizza spot. Conveniently, when we walked in it was late night happy hour! We ordered zucchini fries, the meatballs, and 2 personal pizzas- the two times Tony's and Pesto Paradise. The zucchini fries were crispy and savory but the dipping sauce that came with them is what sold me. It was hot and creamy, kinda like a sriracha mayo. SO GOOD! Definitely gave Carl's Jr.'s zucchini fries a run for their money! And they were like $5! The meatballs were bomb. The sauce was so thick it just sat wherever you dropped it. Loved it! Those were seriously like $3 for 3 meatballs. It was stupid cheap. The personal pizzas were $7. I only tried the Pesto Paradise but it was so good! It was think crust with cherry tomatoes, pesto, garlic and cheese. It totally hit the spot. We only ate like half our pizzas and then brought the rest home. Tons of food for a great price.   PRO TIP- if you go to Green Valley Ranch casino from the shopping mall side you can get here pretty easily without having to walk through the entire casino if you hate smelling like cigarettes (like me!)

DXm7jix8GnlpCWoO-gYKRQ.text: Best pizza in LV!!  Pepperoni, gorgonzola fries, meatballs, Arugula  salad. Everything is great.   You will love their drink menu and pizza selection. Quality ingredients.   Enjoy!!!

3tDdSdurBa3Cm9dEHS_cjw.text: Never coming bacl me and my family left with very heavy hearts with the biggest pizza disappointment of any Pizzarea. We all prefered dominos and thats actually our most hated pizza fast food spot so when the worst fast food pizza chain has better pizza then you we got problems. We got a classic peperoni sicilian fucking bad man tomatoe sauce was like candy very sweet like i was eating sugar on a loaf of bread they sure it wasnt chicago thick crust on that? the peperoni not edible not sure what they get for it but i could taste nothing from it they were crisp yes thats good but nontaste i tasted nothing. The cheese was bland as well.   fucking disgrace.   Now the Chicago thin crust they gave us there was no taste of sauce what so ever like really? nothing cheese was oily and just fucked man It tasted tainted and wierd man. The sausage on it tasteless the crust was a disgrace the corn meal on the crust was the only tastey thing. I dont know how they been open for so long but might be the beer if your drunk or hungry you may eat here. the service was nice the decor nice food fucking wretched.  Not coming back

5QdMg9cDkopiYRM_DX9_4Q.text: We had just arrived in Las Vegas after twenty hours of traveling from Thailand and wanted some food and fast. We just made it to Pizza Rock before happy hour ended. We ordered four pizzas (all the Tony one) and some cocktails. My margarita(s) were great as was the pizza but the overall experience was improved by our server, Brandt, whose energy and efficiency made our Welcome to Town that much better. Thanks, Brandt!

CmQjBzjAddta8lu_HPHMIw.text: I usually go to the one downtown because when family and friends visit they insist on it. So now I'm back in green valley where I used to live and at pizza rock for a child's birthday today. The food is good and service even when busy is good. I know it has Rock in the name but the music is over the top loud to the point you cannot talk someone at your table. The music choices also a lot of heavy alternate rock with long, long, long heavy drum base to the point is annoying. Other then that is ok.

X60mHX5AZpyQs6IFHy7WGw.text: I went to pizza rock this past weekend. This is my fourth time coming bc i love the food here ! Just a little disappointed Bc the service wasn't that great but they were very busy. I always order the meatballs and French fries. The meatball had a hair in it and the fries came out warm not hot.  I'm giving it 4 stars bc my other experiences here have been great. We also ordered the pizza which was phenomenal and piping hot.

NGksMq5g7mTyR3dYsmMAJA.text: I really enjoyed eating here on a Sunday with my family!  It was really busy yet they still managed to assist us in a quick fashion and the food came out fast, ready, and HOT!  There were 9 of us and we ordered 3 pizzas and two calamaris. That definitely hit the spot and fed all of us til we couldn't eat anymore!   You should come out and try it if you're a pizza lover.

Pzhw7_w9NUX4Tni8kwpKEA.text: Pizza was pretty good /ok but we only had the personal pizza lunch and I'm sure we will be back to try more. Our server was very friendly and attentive wish I could remember her name! I felt only slightly uncomfortable about the giant butcher blade looking fan spinning overhead on the ceiling right above our table. I'm into feng shui though, most people wouldn't be as bothered by this I imagine..still an odd choice although I see it's meant to give the place an edge ;)

jRDfBRrrhwZOz0yNCrUUZA.text: Went with my children to dinner after day at the pool for dinner. We were sat in the back area and it took over 20 minutes to have a waitress greet us. While we were waiting to be greeted I decided to order our dinner at once over concerns about their service. We ordered two pizzas and a gluten free pizza for my daughter in which took over 35 minutes for it to be served and they had our order incorrect. They never brought our gluten free pizza and the other two pizzas were burnt and not eatable. I would not recommend this place to anyone. After an hour of bad service and burnt pizzas we weren't able to enjoy our dinner and had to go elsewhere to eat. Waste of time and money!!

e5m3gTxutK5irFwM0I9FKw.text: Our family is obsessed with pizza rock. Cal italia all the way! I wish the gluten free crust was a little fluffier and the music wasn't so loud during happy hour (I love music but I can't hear the person next to me) but everything on the menu is good! Tried the green beans, fries, all of the salads, several pizzas, MEATBALLS, all great!

MXC00dfXM5yPtCKUt8Jp_Q.text: I have eaten at Pizza Rock several times the food is generally very good my experience today was with their lasagna. It was completely bland it is described on the menu as having beef and sausage it had a few pieces of sausage didn't find any beef. The tomato sauce was fresh out of the can and cold anywhere it didn't touch the hot lasagna. Oh and the Cesar salad that started the meal had no dressing when they bought it out and someone thinks a cesar is a chop salad. The manager apologized and took the lasagna off my bill. I will go back again but I will stick with the pizzas.

WRoOA_xYenT1PwlIxxcFag.text: This our definitely our go-to restaurant for when we have a pizza craving. It's unbelievable the Amount of options they have to choose from! Highly recommend

GJeBz-FLHx0zDnupBEPqVA.text: Tons of tables open and yet we had to wait 20minutes -because they couldn't figure out how to bus them -let me help you so my 4 year old can sit down and eat instead of having to constantly drag him away from the slot machines

iU-Vl2_VZrOn6IBX-JirCA.text: Best Calamari Ever!!! Especially the spicy sauce!Happy hour is the best...drinks, meats balls, pizza, must have!!

CoMgQbQOqWBN4HIuoxwh6A.text: Being born and raised in the Chicagoland area, I KNOW great pizza!  I am always skeptical when I'm in a different state and a local says "you have to check out an amazing pizza place" and 9 times out of 10, I wind up disappointed. Well, hats off to PIZZA ROCK!! I had the Cal Italia, which consists of Asiago, Gorgonzola, Mozzarella, Fig Preserve, Prosciutto di Parma, Parmigiano-Reggiano and Balsamic Reduction. OMG!!!! It's safe to say that when I return in July, this WILL be a stop on my list!!! WTG Pizza Rock! Keep up the excellent work!
