6YfvMwlATES720NLb-w5NQ.text: Location: Inside the Green Valley Ranch Casino Ambiance: lively, noisy, and casual Interiors: upscale and contemporary from lighting                   to seating Food: *glasses of Chardonnay and Rose            *Truffle fries tasted more like fried from               truffle oil and not grated truffle              (it'd be pricey but I'll still order it)            *Pancetta and Arugula salad            *Americana Pizza (supreme pizza)            FRESH INGREDIENTS!!! Good food!  Service: Good   CONS: the wait to serve our food and wine took              forever             And for this reason I gave this place 4 stars              Yes, I'll be back to explore the rest of the menu!

q7ulSWcXz3-VkAAIb3Nydg.text: Went to PR last night. It was packed but we got two seats at the bar. Blonde Kat served up many frosty beers. What a nice lady. And so attentive. We watched the Knights game and enjoyed Chicago cracker thin pizza. Such a fun night

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. Chicago thin crust pizza. So good with beer.
Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. Blonde Kat giving us Morning Joe realness.

3xa_8cYnlOEcCnfuBzCClw.text: I've finally gotten the chance to eat here and while their pizza is more expensive, they have a lot of variety and the quality of their toppings is higher than your local delivery store.  Our service was great, as our waitress took the time to explain all the pizzas on the menu as well as make some recommendations. Water was kept full constantly, though we didn't have enough setups, which are stored in little pails on the table. We just grabbed some, which is probably what happened to ours.  We started with the house salad which had cherry tomatoes, mixed greens, mozzarella, and a few other items all tossed in a cherry vinaigrette. It was quite tasty, but "family" portion was a little smaller than I would hope for. It's probably good for 2-3 people, but a little meager for 4, depending on how much salad you actually want.  The pizza we tried was called the Mob Boss, a Sicilian with pretty much every topping you might think of on a normal pizza. Olives, onions, peppers, meats galore, and more. At 32 dollars, it's not a cheap pizza, but it was enough to feed four of us easily. The focaccia-style crust is light but thick and puffy. I really enjoy focaccia personally, though I can see others not loving it. It's served in a sheet pan and I highly recommend it to those who like pan or deep dish pizzas. I ate 3.5 slices, which left me very full (probably over ate), and I enjoyed every bite.  Honestly, the only pizza that they don't have that I can think of is a thick Chicago-style deep dish with sauce on top. Giordano's is probably the best option in town for that one.  They have a very interesting happy hour menu, which we will likely come back for that includes $7 personal pizzas that actually have a good number of toppings and such.

AXl5vXU7RYo8rTMk-4TqfA.text: I first tried pizza rock and they served adelicious fried zuchinni but served it with a  dipping sauce  I didn't care for.  I asked for some ranch instead.  The waitress then charged me .50 cents for a small ranch.  So stupid what a way to not get a good tip.  Then the other day I thought I would try again since they advertise that on Wed. Seniors get 15% off.  When Gino our waiter brought us the bill I said that he didn't apply the discount he said that they don't give it on appitizers.  I said that the sign at the hostess station clearly states 15% off for seniors on  Wed. and nothing stipulating what was included or not.  Well he really gave me a mouth full of rude reasons why .  I asked him to simply go and read the sign at the hostess station, but he did not budge.  It would be so refreshing if the manager or owner of this place could teach the employees some Customer Service.  Very lacking.  We will never be returning.

WwaGq7P1h_66PGYPRbGBSg.text: Good pizza and customer service. Only thing is don't sit by the back door because you might be wearing your food when somebody opens that door.

5aqzvQbcyXSBrw1q7iIcuQ.text: Ordered the New Yorker pizza. Chose this one because it sounded good and because it has won awards. I can definitely see why. I'm not usually a person who likes a lot of sauce on my pizza. It always seems to take away from the cheese. But this sauce was sweet and so fresh tasting. It went perfectly with the cheeses on the pizza. There were little dollops of ricotta and every bite that had ricotta mixed with the sauce tasted like a little bite of lasagna heaven. The crust was crunchy but soft. Perfect amount of meat on top. Delicious pizza.

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. New Yorker Pizza

C_UF0AyFk8Ir4hTstF6kag.text: The pizza used to be much better, but that's not the reason for 1 star.   The reason for 1 star is the customer service. It has taken a huge dump recently and I won't be going back. Anyone can look right here on Yelp and see that whatever change was made recently has led to A LOT of 1 star reviews, many from locals who have eaten there many times.  Pizza Rock needs to fire or undo whatever change was made, and make it right with the people who have been screwed over from terrible customer service lately.  If you screw something up at a restaurant, make it right. I ordered last night and it was wrong. It would have been a simple fix, but they just refused. I was basically flabbergasted. I've never had a restaurant just refuse to make something right, especially when it was so, so simple to fix.  Sorry, but if you're paying $28 for a stupid pizza, it had better darn-well be correct.  Stop acting like a bunch of prima-donnas...you guys make pizza for a living, you're not saving the world.

WY_2asv_tyZCZrpNPO575Q.text: Favorite pizza in Las Vegas! It's a super cool restaurant and you have all the other fun things to do in GVR. I try and come here often.

jlTkKY9vH7dHbfMzxLGYlw.text: So this review is for the happy hour. Not sure how much of a difference there is between happy hour and the regular menu. But I just wanted to be clear that we went during the late night happy hour.  When we got here it was relatively slow. About two more tables besides ourselves and about three people at the bar. Out of all the places inside Greenvalley this has to be the best choice for late night happy hour.  I started off with the zucchini sticks for five dollars. Not a bad price for the amount of zucchini that you get. Typical breaded and fried but these had a nice fresh crisp flavor. Well worth the five dollars. I gave this a solid 5/5.  Next up was the pizza. I got the Tony two times. For seven dollars this is absolutely the best way to go. Personal size pizza with pepperoni mushrooms and twice the sausage. They have a couple of other choices for seven dollars which you can't beat.  Overall a pretty decent happy hour menu. You'll be sure to find something for everyone. Drink specials are pretty decent. The happy hour menu ranges from four dollars to about seven dollars.

m1jWJTkABVC2zZpLyrJMEQ.text: This is for our last visit last weekend... sat at bar... one bartender for Friday happy hour... ordered the meatballs and French fries on happy hour menu which taste great. We both ordered personal pizzas... my partners came out fine but the bartender put the wrong pizza in for me so I had to wait for my correct pizza to be made while I sat and watched my husband eat his... he didn't like his at all... some spicy pizza with Serrano's on it... way to spicy. Mine finally arrived after my hubby had already finished. I did get an apology from the bartender but no offer for a discount on my pizza or free soda...  We just need to stick with the pizza we like... New Yorker.  Is it just me or are more restaurants not offering their patrons anything for bad food or service or mistakes?I'm not looking for freebies but I can spend my money anywhere and when I pick your place I expect my order and food to be what I paid for and to taste good.  We do like Pizza Rock and will return and won't let one error ruin enjoying their food in the future...

kDWrfoU3wb4BXmoo23bJSA.text: Huge disappointment.  We were excited to sample the pie here after perusing the menu and seeing all the awards.  Ha.  We ordered the New Haven Tomato Pie.  Having once lived in NH, it looked like a great choice.  Wrong.  You could not pawn this off as Tomato Pie in NH unless you served free beer.  Not only that but, you served us cold pizza, twice.  We sent the pie back after one bite as the sauce was room temp at best.  The second pie was delivered with a warning, "careful, this is hot".  The waitress was right, the pan was hot, the sauce was room temp.  Why do you advertise pizza cooked in a 700 degree oven if you are going to serve it cold.  Must be a disconnect between the kitchen and wait staff.  Which brings me to my last point.  The service is slow and this was Tuesday night.  If you want a pizza slice at Green Valley, head to Tony's Slice house in the the food court.

uL64r5YgOJHWW0fM0UibNA.text: Yum yum yum!!!!  I didn't expect the food and beer to be so good since it's inside of a casino. I was pleasantly surprised. My fruit cobbler sour was soooo good - but kinda pricey. My little personal pizza was so delicious and filling. I will definitely come back. And the ladies at the bar was awesome!

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. Meat and more meat pizza
Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. Pesto pizza
Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. Fruit cobbler beer, meatballs and strawberry frosted pastry beer

mX8bnsFXFwy0FQsYGen3jw.text: I love Napoletana pizza! I've acquired the taste at several Napoletana Pizzerias throughout the country. I was so excited when I saw that Pizza Rock made True Napoletana pizza. They had soppressata on the menu I was sold! However, once we got there - completely different story. If you're looking for a good Napoletana pizza before 5:00pm, forget it.  If you want to make a substitution, forget it. Pizza is a very personal taste, that's why usually you can order varying items on your pizza, to make it yours. Not here. It's a "craft" and apparently they know my taste buds better than I know them. Some items specifically state that no substitutions are allowed; which, implies that if you're ordering an item not specifically marked with "no substitutions", you'd be able to substitute a topping for something you may like more. Not the case. If you want to personalize your pizza, go somewhere else.  All this really boils down to customer service. I feel like Pizza Rock has the philosophy that the customer really doesn't know what's best for them and it is their job to enlighten the customer. I'm sure you've heard of Seinfeld's "soup nazi" -- Pizza Rock epitomizes that "character".

fTNg0N9eZGiaL5BB_2J0MA.text: Love this place! Other day something went wrong with my pizza and i had to wait a while for a remake and one of the managers Billy apologized and was so kind. I love when managers can quickly apologize and not argue. That's how you keep customers to keep coming back if something little goes wrong! Just the way Billy treated me felt as if I was super important. Other than that mess up, every-time i come in its amazing pizza, amazing service, and just a great atmosphere. Best pizza in town i promise!

pLHnfG6R3HAQ-EGVBe4Z2Q.text: I believe his name was Zach. Started out good. But after 45 minutes waiting for our 2 small pizzas. Not complicated. I finally called the waiter over and requested the check. He insisted that he would check on our pizzas and ran off. Returned to say they're ready now. "Just came out". We foolishly said yes and received our like warm barely palatable pizzas. We were very hungry by then.   I was going to not leave a tip but God clearly directed me to behave as usual and give Him the glory. Reluctantly we left our 20% with a note. This was God,

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. This is our bill. God is good. It&#39;s called grace. Undeserved favor.

miqxM9leaA4ZGsDd2xG8bA.text: I was wrong about this place! One of my favorite restaurants to grab a happy hour beer at or a mob boss pizza. So good!

wtOovxlfuUCwftUod7s2zQ.text: Most, if not all pizza joints just served one style of pizza. Not a bad deal but if one ever wants to try a pie from New York, Detroit, Chicago, Sicily, or Neapolitan at one restaurant the head over to Pizza Rock. We opted for a New York pepperoni and a Neapolitan "fancy" pizza and both were great. We happened to eat around happy hour and took advantage of half price apps of calamari, pan-fried green beans, and truffle french fries. Food was really good, but they do have more options then pizza and next time I visit Green Valley I may order me some Sausages and Peppers.

Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States

A5dRFrvnmXQGefumkQ9TAg.text: Great service first of all. I love Green valley ranch casino. After midnight I hit up the grand cafe for the $6 steak dinner with my bros.  if I'm hungry earlier i hit pizza rock because they have a sick mofo happy hour menu. I always get the calamari with the spicy mayo thing and smother it on my personal pizzas.   The servers are great and always talk with us. A couple folks that work there are aspiring chefs with big dreams and I hope they get there with work ethics like theirs.

MKOjdP01RlOrm6MWFWnP2Q.text: Hands down the best pizza I've ever had. Had the award winning New Yorker.   Atmosphere is pretty chill. We came when football games were on the big screens and it was pretty busy for a place on a Sunday, but not chaotic.   Service was great. Very attentive and polite all around.  Pizza was incredible. Everything down to the pizza sauce (I honestly don't like most pizza because I don't like traditional pizza sauce) was incredible. Even the house salad croutons were incredibly flavorful. Didn't have anything from the bar but the options look good.  Prices were decent. We paid twenty bucks for a pizza that fed three guys easily.   We will definitely be back. And are going to try the Sunday brunch. Breakfast pizza? Bottomless mimosas? Ummmm absolutely.

GxsMPUc4cUSp82mSIKfcJA.text: Great pizza every time!  Highly recommend the New Yorker with the little delicious balls of fresh ricotta cheese on top.

evtXML4jORhsi9qd0N9bbg.text: Great food and service as usual! We dined at Pizza Rick tonight for an early NYE dinner. We were so lucky to get Brandt! We've had him a few times since we started going. He is always very pleasant and gives great recommendations on beer. He is very courteous and attentive no matter how busy they are. Pizza Rock has great meatballs and sauce. They have a great variety of pizzas to choose from. They also have happy hour everyday from 4-6pm. I was surprised they had happy hour on NYE.  So bonus for us! We highly recommend this place when you want good pizza and great service! Ask for Brandt when you go :)

bIFCA4GpGfi8ob1LNjpexw.text: My guy and I went for dinner last week. He ordered a meat lovers pizza and I took bartenders suggestion of a calzone. His pizza came out and mine was no where to be found. About 10 minutes later (he was 2 slices in) I got bartenders attention and asked her where my food was. She was gonna about 4-6 minutes and came back with a huge puffy awesome looking calzone. .... until you separated the 2 pieces and realized there was NOtHING inside!! On the bottom was a few pieces of cheese and spinach and the rest was air. There was a tiny container of sauce on the side. 1 bite in and I realized the dough was raw. Got bartenders attention and showed her. She took it away, no offer for anything else (my guy was almost done with his pizza at this Point) and came back to tell us she took it off bill. That was it. No manager visit, no offer for a salad or other entree. We left there and I stopped at food court on way out to get a sandwich. Horrible experience start to finish!

Q8kzThWkxKXjp8K_Gr2-lg.text: If I could give 0 stars,I would.   After our first horrible experience we were told by the GM to be very specific about the way we wanted our pizza.  So...my husband went in and ordered...specifically as we were told to.  Most of our pizza was,sauce... no cheese  Just sauce.  No cheese...vegetables.   they should be ashamed of themselves.  The pizza was great at first.  Now it's awful.  Save your money.  ..

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. This is what our pizza looked like when we returned home.  Those big red circles are sauce..no cheese on top.
Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. Here is our pizza... big red circles of sauce.  No cheese.

Cq2KAO1PJt2ya1V0dyQp4A.text: I really wanted to like this place :(  On the upside, our waitress was attentive. They currently have a Monday special where if you bring your mother they eat for free (an entree up to $20). I brought my mom and she had a salad (all of their salads are entree sized and could feed a family) and I ordered their famed Margherita pizza.  The pizza crust was soaked in the juices if the tomatoes and was limp and drippy. I had asked the waitress if we qualified for the Monday promotion, and she had said we did; however, she returned and told us that we both needed to have ordered a pizza or pasta :/  Update: The owner, Trevor, reached out to me about my experience. I greatly appreciate that he takes pride in his business and the experiences of his guests. I'm going to give it another shot (because everyone has a bad day every now and again).

YYjVtiIgta-HL_eLiZyH9g.text: Really loved the food here. Pizza is always good but have you tried their burger?  I was very impressed and can wait to go back and eat that again.

C_4rNL6-FP8wWZWFuO4Pyw.text: Food was okay at best. I've been to the location in downtown Las Vegas several times and it is hands down better all the way around compared to the location here in Henderson. Service here is friendly but slow. We ordered the Gorgonzola fries as an appetizer. I've had  these several times at the downtown location. They were good but they weren't as "cheesy melty" for lack of a better term as the fries I've ordered downtown. We ordered the New Yorker Pizza. It was okay. Not piping hot as I'm used to. The toppings were great but the pizza overall was hard to chew. We ended up eating the toppings and leaving the crust.

JibQ1KeI-KjlgbBcXREzoA.text: Another stellar evening at Pizza Rock tonight!  Celebrated dad's 79th birthday and had a great time!!  Food was delish as always!  Just love this place!  Got there at 4:15pm no wait but when we left long lines. Just shows you that after all this time this restaurant has still got it!!  Thanks again for another great experience!

3HZ5rLzo3QJwj2W5u2jmEw.text: Too expensive, slow service.  Eat at the green valley casino location and you choke on cigarette smoke while eating.   For the price go to "settebello" in the district.

0uT4o9orsNbVAO8gIkEOjg.text: Paige was an incredible server. Her recommendation of the Stone Enjoy By beer was wonderful and just what I was looking for. Really liked the New Haven pizza she helped us order. We will be back soon.

GV0soV_zKsFK1Vjjp-xSWw.text: Best Pizza in town I seriously crave this place at least once every 2 weeks If you like pizza Pizza Rock won't let you down.

ZR00mpF3MbedDXPCJ5kzMw.text: Was about to leave Green Valley Casino but I needed a quick bite to eat with a friend. Wonderful rosemary garlic fries along with sharing a person mushroom pizza.   Terrific beer selection but more important then bartender made a recommendation of a wonderful stout.   Will make this a habit.

PQr5Q_SFZwfmvQVLkAR1RA.text: We had just landed in Las Vegas at about 11pm.  Our close friend we came to visit lived down the road from the Green Valley Ranch Resort & Casino.  She had suggested we go there if we wanted to grab a late dinner.  So we did and the first thing that caught our attention was the smell of pizza and the music playing from this place.  Immediately, we wanted to eat pizza!  We happened to stop in during their late night happy hour so each of the items we ordered were under $8.  The meatballs were good...nothing special about them.  But the Rosemary Garlic Fries...OMG!  Those were so darn delicious!  I'm craving them right now!  You definitely can taste the rosemary.  They were so crispy and hot out the fryer.  My favorite item that night.  The personal pan pizzas (Cal Italia and Tony 2 Times) were also very delish.  Now to the Hot Pepper Olive Oil....AMAZEBALLS!  I love me some spice and the oil added a nice kick to the food.  Especially when we drizzled some onto the Rosemary Garlic Fries.  Made the fries even better.    I believe there is more than one location in Las Vegas.  If you're ever there please give this place a try.  I really enjoyed the food.  The atmosphere is pretty rock n roll-ish.  But that made our late night dinner even more enjoyable.

Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. Tony 2 Times

0Ijoj2KmM3GePZGOf2JPoA.text: Awesome beer selection and great menu of pizza and snacks.  This was the perfect place to post up at the and wait for our whole crew to assemble before we hit the tables.  A little something for everyone and tons of tvs.

PIiDJXw9o1Avd3BOx_78oQ.text: SOOOO GOOD. The pizza is amazing! Our waitress was outstanding. We went on a Sunday & I got bottomless mimosas which were fantastic. The restaurant itself is very clean and I love the vibe. One of my favorite places.

I absolutely loved having covers for vinyl records substitute for a more traditional menu.  Service was decent.  Food awesome as always. Pizza Rock remains my go to place for pizza in Las Vegas.

r6uIQhTdJSQBDXhWUSX80A.text: We came here to celebrate my daughter graduation & it was very disappointing.. Server Rachell seems very disturbed on waiting on us maybe because we have kids. Forgot my daughters meal so have deal with a five year old constantly asking when her food is coming. Never apologize for that either. seems like natural for her to forget costumers order. & when I pay I paid with gift card & debit, I work in the same industry so I know that she authorized my card for the full amount coz My bank put a hold authorization for the full amount instead of partial bec. I also gave her a gift card so it took 5 days for my bank to release the money for a mistake authorization. FYI I understand mistakes happened but if you could at least let us know if you made a mistake it will be nice.

OI5xtDZYbsnBILjVApGH_g.text: This place is okay. Fist time I came here, the pizza I had was severely undercooked. Second time I came here, I had a coupon, and the pizza was 10 times better, but I ultimately wouldn't say it's the best pizza place in Vegas. I'd stick with Grimaldi's or even Bella Vita in the District. It's good for the price, but nothing more. Just an a-ok pizza place in GVR.  The one True complaint I have with this place is the live music. One night I was there they had a Dj, which I normally don't mind DJs, but the music that night was ear-piercingly loud. Also, for an Italian place, that guy was playing some very unfitting music. Lots of rap and latin music from what I remember.  It's definitely worth a try, though. You might like it, I just thought it was alright.

FgynhgFg-1xg0R7KGMOMIg.text: I want to like this place more, but it's really not that special. It's pretty pricey too.   My favorite things are the truffle fries and honey pie. I do feel the fries could have more truffle flavor. My husband likes the Detroit red top.   The picante is okay. The New Yorker is alright, but too sweet. I did not like the cal Italia at all.

DvpHpowNugr3zWL4C8M_cA.text: We got a Margarita Pizza, Meatballs and the Lasagna, pretty good. Would definitely go back. Our server was great! A few of the other staff seemed like they would rather be elsewhere, but luckily we didn't have too much interaction with them. Cool environment and decent pricing for a Casino.

qQzdMHxgrn-qEF0O4nOtGw.text: The worst part of this visit was the sheer volume of the music.  We had a table of 5 and could literally not talk across the table without raising our voices.  It was too much.  The pizza was great.  We had the Guinness Pizza and the New Yorker.  Both were really tasty and well cooked.  We also tried the 1/2 & 1/2 calamari app and it was really good as well...however, the dipping sauce for the spicy calamari is REALLY hot, so beware.  The service was adequate, but not great.  Overall, the vibe is really cool and the food we had was great.  We would go back but just ask to be seated in a much quieter area.

Zl0p3cpR9X1RQBcNrRCU7A.text: BEST gluten free pizza I have ever had! Crust is so soft I couldn't tell it was gluten free in the first place. And the sauce! Oh my!! Will definitely make another visit.

fSGKNwRf2K9ocBy3SbJvdQ.text: I've eaten a lot of meatballs in my life. Some great, some not so great, some not worth remembering. But these babies are as delicious as they look! Tender, most, flavorful, and the sauce is to die for! I dream about these. Seriously, they are that good. And you can't beat $4 at Happy Hour!

sgI0-o6kOJp5FxY2Ixd3rQ.text: Went here after craving for a new pizza place in town, and looked on the menu only to see the world famous New Yorker. It was supposed to be good and delicious. It was not. The sausage/fennel combination had good flavor, yet the rest of the pizza was not good. The crust wasn't very crispy and there was way too much sauce. Like way too much sauce. Floppy af. Also the price was outrageous for what you get. Ended up being closer to 30 bucks with tax for one pizza. Grimaldis, Settebello, way better options under same price point. 2/5

R6Lzb_NPISLrTteWSMckwg.text: VERY HIGHLY RECOMMENDED  Who the hell is Tony Gemignani? I'm ashamed that I had to google him. I learned that this dude is THE KING OF PIZZA, the first American and non-Neopolitan to win the World Championship of Pizza.  Knowing none of this, I lunched here on 7/20/16. The Green Valley Ranch location, with blaring rock music, is a pleasant space with a gastropub vibe. Tables are not situated too close together.It's an environment conducive to fun. The restaurant also has great Happy Hour promotions which include both pizzas and drinks.  Pizza Rock is the most ambitious pizza restaurant that I'm aware of. None of this "shorten the menu" Gordon Ramsey stuff. Pizza Rock's menu reads more like an encyclopedia, where one can get numerous selections based on Italian, Californian, Chicago or New York styles. The menu even specifies the oven temperature for cooking each variety of pizza. That is attention to detail, man....or woman.  Rena, my server, greeted me politely and gave me several minutes to peruse the voluminous menu. It took some time because, in addition to the staggering variety of pizza options, the craft beer menu included more than twenty selections.I chose a New Belgium Golden Ale. It was cold, fresh, complex and absolutely delicious.  Pizza was a difficult choice. I settled on the Margherita Pie. As per the menu, this pie won the World Championship.Humorously, Pizza Rock only makes 73 of these pies a day. Why not 75, 80 or 100? Tony, obviously, does not like round numbers. Anyway, since I arrived when the restaurant opened at 11, I know I got the first one of the day. Oh boy! I'm glad I chose this pie.  The Pie was cooked perfectly. The mozzarella was extremely fresh and distinct tasting. It was amazingly delicious.The crust was crisp on the bottom, light and tantalizingly  "puffy"........think the Jerry Seinfeld Shirt Episode. I'm not one who generally notices the crust, but this crust was outstanding.The pie was also sauced in perfect proportion. This pie was the best Margherita Pie I have ever tasted. Indeed, it was not only the best dish I tasted in Vegas, but on the short list of the best dishes I have eaten all year. I polished off all six slices in no time at all.  Based on the foregoing, I have, for the first time, placed the word "very" before "highly recommended".  Tony.....PLEASE, PLEASE bring Pizza Rock to lower New York!!!!

The Old Chicago Pizza tasted like it was from an old Chicago sewer.  The crust was burnt (see picture), the seasoning was bitter, the sauce was almost non-existent, it was dry, and it was just plain nasty. q-B57MvCyIvcqNVoHVOhhQ.text: This place seems always short of staff. Tough to get quality service.  Waiters running around, always in the weeds.  Ordered a gluten free pizza as we have a gluten alllergy.  Cross contamination in kitchen made us very ill.  Not a responsible place.  Paying premium prices for a tasty product , yet substandard service.  Beware!

fsM39yiEJcFtZn_3mM_NGQ.text: First of all Pizza Rock has fantastic pizza's only one better in Henderson.  The problem with this place is the service.  I've been there when the place is almost empty early around 4 or 4:30 pm a time when you would hope to get great service, both times I had to leave my table and search for the server to get something.  I won't go back anytime soon.

5hItU5eyyiYACXmtAKOMCA.text: I was very disappointed with this restaurant! First of all I ordered a Margherita and was told they couldn't make it because the ovens were not on and won't be until 5.. It was 12:30.. The pizza I did order was burnt and when I told the waitress she said "I'm sorry " and that was it! Never offered to replace it! When refilling the drinks she gave the wrong drink to my cousin who was diabetic and the drink contained sugar!! A horrible mistake but only got I'm sorry! What's up with customer service these days?? As I was leaving the restaurant guess what I saw?? That's right.... someone having a margherita pizza!!!! I will not be going back to this restaurant again!! Also their  prices are too high for what you get! There are cheaper places with better customer service out there!!!

Svw-kQ4keO4QgMPfkLDsgw.text: Blonde Kat and Ginger Kat both had to pit up with me as a customer. My girlfriend and I both had a wonderful time here. She had a NY style cheese pizza and I had the mac and cheese. Both were excellent. We also had Coccoli and the beer battered artichokes (2 separate visits in 2 days, dont judge).  I would recommend this place highly.  It is in GVR Casino and hotel.   Ps they still have Blanton's bourbon for those of you who like bourbon!

ZvTV9h-_aU86Uq4xiSQcyg.text: Everyone raved about this place, from my Lyft driver to the front desk, so I thought, wow! I've gotta try it...so I did...and I was disappointed.  I went with the safe choice, pepperoni, which left much to the imagination. The crust was very "meh" and the peps were bland. The only think I could honesty say we're good and/or worth it are the beer and service. Although the clerk didn't know how to properly serve a beer without foam.

dSw6_GZ5ezG5E2IVK9ZE8w.text: The only reason I give it 4 stars and not 5 was because of the 1 hr wait and loud music. Besides that the food was exceptional. I got a pasta dish that had a bunch of grilled zucchini in it, it was delish! Came with yummy focaccia bread. My hubby got the Gorgonzola burger with rosemary fries he loved it as well! Would definitely go back but I think I'd try a pizza next time!

1H2GUimOZyvKHFPSxD3rJA.text: great beer selection.  reasonably priced.  i'm giving 4 stars instead of 5 simply because i was only moderately amazed with my "frank nitti" chicago cracker thin pizza.    i have every intention of trying the detroit red top on my next visit.  i hear it's amaze-balls.  but get there early, because apparently it sells out on busy nights.  sit at the bar. andrew is the man.

PGFpEjUgQQmhpGfIC_ScdQ.text: Thank you Tony for opening a new spot closer to me than downtown.  While I love Pizza Rock Downtown us locals hate getting in the mix with all the tourists down yonder, and not to mention paying to park!!  I might be called NORM here very soon as I found the happy hour pricing and food selections very pleasing.  I might as well go order the next size up in jeans because I can now have my pizza and eat it too!!   Food here as always was excellent!!  The happy hour menu has enough food selections to keep your palate singing!!  It is also a good way to sample some of the specialty za's without buying a big pie if you don't like it.  2 personal pizza's, truffle fries, and a soda was $22!!  We left stuffed and with leftovers!!  Once again...Thanks Tony!!

BJ5v1euFEgdgBCruFOyIRg.text: I would recommend this place if your looking for a place to drink and relax accompanied with some amazing food. The new yorker pizza was really good with some great flavor. I will be going back since the menu has a little bit of everything :)

bUOIE_Y_aLGDJohMmHghxg.text: Bottom line, this place does not put enough sausage on their pizza. The crust, sauce, and cheese is top notch, especially the crust absolutely delicious thats why i gave you two stars.  Really a shame Pizza Rock doesn't put enough toppings on there. How can a pizza place be concerned with sausage and topping food costs when they are charging such high prices for pizza?  Get it together Pizza Rock! Your blowing it!  Worst reputation to have is to be  cheap when you are trying to deliver a superior product at premium prices. There were 8 tiny bits of sausage on my thin crust sausage pizza, I felt like i had been robbed by a sausage bandit.  If the sausage prices are high because your importing from Chicago, switch to something else! Jimmy Dean makes great sausage just add some fennel, red pepper flakes,  and a little oregano- BOOM! italian sausage :) Load it up don't be so skimpy your profit margins are huge on these pizzas, people know what your doing!!!.  You guys got everything else figured out get it together! You could have the best pizza in Green Valley Ranch be smart and add an appropriate level of sausage. As a general rule of thumb when adding sausage to a pizza there should no more than a 3/4 inch between each piece of sausage.  Also remember as sausage cooks its reduces in size by up to 75%.  I will be ordering again soon I hope this issue is taken seriously and is rectified because i don't want there to be any more victims of the sausage bandit.

BuwQFRJm4_owt7cRyny5dw.text: What makes a restaurant amazing?  The food, the service and the atmosphere.  The Sicilian pizza is probably one of their best pizzas especially if you like thick crust.  Top it of with a Mexican Coke.  If you go, request Nick.  He is always attentive even with how busy the restaurant was.  He got our pizza out extremely quick.  Definitely should check it out if you are at GVR or nearby.

tzfQwCX4QU-CfLYyEL6OFw.text: Pizza was good but not great and definitely not worth the price.  The tab was the most memorable part of the experience to remind me not to come back.  This is unfortunate because I probably would return of it wasn't so darn overpriced... Boo

NZm5vaNffpw6AjGxnadecA.text: Bass and music is way intense. Even the waiter couldn't hear us. Would be epic if they toned it down a bit. Fantastic food. Fried green tomatoes were stellar. We got the veggie and the cal itialia. Really great food. They should re think their demographic. Lots of older locals in the area. Not in the mood to feel their body vibrate while trying to have a conversation over great pizza. Could wait to scarf down the pie and get relief from the vibrating noise.

Cbmt7PR1cNaQacQ-3ebBAg.text: I can't say enough about this place!  We had such an incredible time at Pizza Rock.  We had the Calitala and the Calamari and both were amazing but the best part of our experience was undeniably the service we received from Jennifer.  Her Canadian sense of humor was refreshing.  She was so warm, welcoming, and fun!  She is such a comedian!!! We will return because of her.  Thank you so much Pizza Rock for a fun night out.

Wfkf41dJxsx1kW2fLrM3Qw.text: On the recommendation of a very reliable Yelp friend, we decided to try this place, located inside the Green Valley Casino. We were definitely not disappointed! We arrived about eleven pm, it was not very busy, being a Wednesday night, but there was a lively feel to the dining and our server was very helpful and informative as she described the three types of pizzas and the ovens that they used to create the variations to the crusts. We decided to try the gorgonzola fries and the "Old Chicago"  pizza. The fries came to the table within just a couple minutes, they were very tasty, although I am not a huge fan of Bleu cheese and I  think they garnish the fries with Bleu cheese crumbles. The gorgonzola cheese is kinda like a sauce, certainly not bad, and the fries were cooked perfectly. Next time I will try the Rosemary &  Garlic fries. The pizza arrived at our table very quickly and was cooked to perfection, black on the edges, the thin crust on this pizza is awesome (if you like thin crust pizza) and generously covered with delicious toppings including tomato sauce, mozzarella, provolone, garlic Italian fennel sausage sliced meatballs, ricotta and oregano. The 16" pie cost $23.00. We took at least half of it home and I am sure it will be great tomorrow for leftovers. We highly recommend this restaurant. And our server was very helpful and attentive!

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. Gorgonzola fries!
Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. The old Chicago!

XnXeP93AyKuhnl9j7MRA4A.text: STOP! Do not go to the one in Henderson if you want to be overcharged treated badly and rudely by a general manager name Ricky, have sparse amount of cheese put on your pizza, and the deep dish pizza made paperthin then please listen and read this review the restaurant has gone downhill they have a horrible horrible general manager a kid name Ricky Who seems to have complaints after complaint and The casino is aware of it! He will treat you like crap show you in his mind who the boss is! not care if you complain,will get angry and rude Yell at  you in front of other customers and bring you pizza that looks like it was made out of a frozen box that would taste better than going to that restaurant I don't know what happened it's gone completely downhill since the manager Tom has left Ricky is rude obnoxious infantile, and clearly the wrong person that they put in charge and clearly don't care about the reputation if you want Goodfood go to Rissotis pizza do not eat at pizza rock! They will overcharge you they will charge you for every little thing and not give a shit! And they will treat you badly like they're doing you a favor to serve you,Yell at you in front of other customers loudly to make a scene that's what Ricky did ,do not eat there you will be greatly disappointed!

MnjrYzPIp9ACKDSl0-WvqA.text: My first time at Pizza Rock was excellent! We walk in and the hosts are smiling and ready to get us sat. Paige was our server for the night and was completely attentive to all of our needs, and though it was super busy she didn't seem flustered or panicked. We ordered a Cal Italia, Gorgonzola Fries, Calamari, a Molinari and a few other things. The food came out hot and when I say that the Cal Italia and Calamari were the best I've ever had, that doesn't even do it justice! Tommy, one of the managers came to our table and talked with us several times throughout the night. The way that he interacts with customers is the way every business should. I'm sure that we've all experienced going to a restaurant and regretting that you chose to spend your money there, whether it was the service, food or atmosphere. This isn't one of those places. You come in happy and leave even happier. I am now a regular here. By far my favorite pizza place!

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. Calamari!
Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. Cal Italia!
Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. Molinari pizza!

Zwb8APcXOkN3BBLxZ-c2IQ.text: Henderson pizza = yes.  Napolitano pizza = NO.  Kudos to our server and the manager for addressing a burnt tasting napolitano pizza and trying to make it right.  Next time will stick to the Henderson as this style of crust was just perfect and all the flavors came together just right.  The price tag is definitely high -$21 for an 11 or 12 inch.

iG_cAzbW7NV8tsfbWVuaew.text: Great food. Great atmosphere! Get the meatballs. They are amazing. 40 draft beers and 60 bottles and cans. Good stuff.

aZe8d0OTGQpQBtU7pXpWkw.text: I came to have dinner with a few friends Wednesday night and sat at the bar. Josely was our bartender and she was amazing. She was extremely knowledgable with the menu and helped me pick an amazing dish. She was lovely and made our experience o e of a kind. We will absolutely be back to see her.

__ccmcmZCI086axf7iG9yw.text: Decided to try out the hype of this new pizza  spot at GVR. Wow! I was blown away! The food did take a little longer then expected to come out.. But I think it was only the second day being open & they were pretty slammed busy. Excellent beer selection!!!! The New Yorker was on point! I look forward to trying a lot more from this very extensive menu!!! The music was a little loud for maybe an older crowd? Lol but They are obviously targeting towards that young hip crowd in Vegas.... I loved the atmosphere! No complaints from this guy! The service was amazing! My girl Taylor really knows her stuff from beer selections down to the food!! I will most definitely be back!! Great job pizza rock!! Look forward to seeing how much better this place can be!!

7_uYvQ6TqJcPIrGYIYVP7g.text: Pizza was good. Bartender with beard is hot as F*^%!!!  Every time he makes my drink I wish he put his finger in it. Yum.

eAjhyNbSsK4Jh1BqLMjMtA.text: We stayed at the Green Valley Ranch Resort for a conference and decided to try Pizza Rock for the convenience of being right in the hotel/casino.  Not expecting much, we were blown away. Our server Vincent was GREAT. Being a lover of craft beer I wanted to try some of their local beers and was pleased by their large beer selection. Vincent asked me what I liked and was very helpful and gave me great suggestions!  The food was also great for a very reasonable price for being in a casino.  I would definitely recommend this place to anyone. We had the Manhattan calzone and the Margherita pizza and were extremely pleased with both meals.

BM2moBcMxqZyeFoQ76BYQg.text: WONDERFUL WONDERFUL WONDERFUL FOOD, the service is not great but the food is amazing!! The meatballs are a must if you go! The pizza is kind of pricey but can be shared between 2 people. They charge for sides of ranch which I thought was a little ridiculous because of the price of everything else on the menu but I defiantly will be going back to try more items!

zNqnrbauws3DsPpFlfNqew.text: My husband and I have been here for dinner twice. The meatballs and pizza are fantastic. We tried three different types of pizza and each one was delicious. They have a wonderful wine and craft beer menu. The staff has been fantastic. They are all friendly and knowledgable about the menu. I wish we went to dinner at this restaurant prior to trying others at the GVR that were overpriced and had mediocre food.

AS1fr7qILr1dlzTX8MmrWA.text: Came here on a Friday evening with a party of 9. The parking lot was completely full, but we managed to find someone leaving. Apparently the parking garage is THE place to park (we didn't know).  It was pretty busy and loud, but we had a reservation and we were seated immediately. I was immediately impressed by the beer list. Then the food menu- it's large and there's something for everybody. All kinds of different pizzas with different types of crusts and toppings. Salads. Pastas. Calzones. Burgers.  Service itself was pretty good (no one was ever without a beer), but the food took a long time to come out. Also, everyone's food arrived at different times. My pizza came out 10 minutes before the next person got their food and then another 10 minutes after that everyone else got their food. Not wanting to be rude, I waited for everyone to receive their food before I started eating. My pizza was cold by then, but it was still good. I got the Chicago Frank Nitti. It was more than enough for 2 people! The portions are huge here! We all took boxes home!

PyjuKXq4B3z28r6h68v8eQ.text: So I was here with my older brother during happy hour and the service was superb. We are impressed with the pizzas especially Cal Italia, it's such an creative and delicious flavor.  The place is so aesthetically modern and American and I love it. I'm looking forward to coming back!

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. The mob boss

B4FGqj9igiAQf1weCevQAA.text: We have been to both Pizza Rock locations many times and the food is always amazing. One of the best pizzas in town. We always get the garlic bread and meatballs if we come during happy hour and the New York New Yorker pizza. What is prompting me to write the review was the impeccable service we got from Brandt. We have never had more flawless service in our lives. He was welcoming, prompt, remembered everything, had great timing, made suggestions, I could go on and on. I hope management realizes what a fantastic employee they have. We will definitely be back to this location same day and time in the future.

RKlyLLA77_xUWT0jd5Tu5w.text: We were staying at the Green Valley Resort & Spa, so we decided to give this place a try. It was so good! We went in at 5:30 on a Friday night and got seated immediately. Stuffed our faces with happy-hour-priced yummy food. The green beans, meatballs, and rosemary-garlic fries appetizers were perfection. Service was super friendly and efficient. We will be back!

dFws4sXkT6pjJgLQXG4GVA.text: Went here for lunch for the first time and it was awesome! Great atmosphere in a casino and perfect location for Henderson locals. Our sever recommended a great pizza for sharing with my two girlfriends and we got asparagus and coccoli for appetizers. Everything was so good and fresh! Was stuffed by the end. Great beer selection as well! I'll definitely sit at the bar next time! Love that you can get a quick bite or a have a full meal! So convenient. Server kept our drinks full that whole time and was very accommodating as I asked for extra sauce.  Will definitely be back!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States

UYRxs36L3FiAgxL7WDDt9g.text: Food is plenty, good, but we waited a while for it to come.... still debating if we'll come back.  $$$ in my opinion

qj-Wsw-yPKzKAlT-BCK2oA.text: If you love pizza, then this is the place to be.  My friends and I came in here just to grab a brew.  Since one of them is a devote beer drinker, he was one happy camper to see a dedicated menu just for beer and ales.  He got what he was looking for.  Meanwhile, the pizza menu looked awesome.  Since we had dinner plans, we didn't order one.  However, one of the tables changed their minds and didn't want their veggie pizza and the bartender gave it to us for me.  Now, I'm a meat lover, so free is free, so I took it.  If the veggie pizza was that good, it made me think that the other pizza's were also awesome.  Next time, I'll order a pie here.

BsSYESWX20t2RrNoVAk4UA.text: Didn't think anyone was eating here.  12:45 and didn't see a soul in the restaurant. 3 people "guarding" the hostess stand though.  Seating was all being assigned in the far back.  And around the corner near the patio. (When they opened the door it was like an oven) Waitress was so slow.  And I did hear the table near us ask how much longer for their food.  So I knew this was coming.  But I was with a guest so I put on my patience cap.  NO LUNCH MENU AND NO HALF ORDERS. got the Henderson it was ok after 40 minutes ANYTHING would have been good.  My daughter got the kids pizza. Sooo much grease on it!  Good thing we were not on our lunch hour. And to get a refill on a sprite was like asking a miracle.   the sauce was excellent! Downtown location was much much much better on service and food arrived promptly.

M-ooGgC2WlzAcvYeBIhCVA.text: I love this place, fair warning it is super loud, like the loudest restaurant I have ever been in, it is called Pizza ROCK for a reason.  Service: I have only sat at the bar at this location and they are good, attentive and I get what I need plus conversation.   Food: Quinoa Salad - delicious, fresh, light and a great citrus dressing Gluten Free Crust/make your own - not bad for gluten free, it was a little chewy to me, but its not my normal order Cal Italia - to die for this was the first pizza I had and I love it, not your standard meat and cheese toppings, the flavor is amazing, here the description: Gold Medal Winner - Food Network Pizza Champions Challenge Asiago, Mozzarella, Imported Gorgonzola, Sweet Fig Preserve, Prosciutto di Parma,  Parmigiano-Reggiano, Balsamic Reduction  I will keep going back, so much to try!

h43M-S7R4JA2zjH_bQj80w.text: Service is a 7.5/10, but the pizzas and atmosphere deserves a five star! There was a DJ playing on Friday night and they have TVs that will play the music video of the music that's playing. I like sitting in the bar area for great people watching.   They also deliver to Inspirada with a $7.99 delivery charge.

dBvQU3f647mZO8q9F7nZpA.text: Tony X2 pizza and garlic fries were delicious!! Happy Hour prices were a plus! I cannot wait to come back! Great, fantastic and wonderful!

aK2hR5ZSSpBEDjagewRcjQ.text: so I came here for happy hour and i was so excited to try this place but to easily say the food was terrible. we all had personal pizzas ($5 or $6 at happy hour) and it was seriously all bread. the sauce tasted horrible and it was the size of a IHOP pancake.   service was good though.

JZWvHtX2ZQT-H6JQ6PVIBA.text: Wow, what just happened! My friends and I are Vegas locals, and were craving a good pizza and happy hour day. Pizza rock at this location has everything! We had a wonderful server Paige who was friendly and always on top of our dinner, fun location and beautiful weather :) will definitely be coming back!

MYo2FFeNBE3tJOEyD59Zgw.text: Love Pizza Rock!  We live close by Green Valley Ranch, so we can walk there (which is good - need to walk off some of those calories we devour at Pizza Rock)!  My husband thinks the New Yorker is the best pizza in town.  I like that they have thin crust options (Chicago cracker thin).  You have try try their meatballs - delicious!  It's a little loud inside for me, but I put up with it for some delicious pizza!

i-0QWLQbbDY4OhaOagCVyw.text: Tried downtown yesterday Green Valley Ranch today ! All I can say that when It comes to pizza This place is 2nd to none. They should change name From Pizza Rock To Game Changer ! The absolute best ! I won't settle anymore ! Pizza Rock has earned My business!

x4qFZVINAPxzhBE7WCkW8Q.text: Good decor. Fun music playing. Ordered large family size house salad. What a rip off. It was almost all lettuce with a few slivers of onions and three tiny pieces of tomatoes. All for $11. Wow. I was shocked. The New York style pizza arrived. The crust was was good and crisp. Hardly any cheese and way too much sauce. Speaking of the sauce. It tasted like spaghetti sauce and way too sweet. Gave it a try. Disappointed. Grimalti's is much better. That's just my opinion and taste. But I know good pizza.

_5hroR1hTqSRemYj9WjdtA.text: It's now one of our favorite places to go & take friends or family when they are in town. It's by far the best pizza for me. My husband agrees to that too!  The only downfall is service is poor. Been here maybe 3x and so far it's always the same kind of service weather they are busy or not.
