rKdcucCVdnP_G_tqjWv6aQ.text: I'm giving it a 3 stars but that only because the bartender was very good and they did take away the bad and let us order something else.  The pizza?  OMG the worst I have ever eaten.    Being an old Jersey girl, I know my pizza.  If you want to get shot in NY .... take this pizza to NYC and try to serve it to someone.   The worst thing was that we saw other people ordering  the same pizza and it looked nothing like the burnt cracker with cheese so over done it no longer resemble cheese  (is these a secret to ordering here?)  I get the whole 700 degree oven business that's gonna char the crust - but this was inedible.  The bartender - bless her soul,  took it away and we decided to try something else.  We both got the meatball parm sandwiches which were very good.   So will we be back? - maybe....but I'm not ordering pizza.  What a shame.

AedIDmn3Xg_x-5JwtFo0ww.text: Very poor pizza place. got some misguided local vibe. Service was poor. Pizza second rate at best. Noise level was extra loud. Avoid....avoid

WI3Y4GcM4iJhl1C8N-yZOw.text: I came here with a few girl friends and we had a great time. The atmosphere is fun and the place was very clean, staff was really helpful and friendly. We ordered the mob boss, New Yorker, green beans, and meatballs. The green beans were ok. Everything else was delicious. I like hand tossed crust so the New Yorker was my favorite pizza. The mob boss was really great too, it has the thick Chicago style crust. The meatballs were fabulous. We will definitely be back.

lDzyfuZcBgN1VZfF-6m1bA.text: Found the pizza here to be really awful. It's the second location I've been to and in both cases the pizza was overdone with an annoyingly cloying sweet taste. Never again!

asFDOPHukWvf7NnF3PzZig.text: This place is amazing. Great atmosphere, service, and pizza.  Always judge a pizza place by its pepperoni pizza.  Order the New Yorker ($23). It'll be one of the best pizzas you've ever had. Complex for a foodie but accessible enough for person just looking for a good pie. The only negative (albeit, a very, very small one) is the music.  It is a bit too loud but when you're having fun, who cares.  Every pizza lover should try this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. Magherita pizza

pkDLduXGxEJIVfoKNGDuZA.text: I can't say enough good things about this place. Their Gargonzola Fries are THE best. Pizza is awesome, heck, all of their food that we have tasted is awesome. Fun atmosphere and the staff are great.

CJ-I1xQSG2joBKe_fy9QfQ.text: Called in order for pick up on my way home for a long car ride back to Vegas. My wife called when the GPS said we were 20 minutes away. Got there and the bartender told me she just put it in 6 minutes ago and I would have to wait. Then she told me it was my fault it was not ready because I was early. I then waited another 14 minutes for a total of 34 minutes. I would have been fine if she didn't say it was my fault I can't stand liars. Two stars because the pizza is always good.

F_GzP8NJEQ258TwCF7CV-Q.text: Horrible service! Sat at bar in waited about 30 min for a beer. Despite having about 50 taps they didn't even have my first 3 choices of beer. Tip in summer time lv have a lemon shandy on hand. Also server just dropped food without even asking if we wanted anything else. We ordered a side if meatballs that were doused in sauce which were good but they didn't serve or offer bread. My pizza was way to heavy in sauce. Too messy to enjoy. $100 lesson learned. Won't be back.

iYzL4lWOQIfT6VI-o-p_tg.text: Cool restaurant design. Really liked the semi-truck and abundant tv layout (MNF was on). Good food. Pizza was delicious, if not a bit over priced. Fried artichoke heart was good but didn't need the dipping sauce at all, it was overpowering the artichoke flavor. I just squeezed a little lemon and it was much nicer than the accompanying horseradish aioli. Mud pie dessert was ok, but only about half the size of the amazing Mud pie being served at Born And Raised (and the ice cream wasn't nearly as rich as BAR's either). Service was the real low light here for us. Slow and forgetful. I would like to try more different pizza varieties, so I'll be back for the good food. Hopefully the service is a bit better.

-4EdiHlwI8221-ZVcv0n8Q.text: Ben was are server and he was fantastic the food was great but even if it wasn't having Ben as a server would have made up for three food.  But the food and atmosphere was fantastic.  Thanks Ben.

eJdhOTQPCw2mYWB0BEJnjA.text: We had a 5 top with the most amazing server that I have ever had!  Thank you Brandt Downey for making us feel so wanted. You made us want to come back!  Thanks

y2evbsHtYqzJrr8T9Mv7kg.text: I prefer the downtown location but this is definitely a good spot if you are in the area.  Happy hour is perfect if you need a quick bite.  You can definitely share a personal pizza if you plan on getting an app.  Service was good and food came out quick.  Good selection on draft.  They even have a sports talk show going on while you eat

dtp_pxzxupXnytTS9xeM2Q.text: Yum yum!  Vinny was our server and he was great!   First time here- heard great things about the downtown location and we were not disappointed   The dj booth is cool!

Pa4Awj_0Go4Yr0a4WxA01g.text: Probably the best pizza i have ever had. I have eaten here now 3 or 4 times. If you are ever in vegas definitely try it. I love the pepperoni and sausage pizza. Very good service with friendly staff.

pD3-eThHZZ40O7-0xkJ89w.text: Hands down best pizza ever. I haven't had anything here I don't like. I'm definitely a repeat customer and was so happy to have them open up in Henderson.

jcNCWBOnz6P5ctwrHyasEQ.text: The pizza is good not great. The customer service is good and bad.  It all depends on who you can find or run into.  The waitresses were somewhat busy but definitely did not look happy to be working.  I came here twice during my stay at GVR.  The location is great.  Doesn't get much better than in a casino. They have late night happy hour which is awesome. Too bad they don't sell any pizza by the slice after a certain time. $5 for a personal pizza which is of decent size isn't a bad alternative. $7 for a specialty personal pizza was a little high given the minimal toppings they add. The  truffle fries had good flavor but they were a little soggy.  The menu said $3 but got charged $4.  Not complaining but found that somewhat odd.  Paid it anyways.  The garlic bread was good.  I ordered that my 2nd time visiting pizza rock.  I could've tried it my 1st visit because they messed up and accidently brought a garlic bread to my table.  I notified them as I didn't want to take someones order and they took it back and probably tossed it instead of offering it to me.  It sat at my table for a good 10 minutes as it took that long to find someone to notify of the mistake.  Oh well guess that's the way they handle those situations.   Would probably go back if I stay at GVR again due to the convenience of being located in a casino.

chatpk1Ad0l4Kas0XEBUAg.text: Great pizza!! Every type of pizza you could want in one place. Love the super thin crust. Nice place with good atmosphere.

5aZSJ794YS0kFyKdloTCcQ.text: This place is delicious! I loved the dough balls, prosciutto, and cheese. I forget what the appetizer is called but it was the best thing I've had in a while. The pizza was good but the reason I would come back is for the happy hour menu and the apps! So good!

Plm8Ahirwx9nA8G74owAAA.text: The food is always great! I've had many of their pizzas and recently tried the meatball sub and loved it. This is our go to when hanging out at green valley ranch. The only complaint I have is the mediocre service. They are always pretty busy but I still think good service is important even when you're slammed. If the service was a little better I'd give it 5 stars.

hrqkRt04uqDe_9p8ea_d3g.text: Pizza you will be thinking of weeks after - if you can resist waiting that long before you return!  In Vegas we have our chef's and Pizza Rock's Tony Gemignani is one of the best. With a variety of different style pizzas and a several different pizza ovens each is a True work of art. I recommend ordering two or three of the different award winners to truly understand the artistry. The Margherita was the defining World Cup Winner - fresh tomato, just the right amount of fresh mozzarella on the perfect crust giving it a delicate old world flavor. You will understand why it won and you'll still be thinking about this pizza weeks later - I have the texts from friends to prove it! This pizza is also great with Pepperoni added. We just asked Nick who has been there since day 1, he is an absolute house expert waiter on the nuances of each pizza - he'll set you up right! For a second pizza I recommend the Cal Italia or the New Yorker - if you have a big enough group snag all three. The Cal Italia is a Food Network Winner and completely different pizza from crust to cheese you'll be glad you tried it.  Finally the New Yorker, local winner of best traditional pizza will have you smiling when you reach the dollop of ricotta. If you are visiting, definitely worth grabbing a ride to visit this Henderson treasure if you want to experience pizza you will still be thinking of weeks later.

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. New Yorker - dollops of ricotta is unique surprise.
Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. Cal Italia: artistry defined!
Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. Margherita: Fresh, amazing with old world crust! Must have!

_0OhRsT31MPv9QcGlRqMUg.text: Came here with my wife during happy hour specials after 10 pm. She had a $5 guiness draft, i had $3 off a marmalade whiskey sour for $9. We each got a personal pizza for $5 each. The pizza was really good. My wife doesnt normally like pizza, but she kept saying how good it was and finished hers. My cocktail was really good. Id definitely get it again. I enjoyed the selection of loud music while eating. We will be back for sure.

Ej_Va7LmbW-svrgQdjzsRw.text: Amazing lunch and Nick is the best!  Will definitely be back again!  Calzobes for lunch was not dissapointing.  Great service, great food and Nick gave us amazing service!

84KpC_REEZt7tarNHAFoyg.text: Had the Detroit Red Hot and it was delicious. The GM did come over and informed us that the first pizza was over cooked and not to their standards.  If they take that much pride in their pizza and will not send out sub-par food they must really take pride in everything they do. Bartenders were very friendly too. Amazing experience!! I will be back for more food just because of the GM and the bartenders

9_nAedlFRWC8-BnhZmHhmw.text: Run of the mill pizza restaurant in a "local" casino not on the vegas strip. Waitress was nice, quick, and knowledgeable. The cost of the meal was moderate and the meal was quite deliscious.   We had the pizza with every meat as an appitizer and I had the chicken parmesan entree with homemade spaghetti.

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. Chicken parm on fresh spaghetti
Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. Meat Leftovers Pizza
Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. Menu branding

-Kzl6d8UzxQ9SOqdN9LK5Q.text: Frequent flyers to this location and usually it's a 4-5 star experience. This time (Saturday the 7th) not so much.  One of the things that attracts us to Pizza rock is the fact that they cater to celiacs (Gluten-free)....  We ordered our usual to accommodate the celiac person in our group and the waiter told us that the gluten-free oven was "not working".  He seemed bothered by the fact that we were ordering a gluten-free pizza and his attitude reflected it. When I went to speak to the manager on duty (Paige),  I found out that the oven was working just fine. Page sent another server over and the rest of the meal went fine.

QeLHYqStysZqpCG-vbsQPQ.text: This pizza was AMAZING!!!! Read that it's the #1 pizza spot in Nevada and I can see why!! Good prices, lots of options and toppings but most of all, the cheese, sauces and Dough were all great!!!! Only thing you have to worry about is the service. I called in an order , arrived to the restaurant and people walking up got helped before I did . Just a bit disappointing to see my pizza sit there a people getting drinks ordered. I'll definitely visit again!!!

hFU3m0JSZp2utDHHZys-rQ.text: Allison was amazing and gave exceptional service! I'm usually skeptical of service in casino restaurants, but Allison's service truly made us want to return. My family and I will be back!

1VZvXqA-qjVkqZk1aueeLA.text: This location at GVR is really sad. 6 people have to wait 30 min. To be seated but half the restaurant is empty.  They won't allow you to make a reservation. Not sure what the deal is? I guess so you sit at the bar and buy drinks, as a locals place it sucks. Pizza us great

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. Dirty tables.. for ever.
Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States

y8x87KP-iyX0XRbFgle4Hg.text: Pizza rock is fantastic!  Main reason is convenience! And of Course their Pizzas and Calzones!  1. Pepperoni Pizza 2. Margarita Pizza 3. Deep Fried Manhattan Calzone Are our family favorites!!  I love the fact that I can sit and watch the NBA/NHL playoffs @ the sports book area and enjoy myself and then pick up the phone, place my order and pick up when it's ready!   Plus all the staff are super friendly!  Pics coming soon

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. Sitting in sports book and ordering pizza is a given
Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States

uKDy4ioNZg0JJvWARMTbIg.text: Hostess at the front-end needs to be retrained , very rude and snappy! No personality and quick to refer me to a manager! Bad bad.....

0Smu-MpOnSwBpnRevb8xuw.text: Been here a few times and the pizza is so yummy! The last time we went there was a few months ago and they had Geeks Who Drink. I love seeing restaurants and bars that bring in entertainment like that to really bring something special to the guests. We got to play trivia (which I was terrible at, note to self!) and we got to enjoy delicious pizza, good beer and a great atmosphere. This has definitely hit the round of restaurants my husband and I frequent.

WNYYr-DArdtc5luiwCMG-A.text: Okay the first pizza that we had delivered was incredible!  I have to say that the experience wasn't the same the second time.  The pizza was cold and dry.  Truthfully it looked like the drive let that sucker sit in his car for 30 minutes before heading to my house.  I'll give it another shot though.  I hope I'm not bummed.  Cool menu though!  Many creative pizzas to choose from!  Very pricey pizza.  The quality should be top notch every time.  Unfortunately not the case.

5h_kRqJu3KzOAta3qBgk3g.text: Well maybe (probably) the pizzas are better if you eat them in-house, but we ordered 4 pizzas to be delivered and no one in my family was impressed at all.    We tried a variety and 4/4 were ...  meh.  For the cost it just wasn't a good choice for us this evening.  No one ate more than 2 slices and even then they left all the crusts.  It was an expensive disappointment.   Anyone want our leftovers??

tDUQXKwzEk1sBe-4hFnzYA.text: Stopped in for a bite and to watch a couple periods of the Knights game. When I ordered my first beer, the waitress informed me that since I had my VGK hat on I got a free beer! Great surprise!   Tons of TV's, great sound and good visibility from most seats. Love that they have an indoor outdoor area.   I've been here a few times, but never wrote a review. The food is all pretty good. Amazing? Nah. But really really good. they have a ton regional pizza styles. From the Neapolitan style, the Detroit cracker thin crust,  and even a deep dish style. I've had them all before and all really good.  Today my wife and I split a Stromboli. Pizzas here are just too expensive for us. But the $13 Stromboli was perfect for us to share. Maybe not if we were both super hungry, but tonight it was great.   All good things you say? Why only 4 stars? Well this is pretty overpriced for pizza. Really the only feasible option IMO is to come for happy hour. Beyond that it's rough to justify coming regularly. I mean a glass of White Zin was $7. A Blue Moon was $7.50. Just gets too pricey to come here on a consistent basis. Every now and then we come to grab some Zaaaa and watch a game, but with the myriad of sports bars in the vicinity with MUCH cheaper drinks and fairly comparable food this isn't usually on my food stop rotation.

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States

ZKqIKV1yuJcJoMQ4CTCUTA.text: A big "Thumbs Up" from my whole family! Very good pizza, and they offer it several ways; Cracker Thin, Sicilian, Chicago Style, New York Style, or just plain 'ol American Style.

LoJZ2qMviay3Oqe_sDgIVQ.text: Had a fun date night / staycation with the BF at Green Valley Ranch.  I had been wanting to try Pizza Rock.  I heard so many good things about it.   The food did not disappoint!!!     The wait was a little annoying, but it was a weekend.  They texted us when our table was ready, so that was helpful.    We had the Italian, rosemary & garlic french fries.... yum.   We had the New Yorker.  The pizza was delicious, except we didn't care for the dollops of ricotta.     We will be back to try other stuff.    On Wednesday, 50+ gets 15% off   :)

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States

ipjGnDd8VllUzC4JZpvjCw.text: We had our first outing at the downtown location mainly because the one in Green Valley Ranch hadn't opened yet.The pizza iqs the real thing.Quality ingredients and nice crisp crust.Happy hour is the bomb with lots of tasty apps to try and Tony two times pizza is my personal favorite and only 7 bucks.It has pepperoni mushrooms,salami and homemade sausage.Dericious!!! If you haven't tried this place you should.

N5fFchYgAjU0ySY5ZMX4ow.text: All styles of pizza and meatballs are great. A must try on everything is the hot pepper olive oil..

JXRrbJntUgULe8nT1bWy1g.text: The pizza was great here. But when I asked for a box and the waitress grabbed what was left of my calamari and threw it away before I could say anything I was a little upset. I was trying to leave, but she said they would make me some more. I waited ten minutes more and she finally brought out a little to go box. I opened it up, and there were four little scraps of calamari, might as well have just told me tough luck, or taken it off my bill. Oh well.

AoMm8a9YisM7WCNt-BC6WA.text: I would give 5 stars but the service has been hit or miss each time I go. The food on the other hand, has always been consistently delicious! They play rock music, obviously in the name. Clearly they serve pizza as well. There are also pastas and lots of different beers, IPAs, stouts, etc.   I've never had to wait to get a seat, although we typically dine at off hours like 4pm. They have happy hour each day from 3-6pm and lots of appetizers and drinks are half off. Who doesn't love that?!  So far my favorite pizzas have been the tomato pie, New Yorker and Detroit red top. The last one is a pretty darn big pizza, enough to feed 4 people. We ALWAYS order the truffle fries which are perfectly crispy and tasty.   One downside is that it is in a casino so smoke does drift in from time to time and it is quite loud with the TVs and slot machines. But you don't go to pizza rock just for the atmosphere, it's the food!

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. Truffle fries, super crispy
Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. New Yorker, half without meat
Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. Kids cheese pizza

vsdKOrNbrftqKee3lPH35w.text: Fantastic food,  ambience,  and service... as always! Love this place! We make it a point to eat here at least once when visiting Vegas!!! Great music,  live music on the weekends,  and as I've said before... the menus are the coolest things I've seen! You just gotta come see this place for yourself. You will not need directions... promise! Follow the smell of fresh... fresh garlic,  fresh pizza crust,  freshly grated cheese all melty ...and gooey ...and delish. It's just that good!

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. Post-Apple Gorgonzola Salad.  When brought it out,  it came with serving utensils? Did they thing I was sharing this salad? Nope...all mine!
Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. Never seem to stray from my faves... Apple Gorgonzola Salad and the deep fried Manhattan Calzone. Once you go fried...
Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. Garlic Garlic Bread... so delish,  they had to throw 2 garlic in the name. Let the feasting begin....

_SjnlubXd-MtrXyPjIEzzQ.text: First of all I have to say that the staff were very friendly.  BUT Holy way to slow down our happy hour hopping!  Like they brought us to a grinding halt.   We were having a blast bouncing from happy hour to happy hour and stopped at Pizza Rock.  It took another over twenty minutes for their happy hour French fries to come out and another 30 minutes to made one personal pizza. I could understand if the place was busy but we were one of set couples in there when we arrived and there were 8 couples by the time we left.  The personal happy hour pizza was delicious. Perfectly cooked and mouth watering.  The frys have that horrible batter that seems to be all the rage in cheaper fast food restaurants.    A French fry is already deep fried.  It does not need an extra grease absorbed batter.  If you're chef who insists on trying to reinvent the French fry please don't!  If you do please also offer for centuries old traditional French fry.  There's nothing wrong with a little rose mary or garlic but stop trying to batter my fries!    In closing I will say that the restaurants motif looks Rock n roll cool and the staff were super friendly. They just need more staff so that they can get orders out at regular restaurant speeds.  So if you have the time, take the time and check out the Green Valley Ranch location.

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. Wow!  With a pizza oven like this you&#39;d swear Liberace cooked there!
Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. Roulette table inside an awesome family styled table.

GdluKvjnDmQ4TvxJEy7rKA.text: Award-winning pizza doesn't make the experience worth it. Horrendous service: no water refills throughout the course. Bussers didn't stop by the table once as they SLOWLY cleaned tables. Server was fairly nice but did not check on us as we did not enjoy the food and we wish we could had shared our concerns. Worst of all: it was some sort of trivia night and they could have not pierce my ears anymore with their microphone feedback (the host allow this to happen multiple times). The trivia night didn't make sense as the music from the casino muddled out the host's voice. Is there a manager to supervise and control the atmosphere and service? I could not identify one..   Now to the food... We opted for the Americano pizza... We were told it had a thick crust, we were surprised it wasn't. The pizza was utterly sloppy and greasy. Everything fell off of the dough... The calamari seem promising but the breading was not one bit crispy and was soggy. The sauces were not as tasty as it had looked in pictures. Everything lacked a kick factor and did not deliver texture-wise. I wish I could have squeezed a WHOLE lemon tree onto the calamari for some complementing flavors but hey, no servers, no bussers, no managers around to assist.  I hardly give one stars but this was one experience that disappointed me so much as I went FAR out of my way to try this award winning spot.

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. Americano pizza.
Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. Calamari and rosemary garlic fries.

MDS47EregT6FYMRBWBffww.text: Wicked good.  Crazy about pizza and this is the new best in town.  The variety is outstanding and there's a pizza here for every taste.

2Mjc6RPjBXJCvHlfYBMCCA.text: Best Gluten Free pizza! They have amazing crusts! There sauces are DELISH! Excellent ambiance and customer service skills! One of our faves!

EUb4WVugAvuSKjfeb0IGUQ.text: What can I say?   Pizza Beer and Rock and Roll.   Big screen tv (multiple) for viewing sports or music vids. Beer selection is awesome.  Love to come here during happy hour because the cook only bakes his award winning Tony Two Times for happy hour.   I do wish they'd offer it at other times and to go.  However it gives me a reason to come sample their latest beer selections.  Pizza menu is extensive and the  pizza lover will not be disappointed

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States

rom5yES4whSNXXhOfQj6fw.text: Best pizza is the Detroit Red Top. I know.. Detroit Pizza? Doesn't New York make the best? Yes, New York does. But this ain't New York. Here the best is that Detroit Pizza! It's thick and square cut. I get it without the garlic drizzle on top because that's just unnecessary.   The restaurant is non smoking but it is open on two sides to the casino where smoking is allowed. You are close to slot machines so if someone has a cigar there while you are eating, you are out of luck. BUT they have a covered outdoor space that's shaded and cooled so you can sit out there even when it's super hot out and you won't be exposed to the smoke.   There's five million beers, many on tap. Kids will like it, too. It has 80's music and a giant truck inside.

QBPxqpFSYPO_Hskn3hewig.text: Really enjoyed my experience here.  The food was good -- I had one of the strombolis -- and so was the vibe and service.  Looking forward to coming again on a future trip!

-LF3kftFZPldEgWn54qewQ.text: I have been wanting to try pizza rock for a while now. Finally went for happy hour and I really enjoyed it. The happy hour prices are great and the food was very good. The service though was lacking. Our server made a comment that she had "17 tables and everyone wants food". Well yes, that's why we come to a restaurant! It took quite a while for the fries and garlic bread to come out.vthere was also a long wait for the pizzas.   We ordered the garlic bread, meatballs, Gorgonzola fries and the CalItalia pizza. The garlic bread was awesome, some of the best I've had. Bread was soft on the inside but crunchy on the outside and it was loaded with garlic. The Gorgonzola fires were also excellent. The flavor was fantastic but I just wished the fries were a little more crispy.  I thought the meatballs were okay, nothing spectacular. The CalItalia pizza was a wonderful combination of three cheeses, fig preserve, prosciutto, shaved Parmesan and a balsamic reduction. The combination of the salty cheese and prosciutto with the sweet fig and balsamic was perfect. My only complaint was the crust was a little underdone for my taste. I will definitely be back for happy hour again.

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. Happy hour size CalItalia.
Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. Gorgonzola fries. Flavor was excellent, wish they were a little more crispy

u7oMRA8LdxXIXuz8ONvzoA.text: Ordered the New Yorker tonight. This pizza is trash. The crust is inedible, bullet proof. The toppings are sparse. Won't make the mistake of ordering pizza from a casino again.

uatphpkFPTxqv64Svfs8Vg.text: Love Pizza Rock. Awesome pizza and drinks. Service was perfect. Great atmosphere. Will definitely return here in the future. A+

Fv_NlWIOZorxndf9lEOTng.text: I ordered Pizza Rock on GrubHub. Didnt want to go out after a 5 day trip out of the country. Pizza on the couch sounded terrific.  Pizza Rock canceled my order with out even calling me because of a simple request I made for half cheese and half without due to a dairy sensitivity.  When I called they said they could do it but that I'd have to reorder and be charged again until the first charge was reimbursed in 5 business days.  Are you kidding me?!?!?! I'll go elsewhere.  And thanks for the crappy service. You've lost my business forever.  Nice work.

ui4-_DCQs2Wx7YJAm66Rdw.text: Let me start by saying... I am from Chicago and I dont like pizza... yes... I know...  This place is INSANE. The crust is the most amazing crust I have ever had and I am literally drooling just thinking about it.   One star off for the slow moving line.   Pizza Rock is a MUST

gsCYr52khPlbGWzaeRfNMg.text: Good spot to enjoy for a fresh pizza pie.  Prices are affordable and the place has a good vibe.  Our waitress was nice, the food was fresh and straight out of the oven. What else could you really ask for from a Pizza joint. Try it.

6Qnu1S2bpsIsGIj5jBjCqQ.text: Pizza Rock is the best pizza restaurant in the city of Las Vegas hands down. Pizza Rock was started by a guy named Tony Gemignani who is a Triple Crown winner of International Pizza Championships in Lecce, Italy. He is also the 2007 World Champion Pizza Maker at the World Pizza Cup in Naples Italy. He's the first American and non-Neapolitan to win. To start I recommend ordering the classic meatballs or the Honey Calabrese sausage. Both are delicious. As far as pizza goes the must try is called "Sausage & Stout" it's made with Honey Malted Guinness Beer Dough, Green Onions, Crushed Red Peppers, Beer Salt and drizzled with a Sweet Guinness Reduction. It's amazing  they only make 23 a day so hurry. Another favorite is the Old Chicago which is outstanding. I get it well done and I add pepperoni. 3rd on my list is the Honey Pie. It has Mozzarella, Calabrese Peppers, Serano Pepper's, Green onions and local honey  topped with fried caramelized onions.! A few other popular choices are the Cal Italia Gold Medal Winner with Asiago, Gorgonzola, Mozzarella, Fig Preserve, Prosciutto di Parma, Parmigiano-Reggiano and Balsamic Reduction!  The Margherita which won the World Pizza Cup in Naples, Italy Has San Marzano Tomato Sauce, Fior di Latte Mozzarella, Fresh Basil, Sea Salt and EVOO. Whatever you do don't go and order a cheese pizza, take a chance step out of your comfort zone and order 1 or 2 of their specialty pizzas. Better yet get some friends or small group and order 3 or 4 different pizzas so you really get the experience. It will change your entire view on pizza!    happy pizza hunting Ciao

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States

oRsnEVIG9fnLhdJCzeaU5w.text: My colleague and I always drive out to Pizza Rock GVR when we're in town for our live events. We're always so happy with the food and we always have a great night sitting at the bar.   On several occasions, Kat and Aaron have been our bar staff and always take care of us. Drinks are well mixed. Bars are clean. We're always offered new plates and water refills.   Kat is extremely pleasant and enjoys the banter of my colleague. Aaron shows great care for the bar and his working environment.   We'll always keep coming back and we're so happy to even be called by our first names.

PX2GqpPJWXrQRSYijsaobw.text: Joe was our server. Will not be back. He came to take our order and never saw him again. The hostess had to get us drinks/ranch/plates. Told the manager what happened and he ran my card and did not seem to care at all. Pizza was ok tasting but nothing special.

kb95pODMmGwHSclfFn8X8Q.text: Cool pizza place! Crazy beer selection so many to choose from! I had a white ale and it was delicious. Lots of pizzas to choose from as well as other good food. It was a little loud but it's inside a casino so I understand. Our waiter was very nice and gave us his recommendations and they were yummy! We had the ranch pizza and it had bacon and chicken! Overall great service, great food, great people!

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. What&#39;s left of our great dinner!

jt7Lk4xSz-WVvli3czxeWA.text: Incredible pizza joint and awesome atmosphere. Visited family in Henderson for 5 days and we got pizza Rock 3 times, one of which was an acoustic Rock Sunday brunch. The Chicago cracker crust was ridiculous good. So good in fact we now think all the pizza joints back home are mediocre at best.

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. Chicago cracker crust...beat pizza ever.

tzTRlo6GD-FH3gZL7SgrZw.text: Hello and welcome to Pizza rock. So this review will be short and sweat. The atmosphere was excellent. the staff worked hard and had our drinks filled and refilled without delay. Pizza was of course really good. I am quite fond of all most of their pizza and the quality of beer choices.  Thanks for dining at Pizza rock. If you don't mind a casino atmosphere just outside the restaurant then check this place out. Beer, Pizza and sports on TV. Oh and trivia.

yZ27SSF8Dm6WhIJ6wfiZ6g.text: Good food, really loud. Too much pie for a single guy so we got leftovers. Ordered the Butcher and it was loaded. Wait staff was very attentive and my water glass never got empty. So if you're up at The District in Green Valley Ranch, stop in here for some pie. The reason I didn't give it a 5, no nutritional information on their menu.

sUmkJQwX4hGBFfAAuDmzRg.text: " Fabulous Pizza, Great Beer and Desserts "  My wife and I visited the Pizza Rock restaurant  located in the Green Valley Ranch Casino in Henderson , Nevada two weeks ago. Resa our server was so pleasant and funny as  she took our order for the Frank Nitti Pizza. We added Pepperoni along with Tomato Sauce, Mozzarella, Provolone, Sauteed Spinach, Garlic, Ricotta, Romano, and Oregano which was $22. The pizza was delicious ! We also had some craft beers which were good. For dessert we had a wonderful Mud Pie and Pecan Turnover which was excellent ! Tommy Pape the manager was also so nice, as he checked on us many times to make sure we were happy with everything.The Pizza Rock definitely Rocks in Henderson Nevada. Check it out !

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. Bar Area
Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. Craft Beers on Tap
Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. Pecan Turnover Dessert

L5Nqe_SIN6AjoeXDV2r3cA.text: We decided to eat here when we were at GVR for a conference and had a lunch break.  The selection of pizza is good as well as salads and sorts.    The Vedura pizza was amazing as well as the Italian Fries and salad.  At lunch time the service was very good, our order was taken quickly and the food came out pretty fast.  Getting our server to refill our drinks was a little bit of a challenge but overall she was very good.   The staff is pretty friendly for the most part and we really enjoyed our experience here.  There are places in town to get pizza which is very comparable at a cheaper price but overall for a casino environment, this place rocks...  Will I come here again, most definitely yes we will be back as the price is worth the quality.  If you are at GVR, this is a good place to eat.

UVddw3qE6qgTW3PqIAQsvA.text: Yum!!! I recently dislocated my shoulder and was unable to cook and drive, so I decided to order food through the bite squad service. I saw Pizza Rock- had never heard of it before- and decided to order because of their great reviews and delicious looking food. I'm glad I did! I ordered the Cal Italia pizza (see photo) as well as the Gorgonzola fries. The flavors in the Cal Italia are incredible and blend together beautifully. The Gorgonzola sauce on the fries isn't overly "cheesy"- really good. All in all, DELISH!!!! The prices are moderate ($19 for the pizza and $8 for the fries), but you get large portions. Very pleased and will definitely be visiting when I can!

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. Cal Italia pizza. Delicious!

52wDhK8w9rKFCFaujPCFog.text: The pizza was just "so-so", not as good what I heard. The service was better than the food and the ambience was the best.   I loved that the DJ was operating from a MAC truck cab live in the joint. Thanks god he didn't honk the horn. Great music and music videos from 80's to current day pop. My group had a lot of fun trying to remember various artists.   We ordered a pizza with pepperoni and sausage, thick crust. We asked if a large was enough for three,  our mistake for not asking specifically how many slices it had. Surprised to have a monster pizza on our table with at least 15 slices. We could have two slices each and be good with that.   Pizza for $30 for three people? I prefer Napoli pizza instead.

N3GjKBZ7W-jMiYkqCNH-Cw.text: Great place to meet up with friends. Pizza definitely rocks. Isn't too pricey and very cozy. Highly recommended!

Deu2HvvRAZ6tr4-prlGypg.text: Great pizza! Service was good.  They had a deejay rocking all the jams which made the experience so much better.  Would definitely go again

tmF2QZZiwo_fblOZeKIXTg.text: Food was really good!!!!! :)   Service was eh. Seemed like our server had too many tables and kind of forgot about us since we were in the corner. She did come by and refill our drinks once.   The food runner that dropped off our pizza forgot about a side of ranch that I asked for.   Overall was an okay experience. Could have been way better if server was around more. But the food was really really good no complaints there. Maybe next time will be better, if I decide to come back.

UO2w2YrbcnxAGtaf1N5zdg.text: Thank you for accommodating my birthday party! The manager reserved the patio just for our group and the staff was super nice. Our waitress was super sweet and the food is always amazing. Every thing was good, the calamari, the green beans, the cal Italian, the prosciutto and arugula salad are some of my favorites.  Again, thank you for being so accommodating!

GSnTK8dXi58adEQh25wPlw.text: Gone here twice.  Had a wait-list both times, but the last time we opted for the pizza-bar.  The wood-fire oven and I were separated by a glass.  It was cool to watch the pizza chef work his magic.  He was very clean and busy the whole time.   The service the first time wasn't up to par, hence the fifth star knocked off, but the last time fiance and I were there, service was superb!  The waitress was super sweet!   Now, I did get a little bitter towards fiance waiting on my pizza.  I assumed, like a dumb-dumb, that all pizzas were going to be made by this pizza chef in front of me.  I was wondering why he wasn't making my pizza and assumed the waitress did not punch in the order.  But there's another kitchen...  Don't worry, I didn't let my hangry self affect my composure towards her.  We ordered the New Yorker the first time - way too big for two people, but was freaking delicious!  Goat cheese was creamy and sausage was the best!  The second time we order the St. Anthony - holy cow, yum-mazing!  It had basil, fennel sausage, and EGGS-over-easy on top!  We mixed the eggs evenly throughout the pizza; it gave it a creamy, yolky flavor.  Definitely a must try!

672zoL4qmDpOi2kg_tvXsQ.text: Great food horrible service.  Sat at bar to place to go order.  Neither of the two female bartenders greeted me.  Ac waitress asked if I needed anything I tikd hey a to go order she said that's the bar tenders job but I'll take your order and let you know.  Nobody asked if I wanted a drink.  Waited for 20 minutes with our a single employee asking if I needed anything.   Maybe it was an off night....

BXFO1MMPUfu3u6k0A7N2PA.text: I almost died eating here. It so hard to resist another slice. I tried many other places but I can't seem to find anything close to pizza rock. The Cal-Italia is so good. Meat balls are great. Food is always consistent.

jqZ7huZCChm9Cod1ZHHY2g.text: Have gone to both the Downtown and Green Valley Ranch locations and were very happy at both. I'll admit we have only eaten the Sausage & Stout pizza. I'll admit it- the menu is extensive. The S&S is beyond amazing and well worth the wait. We have yet to find it not available.

8g9-tPL1EM8yIMr2lu-XDQ.text: I went here with my girlfriend a few days ago and ordered the New Yorker and I already expected it to be great since it was voted "best traditional pizza in the world" that kind of stuck out to me and from that I chose to get it and the cheese was so thickly laced on it, the flavor pops out a lot once you bite into it and that is definitely a pizza I would love to eat again, we left no leftovers and regretted nothing because the pizza was great and the service was great too they took care of us the entire time making sure we had everything we, definitely a place to try if you love pizza.

MQJ0_th2Qzdzlafvtit2PQ.text: Let me first say that their food and drinks were on the verge of excellent, however, their 1 Star rating is due to how the bill was handled. I stopped by on a Sunday night with a friend before he was to drop me off at the airport to fly back to LA. We ordered a regular pizza and 3 drinks. The pepperoni/mushroom pizza was one of the better ones I have had in a very long time. The sauce was very, very flavorful and the drinks were nice. But when the $31+ bill came and I handed her a $100 bill, the waitress only gave me back $68.00 even. Where was the change? I just have an issue when businesses round up the bill in their favor. I am not going to create a possible embarrassing situation for a quarter but the waitress should know her arithmetic.

RaWkz2RnoztIPSUYWidl3w.text: They have a great selection of beer. Their mixed drinks are ok. I was so impressed with the pizza that I brought my family back. Service is ok.... Their pizzas are definitely for big groups or for two with leftovers. The stars are for the pizza. It's really really good. The service is just that bad.

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States

yBQ4_3KSt6Zof1y5_2itBw.text: Bad news for this local hang out!  Often I eat very small meals off the kids menu as it is the perfect portion for me!  First I asked for a small personal sized pizza to which my server Jennifer said "no-you can take the rest home like everyone else" ---hmmm---Then I asked for a kids menu.  Jennifer the advised:  "its called a kids menu for a reason, so no you cant order off of it".   The manager was kind enough to come by to advise that the kids menu is a discounted & designed to lure locals in.   I am a local & all I wanted was  small pizza.  His last advise:  "you know I will just buy you a pizza if that males you happy!".,.,,   Perhaps this Stations Casino Restaurant really doesnt like locals thus contradicting their marketing strategy.  The economy is poopy--I have cash & all I wanted was a small personal pizza!

xekQ7AaKu0N7MRjItCEyKg.text: Came here the night after it opened and WOW! Very impressed with how friendly and knowledgable the staff is. I frequent the Downtown location as the food was on par to their sister location. Same top quality ingredients and service.   Andrew, the bartender is very knowledgable on both beers and food. And holy crap!! 40 beers on tap!!  I would definitely recommend this to anybody in the Henderson area looking for top quality pizza.

vZvoXT9rsU9m7JPBwd65_Q.text: A group of ten of us went there this Sunday, great food and drinks, lots of different pizzas to choose from, I mean you need ten minutes to pick a pizza with all the toppings.  Salads are amazing and the drinks list is incredible, you will have a great time here

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. Martini list
Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. Pizza Rock at GVR

NUL-ephsf5FVhSnnIGGj1g.text: Ate at this location while on a road trip to Vegas and staying at the Green Valley Ranch Hotel.  We got the garlic fries and a gluten free pizza.  Don't get the fries if you have any kind of aversion to bad breath. The garlic sticks with you into the next day. THIS IS THE BEST GLUTEN FREE PIZZA I HAVE EVER HAD. I have been on a gluten free diet for about 5 years now, and finding a gluten free crust that isn't soggy in the center and too crunchy to even eat on the outside has been a challenge.  The gluten free crust at Pizza Rock is down right perfect! I asked for it a little crispy, and it came out with the crust just right and the center was also crispy.  It didn't have the strange flavor that most gluten free crusts have either.   We will be making the drive from SLC to Vegas just for the pizza for sure!

hPG7yQT-xWfme6WakbKJQg.text: This was the most expensive and worst pizza that I ever had.  The pizza that they said was voted best pizza in the world should have been called the burnt tomato paste pizza.  The chicken one was a grade "C" at best.  Never again.

JmVWDEATKM0Pk-h4Y34pgw.text: I lived about 35 years in the New York City area, so I know what great pizza is.....That being said, Pizza Rock pizza was very good (I ordered The Butcher, which is an all meat pizza). My only complaint is, that unless you go during happy hour, they don't offer individual size pizza (the smallest size they have, for a single person, is 12 inch....which is way too much for most people). Other than that, I really enjoyed this place.

7cEh4y9UkikMO7JvgLxcbg.text: Love this place! Great vibe, food and atmosphere. So glad it is in Henderson now! Nice patio too.

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. DJ booth.

U-FXiNGgY29dt2GZGeoOLw.text: I dine here at least 4 times a month. The service has always been excellent and the food is always great. It is prepared in a timely fashion. Occasionally I get the my order to go and it only takes 20 minutes before it is done. I would highly recommend dining here!!!!

R5COIBjn6tO5qUniU7c7_g.text: I have been to this place serval times. It seems like it gets better and better every time. Everything I have had at this place is amazing.

YdD6Hj8aLZ5HOoHygbPtIw.text: I work at the property, so to be fair and transparent. The food is great, my daughter and I go there twice a month (like I said, I work at the property and I eat there with clients more often). This place is not owned or operated by GVR, so there is no reason to boast if they failed. The staff is always great. They are polite and helpful and always treat my daughter well.

szYcVa6Sk2cnVaW2A0-gcw.text: Came here for a friend's birthday. Heard the pizza was aweome. Had a couple drinks before table was ready. Finally got sat. Server was very friendly. We def had a great time. Friends bday was a success. I will be back for sure. I love pizza.

PZp1AVaS9RsKgMt0aG385A.text: So much fun! It was almost like karaoke and pizza combined. We got a seat at the bar, and had fun bartenders. I am partial to east coast thin dough pizza, and ours was perfect. We sang along as we ate, good times!

tSlAfZ5mxTSwhXeGddjrVA.text: I'm so glad Pizza rock has come to Henderson. I went to the one downtown last year and loved it. The one in GVR is also great!! I love the Sicilian pepperoni pizza. If you love pizza, you have got to check it out

HpzaUKjuBe5U54e4HD2eYw.text: Very disappointing experience! The hostess that greeted us was pleasant and friendly. And that's where it went downhill. Our server brought us water and said he just needed to set down his tray and he would be right back. For the next 15 minutes, we watched him bring tables drinks, take orders at another two tables, and begin cleaning a table and never returning to take our order. We went and got the hostess who was kind enough to put in our order. One glass of wine, meatballs and a pizza. When we finally caught our server's attention we asked what happened? He replied that he would have come back but the hostess came and took order. He said the wine would be right out. More time elapses. Out come the meatballs, which although they were tasty, they were lukewarm at best. Still no wine and now we are out of water. Server brings wine to the table behind us. And finally brings my glass of wine. One sip and it was obviously the wrong wine. After waiting to get his attention again, we give up and go to the bar to exchange the wine. The appetizer is finished and still no water. Out comes our pizza which was advertised as the New Yorker. Again tasty but what was supposed to be a charred crust was burnt beyond recognition. The whole outer edge of pizza was inedible. At this point, we were too tired and hungry to send it back. We just ask for our check which he does bring right away. We immediately place our credit card on bill and continue eating. After we had finished eating, he still had not returned to collect payment, so we took it up front to hostess stand to pay. Unfortunately we weren't the only table having difficulty. The table behind us was brought their salad without the grilled chicken they ordered. They were told to go ahead and start on salad, and chicken would be out soon. They were not pleased. This is not an inexpensive neighborhood pizza joint where you expect less than satisfactory service. For the prices they charge, you should expect and receive more. The food was mediocre at best and the service was awful. We will not be back.

GIpbF2GhukbGHDcoRW7y2A.text: Fantastic. The New Yorker with sausage, pepperoni and ricotta had a perfectly crisp yet chewy crust. Awesome craft beer selection. The bartender Kat was excellent, suggesting beers and getting the games we wanted on the Tvs behind the bar.

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. The New Yorker

TYF5hW-5D2qDLOKSYWOgzA.text: Very good food and even better service! We had a reservation and got seated right away. Our waitress was awesome! She came by right even though our whole party wasn't there. She came and sat down and asked if we have been here and what questions we have and got our drink order in. Then she came back with our drinks and to take our order. The food came out great and we didn't wait very long. I wish I knew the waitresses name so I could let her boss know how amazing she is! Def go here!

GSjLn8jLiX3Q9rulIaFq5Q.text: Yum Yum Yum! Different STYLES of pizza...deep dish, New York, cracker crust...what to choose? Located inside GVR Casino, the ambiance is "glam pizza." I ordered a special Sausage and Stout pizza--which the restaurant limits to making 23 per day. If you like sweet mixed with savory, you will love this pizza. A bit pricy, at $28 (generously serves 2), the flavors of the beer crust, the creamy fontina and mozzerella, spicy sausage and sweet Guinness reduction sauce were a favorite even for super-picky RAW, whom I was afraid would have a fit about the "sweet pizza," but he liked it. For another $5 the pizza comes with two pints of Guinness. The house salad is very good--fresh and dry. Served with a creamy basalmic--be sure to ask for extra dressing if you like dressing on your salad...they are a little chintzy, but will gladly give you more.

KLi7yw0caXUpXl7EQ_g5gQ.text: Pizza was bomb, but JoJo made our experience memorable! We'll be back to see her and throw down some ZA..

d_mieY-DRy2Dj5SL4V1LZw.text: I'm from Detroit and never heard of a Detroit Red Top, so my wife and I tried one out of curiosity. It reminded us of a Buddy's pizza, and it was fantastic. When you get to the crust around the edges an uncontrollable smile appears on your face.  It's pricey at $27 for four large slices, but we each only ate one slice and were full. While the food was great, the service was not. It took five or ten minutes for our waitress to reluctantly wander over to our table, and then appeared irritated that she had to take an order. OK, so we will not be ordering alcohol tonight. The hostesses were also dull pencils. It was almost like the staff had just received a lecture from the boss and were all mad about something. With decent service this would have been a five star rating. The Fremont area downtown location has much friendlier staff.

FoNip8l-pzgG7Kx_bIBOcw.text: Pizza is very good, they have so many options it's hard to choose. Great ambiance. Love the music and videos. Love the location at GVR, service could have been better. But I'm getting used to really shitty service in this town which is sad because that's what vegas is all about.

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. Cool videos. Good music.

XwJQsox8pXjWCmCMFjXQ0Q.text: It was out first time eating here. Food was good. The atmosphere was awesome. Kids had a decent sized meal. Ice tea was super strong. Only gripe is they brought all the food out separately. Pizza was dropped off and we waited about 8 minutes before my daughters spaghetti came out. We didn't want to eat without her. Other than that. It was pretty ok.

CUUcyxiQkt7N6il841WjFw.text: Great place to get pizza and watch games! The pizza was great but the service lacked a bit. I still love this spot and location so I will continue to give it a shot. I recommend the Giacanna pizza, it is great! The patio is nice with a couple Tv's for some game viewing. I'm happy for anything new in green valley ranch.

ZsnbMWe5V3PQTMynlXUCqA.text: Food is excellent. The Sicilian takes a bit long to make but it's worth it!  Service was spot on and everyone there was super friendly. A bit noisy but that's the vibe they are going with. Would definitely recommend for a great outing with friends not so much with little kids.

ieuMvq_MytwUY3UrSWkXBw.text: Came here for lunch, have to say I was sad to see Quinn's go. But they had a great drink selection and the pizza was great. Our server was awesome and even took our garlic bread off the bill when she realized it was a little over done.   Can't wait to come back and try all their other pizzas. Hardest part was deciding what to order!

v7tOaQkeVwTYjW8-vrttUg.text: Sorry pizza rock. I wanted to love you bc I love pizza and you are so close to where I live :( we got the New Yorker and it was just Ok. Not enough cheese some spots had no cheese at all! Also pretty overpriced: one pizza, one soda, and calamari appetizer = 50$ Two stars bc I did like the slightly crispy crust and the server was nice.

YQEwISfEv6ttv2EDQfM-RQ.text: Good pizza, not great. Prices are very high even though it's in gvr, and the drink glasses are tiny. Rather go to Metro down the road.

jAUt7Sf-xUS5-YEO_F1-8w.text: Pizza Rock is always a must whenever I'm in Vegas. This new location at GVR is just as great. It's fun, the staff is friendly and personable, the food is amazing and there is a lot of variety to the menu!

_oEvWa6Uxs05wat_d3LPCw.text: Went to Pizza Rock expecting--hold on to your hats--pizza. What we got was...well, I have no idea what it was. What I expect from pizza is cheese. There was no cheese. The manager--when we inquired as to the reason for the absence of cheese--looked at us with pity, as it was apparent that we were unenlightened miscreants. It was not good. If you're looking for pizza...keep looking!

89A8j7gWcUuaP8wkdhl8rw.text: Great atmosphere here! The pizza is awesome! The best pizza is the Guinness pizza, once you eat that pizza, it's the only pizza you'll order. The meatballs are also delicious. Everyone from the bussers to the manager, are all accommodating and friendly. They really want you to enjoy your experience eating here!

AXqHuFznl2nnsj92ZHbucg.text: At my daughter's suggestion we came here to enjoy a mess free Thanksgiving brunch. FANTASTIC!   One of the best pizzeria joints I've been to.  And our server Brandt was top notch.  Look forward to our return.

Gph6H3f9YT4jw82KqFYV3A.text: Pizza was fine and the atmosphere cool. But my 2 star rating is because the bartender overcharged me for drinks. When I brought it to her attention, she was totally unapologetic and didn't say sorry, didn't offer to fix it - nothing. A real shame. I am staying as a guest at the hotel and I will be mentioning this to management.

jkJqyfKFUthrYbgwsTDDUA.text: Enjoyed the Americano pizza and the extensive beer selection! We will be returning next time we are in the area of GVR.

GyAAn06W84OtCHXBJB19NA.text: The food was very good! If you're looking for great pizza this place has it. The 3 star rating is due to slow/aloof service, bad dessert and smokey atmosphere. Our server, Guillermo wasn't very attentive. I was without any kind of drink for 30+ minutes during the meal. We also waited for the bill for an excessive amount of time. Good thing we didn't have a show or movie tickets! I got the dessert calzone which was not even warm and still had raw dough in the center. So disappointing! Pizza Rock is open to the casino so the cigarette smoke just travels right in. I think they should have closed the restaurant off to avoid this issue. It was a busy Friday night so maybe this is not a problem all the time. The experience as a whole was just okay. I wouldn't drive far to get here. However, the food is good.

z0NFbxD1_n3GI4pPov7Dtg.text: No they apparently closed last call 1:30am. And if you are fortunate to get food they are overpriced, rude. And for some reason don't carry salt only Parmesan and black pepper. I don't recommend!!!

s-C8ghLHJK6qC9kyb9Td7w.text: Pizza Rock is my favorite pizza restaurant in Las Vegas. The staff has alway been fast and polite. In my opinion they make the best pizza in town. My favorite pizza is the vedura. It's a veggie pizza cooked to perfection. They also have great happy hour specials.

K40_h7yxUmYqh-9BhQ3b3w.text: Went to GVR with the husband. He got a pizza, I had lasagna. Lasagna had bacon in it!!! Only problem, it was really loud.

VwrS2nSU4NbJMT_WiNWcCg.text: One of the best pizza I have completely consumed in many years. They  have one of the best selection of craft beer on tap anywhere in Las Vegas valley.

jaQZ8HS87Ap1_uEFECQiSA.text: Really great, creative pizza while still maintaining great pizza traditions. Pizza is great but I never feel like I get amazing service. It's not awful, just rarely special. will continue to come back, again and again.

e3KSt9s5FITSAVh_KCgA6A.text: Great beer selection and cocktails. The food is spectacular. I really hope Henderson is a me to support such a unique establishment. Our service was amazing, the food was great and the drinks/beer were excellent.

8escZnDf9J0DvXNpGdJAng.text: So I've been to the downtown location multiple times and I've been to this one three times now. The first two visits were fine, but this last one was pretty bad. The previous time I came in, the place was packed with a 30+ minute wait. This time, it was almost dead inside.   We sat at the bar. Our bartender never introduced himself, but the check said Josh, so I'm assuming that was our guy - black spiked hair, triangular sideburns. It was pretty much an all out fail this last time. There were about a half dozen employees hanging out at the end of the bar, looking bored. They were slinging racist jokes and dropping F bombs, just a few feet away from us! Real classy. I couldn't help but wonder where the hell management was at!   We got two beers, which BOTH had some kind of mystery "floaties" in them, after which we were eyeballing our plates and flatware. Pizza took a long time and was bland. We got a large house salad which was entirely lettuce. Literally, there was like one piece of onion and a half a slice of tomato. Inattentive, unpleasant service when there was no one in there, bland food, dirty dishes...The only reason I'm giving three stars is the other two times the pizza was good and service was fine. They do also have a healthy beer selection. Just an off night I guess, but if that was my first time I would never come back! Management, crack the whip! You haven't been open long enough to be this lazy! I'll give it a break for a while or just stick to the downtown location which has always been fine.  P.S. The cheese in their caprese salad is breaded and fried, which is not mentioned on the menu. On the menu, it reads like a normal caprese. I did not like the fried spin on it.

3D08wz0-3sBoxe3ZtpchaA.text: We had a reservation so we got in right away.  It was pretty crowded.  The music IS too loud as I read on the other reviews... they need to dial it down.  The Lasagna is billed on the menu as "It's Huge"! It was NOT huge.  The serving was no bigger than in any other restaurant.  We mentioned that to our server and she admitted that the Lasagna served in their Downtown location was bigger.  Now people if you're going to bother to put it in writing on the menu it better be "huge" otherwise you just look ridiculous.  My husband's dinner came out first and I had to wait 20 minutes for mine to show up.  Not very professional.  Either serve them together or serve them at the same time!!!  There is no other choice.  That's just common sense.    In their defense I must say the food was Excellent.  The Lasagna tasted very Fresh with a hint of Sausage Flavor.  The Stromboli was amazing.  Now That was Huge!.    They just need to work out the kinks.  Turn down the music, serve the meals all at the same time and never promise something you can't deliver.

S66rb2UtxFCUCJetRInfRg.text: This is some of the best pizza I've ever had. The atmosphere was cool (loud music, younger crowd) and the service was great.

Ef9-ChXUpvJlNOxyyN01IQ.text: Service is super slow & crappy, we had 4 different waiters trying to drop off food we didn't order, salt overkill on the calamari & been waiting for desert for over 20 mins. Do yourself a favor and go to the downtown location

DwnzaFPhMkO0FrGT-CVpCg.text: They took my cellphone to text me when my table was ready. Never got a text --they said they didnt have a number but i gave it to the lady three times. Food was just ok. House salad needed more dressing & some other kind of greens.

jUv8Jl21ftJIzuww-EyAwA.text: Had the trio of meatballs (Great! not too dense) and the Margarita Pizza with Bacon and Pepperoni on my half (Fantastic!! The dough is amazing and the sauce is awesome!)

aFEOcKznzupv0Ovf5VNZ4A.text: I lived in NY most of my life and I missed NY style pizza. Not anymore. This Pizza really rocks. Crispy meaty and delicious. Service by Nick our server was outstanding. Definitely recommend this place. It will be our go to place. .......PIZZA ROCK

AUmjHxo7cdckjuaF85oQug.text: Both locations are awesome. Although the one at Green Valley Ranch is obviously much easier for the local crowd. Pro tip: the New Yorker is awesome for the pepperoni and meat crowd. Plenty of other good stuff on the menu as well.   Only room for improvement would be the ability to order half or quarter pies, since the wife and I have very different tastes. But I know Mr. Award Winner Pizza Rock don't want to be hearing that noise!

AZFalzi5CtmPVjznIx4EZg.text: Been wanting to check this place out for a while now. We came on a Sunday and opted for pizza even though they also have a brunch menu during weekends with unlimited cocktails. The variety of pizzas was really extensive and based on their choice of ingredients, a lot of thought was put into creating the menu selections.   We started with the Calamari friti (half original, half Calabrese...which is spicy) and got the thin crust, award-winning New Yorker (Mozzarella, tomato, link sausage, garlic, pepperoni and ricotta). Totally loved it. The Linguini and clams was perfectly seasoned. Can't wait to come back and try other things on the menu. Great service.  It is located within the Green Valley Ranch property which is good since we like visiting the area. Nicely decorated interiors with a "rock" vibe. There is a semi truck and trailer incorporated in the interior design and serves and the command center for the music and videos playing on the wide screens all over the restaurant.

rKlgbEZY1TztttQgjksUvg.text: So my man and i stopped in for lunch today as i have been very excited for it to open, and what better way to watch college basketball than over a hot pizza?   Anyway the food was good. We got the four meat pizza with goat cheese, arugula, and these tiny sweet red peppers that look like teardrops... So good! But then again, it really is hard to go wrong with prosciutto. We also split the Caesar salad which was a little underdressed, but otherwise fresh and delicious.   Atmosphere was good, not too crowded and  not too loud. Good tvs for watching sports. The only reason it isn't a 5-star is the service was decent, but not great.   However, I'm hoping to check out a $7 signature personal pizza and a $2 off glass of wine during happy hour (early or latenight) and be able to bump this up to a 5!  So then, if you live in the area, it is definitely worth checking out.

L325ONfbjI9eocJx9AU37w.text: I haven't been to the other locations but it smelled so good in GVR that I had to try it and it did not disappoint.  We had the New Yorker but it was a hard choice because a lot of them sounded good.  Fresh ingredients, great tasting sauce, perfect crust.  This is definitely my new favorite pizza.  The service was friendly and very attentive.  The only reason I didn't give them 5 stars is because it is a little pricey.  The pizza and two Pepsis were $33.00.

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States

3_ktVQ1ioVodpcQmMYJz1w.text: Pizza Rock's newest locale inside Green Valley Ranch was a bold move. Sometimes we patrons out here in Henderson are passed over in favor of the glitz and glamour of the Strip, so we're stuck with whomever decides to grace us with their culinary presence.  Well thank goodness Tony Gemignani and crew did, because the food is incredible. We started with the meatball appetizers - amazing. The meatball is dense enough to get a good bite, but not so dense that it's dry. The gravy (sauce) is amazingly robust without being too acidic. Plus it has just the right amount of chunks of tomato in it.  We moved on to the Fried Green Tomato Caprese. The tomato is bathed in a beautiful corn meal crust, fried lightly, and bedded on top of generous chunks of mozzarella with basil and a perfect balsamic reduction. This was a definite plate licker.  The beer selection is amazing for a 'pizza joint'. Lots of good selection on tap - ask your server for their recommendations! Beer turns over quickly here, so don't be sad if something is out.  We moved on to the New Yorker (amazing! STOP modifying this pizza, people!) with it's lovely mounds of fresh ricotta that meld with everything once you fold that pie and take a bite (you better be folding these slices!). My husband also ordered the pear and prosciutto and that was a great take on a creative twist.   The atmosphere is really great, the flow is pleasing and the wait staff is surprisingly attentive and polite. Great job Pizza Rock!

HyaUb3NC89dMHIFR2EdLoQ.text: Wow, the sauce on this pizza is fantastic. Everything worked so well together. I would rate this place over Grimaldi's for east coast style pizza because of the higher quality ingredients. Easy parking and a nice place to watch the game seals the deal.

2a_Esy8bdjuYquZYby28oQ.text: Came in for their Sunday Brunch (11am-3pm) based off the bartenders recommendation (Andrew and Jojo) and the food was phenomenal! My fiance got the Pizza Rock Benedict and I had the Double Sausage and Egg Pizza. The also have bottomless Mimosa's and Sangria for $15 and a killer 22 oz Bloody Mary with bacon for $10. We are already regulars here and their brunch just gives us another reason to come back more often. The manager Tommy (as always) made it a point to stop by and say hello. Great job again team! We are so glad to have you so close to us. Finally a great place in GVR to visit!

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. Hanging out @ Pizza Rock
Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. Sunday Brunch Menu
Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. Double sausage and egg pizza with a bloody mary

4ESQTxmjcMnem_Q37DZWyQ.text: Best pizza ever! The artichoke joe pizza was the bomb. Tony was our server, he was fun and so great. Best service ever!

xlcC75YrHhln2pmgpA7i7w.text: Service was good, bar is fun pizza is pretty good.  I think I was expecting something different/exceptional. ;) But food was good and the atmosphere/ music is better than a regular pizza place.

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. Not mine lol
Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. Yum! Margarita pizza!

MZKxcDlR6gr4q3EC_yfNGg.text: The placed was rammed so we sat outside, not ideal on a hot day.   Service was good, knowledgeable on the ales.   For the price I was disappointed with my Chicago pizza but the missus liked hers.   After spending the best part of $100 on two pizzas and a few beers I don't think I will be back again.   Shame.

WSlekKVlzN0Bgws7KrJjJQ.text: Lived up to all the hype. I want to give this place 4.75 stars.....c'mon YELP, change ur rating system. But the food, decour, service, and of course the pies were amazing.  Went here for lunch with 2 other guys. Ordered two pizzas; the pizza Campari and the Margherita pizza and a large house salad. They only make 73 or so of the Margherita a day. The waitress wasn't exactly sure why, thought it was something to do with superstition of when the chef won a pizza competition. I thought it had to do with the dough or the mozzarella, both of which were so delicious and fresh.  The portion size was perfect, the brick oven crust had just the right amount of char, and the toppings were bursting with flavor. All pizza is delicious to me, good, bad, hot and cheesy, cold and chewy, thick crust, thin crust, its all yum. But if you want to treat your taste buds like taste bros, then you have to try out this pizza spot.  Love love loved it.

ZBumQktzmuc6H7FENAwdLQ.text: This is my family's favorite new pizza place. The food is consistently excellent and the service is great! We have dined here 15 times in the last six months and tried the salads, different pizzas and pastas as well as beer on draft, cocktails, and wine, and we have been very pleased overall with everything we've ordered. The music is loud so if you're looking for a place to have a conversation while dining you may want to go somewhere quieter, otherwise the atmosphere is fun and hip. Highly recommended!

mksIxF1uB5Emg-OZ6Errfg.text: So happy to have Pizza Rock closer to home! Same amazing pizza's! I've tried so many and never had a bad one. My favorites are the Sausage and Stout pizza, the Butcher and the New Yorker. Can't go wrong with the Sam Giacana or Michigan Ave. either!! The spicy calamari is delicious, though I wish they'd go back to the smaller pieces bc sometimes the larger calamari don't get crispy enough. Amazing happy hour specials too!!

csuqzl27CAKCAKBCxJ31ww.text: Updated review, haven't been here often because of the gym. Figured I'd update it for labor day weekend. Just had the meatballs and the New Yorker. Clicked update and saw our review was labor day last year, meatballs and the New Yorker.  I think it was better this time!!!

tHFoDIugUWlCFPPoPSWknQ.text: Finally GVR has some great restaurants going in! Pizza Rock is pretty awesome! Clean and fun environment. Try the Old Chicago Pizza! It's pretty tasty. Would love it if the music got turned down just a bit. Just hard to talk over.

uG-b_1snad0Ri47-8MTQQw.text: I've been here multiple times, and every time the service is awful. It's extremely slow and inefficient. The food is not that great and it comes in extremely large proportions, that I usually just end up taking home and throwing away. Highly would not recommend this place.

Pcu8YtwJ27pMYeBZSvqqOw.text: This place is being rated as a takeout restaurant .I am the takeout king of Las Vegas and will not rate the delivery because usually outside company's are delivering these days and it comes down to the driver and the dispatcher having good days bad days or are incompetent .It is important to note , of course most food tastes better eaten in the restaurant , than waiting to eat it 20 to 30 minutes later on or getting reheated .Also being a sports fan ,I rate reviews with Yeahs and Boos. This a regular take out for me . My favorite menu item here is the Calamari . It is tender and fresh and fried lightly to perfection . The Calabrese sauce is just spicy enough and they also give you their homemade marinara sauce option for dipping .  I don;t care much for their pasta or sandwiches which are average at best but like everything on the menu , a bit pricey for Italian takeout . now I'll pay extra for something special like the Calamari and pizza but not for average food .  Speaking of Pizza , I have tried 3 types so far . The New Yorker , The Mob Boss and the New Haven style clams and garlic thin crust . Starting with my least favorite the Clam garlic is very tasty but I do know of at least 2 places back in New York that make this much better. The Mob Boss is very good with plenty of fresh ingredients for toppings . The New Yorker is fantastic ,a real work of art . Extremely flavorful , I can see why this pie has won many awards .   So one boo for the Pasta and pricing and 5 yeahs for the rest equals and nice 4 star rating , maybe 4 1/2 stars

e3N6Vwxefx9YOPeeYbxmZQ.text: Amazing food and our server, Nick is WONDERFUL. You won't be disappointed. We enjoyed the Cracker Crust pizza and red wine, on Monday it's a BOGO on pizza.

9eBmi75TyK6qtC_N1fuFww.text: Ordered the fried green beans, and the beer battered artichokes as appetizers both great choices wish the artichokes had more it was that good! The main course was the "La Regina" and it was probably the best pizza I've ever had in my life no exaggeration, very filling while not being heavy! Ryan was our server very friendly, efficient, very knowledgeable! 10 out of 10 would definitely come back and order it again and again and request Ryan he's very attentive!

O_BdfodcO1VUsBOxunSTqg.text: Everyone has different opinions on what is or isn't good. With that being said,I think they have great pizza. The only thing I didn't like was the fennel sausage. I just don't like the taste of fennel sausage lol.

Mp0uR4BemFvugn_xIV4Lqg.text: It's 11:50 pm and I have now been waiting almost 50 minutes for a meatball sub.  About every 20 minutes they come out and explain to me a different problem.  The first time they supposedly left it in the oven too long and burned it.  They said a new one would be out in 5 minutes.  Over 10 minutes later they brought out a sub with cold meatballs and unmelted cheese.  They said they would fire it for another 5 minutes.  15 minutes later the bartender said they burned it again.  The manager came out and contradicted her and said the bread got soggy from the cold meatballs.  She seemed very intent on justifying why the sub was taking so long.  Seemed surprise that I really didn't care.  They did comp my sub and drink.  I would rather have the last hour of my life back.

5k9ARHdJlP9b1grRTe7cVA.text: First time at GVR location, and for happy hour. I'm impressed with the decor here, it's upscale in a subtle way. Bar was packed and I got the last seat next to a somewhat intoxicated fellow. I had a $7 happy hour pizza with pepperoni, sausage, mushrooms. Was most yummy and almost worth $7. More of a snack sized pizza but a good way to try a few different kinds! Happy hour drinks are plenty and at $5 for a draft, I passed. The beer selection is excellent though & I wish you could get these drafts while playing!  They have Banger, Crafthaus, Bad Beat, Joseph James! Gonna try a few sometime, maybe at the late night happy hour at 10 every night!

fk6Ww8nYCS8mUM6p1ErfQg.text: We had heard that the wait times for this location were very long, so I made a reservation on Open Table.  We were seated almost immediately at a high top table with a good view of the guys throwing pizza dough which is always entertaining.  Service was good, their beer menu vast, and their food menu intriguing.    We had a hard time deciding, so we went with traditional pizza joint staples, figuring that we could be more adventurous on future visits if we liked the standards. We started with the House Salad: Mixed Greens, Cherry Tomatoes, Red Onions, Mozzarella Cheese, Croutons, and Balsamic Vinaigrette $10.  The presentation was nice and was served family style. It was a basic salad, but also very good.  All the ingredients were fresh and flavorful.  Then we went for the New Yorker Pizza $25- a 16" round pie, with a lightly charred crust, Sliced Mozzarella, Tomato Sauce, Sliced House Link Sausage, Garlic, Pepperoni, and Ricotta cooked in a 700 Degree Electric Brick Oven (some of their pizzas are cooked in a 550 degree gas brick oven, some in 700 degree electric brick oven, and some in a 900 degree wood fire oven).  The menu said this pie was the "Winner, Best Traditional in the World, Vegas", so it seemed like a good choice.  The flavors on this pie all worked really well together.  The sauce was more acidic than sweet (how I like it) and the ricotta was very smooth unlike most places where it has a more gritty texture.  The pepperoni was also cut small and thick.  It was very good and tasted nothing like pizza chain pepperoni!   We enjoyed this place and will be back to try something more adventurous!
