sSB-kh45mVdRDCbHP5LOuQ.text: Got delivery for the New Yorker. Delivery guy was a bit late, but he kept apologizing and said he had the wrong place. No worries there. It happens. Pizza was good but was burnt on one side. It look like they kept it too close to one side of the oven. I'd try it again, but not more if the issues keep up.

akrl7NLTfnuKSHg8sSBsJQ.text: Love this restaurant! Being from Buffalo I am picky about my pizza and this place passes the test. I've been here several times and have enjoyed every pizza I have tried.  I love that they opened this location because it is so much closer to work and I don't have to go downtown whenever I want some of their pizza.   We started off by ordering the meatballs. This is a must have everytime I go to the restaurant. You need to try them! They are my favorite meatballs of all time. They are so soft and melt in your mouth. The sauce is also to die for and is half of the reason why I enjoy them so much. I almost wish they would serve pizza with a side of this sauce so I could drunk the crust in it.   Yesterday we decided to order the Sicilian with pepperoni and banana hot peppers. It was really good! The pizza is thick so if you are not a fan of having doughy pizza I would try a different pizza on the menu. Luckily I really enjoy thick pizza so I enjoyed it. The only thing I could have asked more of was the sauce. Their sauce is so good that I wish the pizza had a little more on it.  We finished the meal with the apple calzone. It was two tiny calzones with apple inside and caramel drizzle on top. It was served with a small scoop of vanilla bean ice cream. It was good and was a smaller portion so I didn't feel over guilty about indulging in a few bites.   If you're looking for a new pizza place to try in the Hendreson area I recommend Pizza Rock!

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. Sicilian pizza

Fg3yCniRTq02EnuiHtotSg.text: Visiting from out of town I saw a review for this place and had to try it! We waited awhile in between ordering our drinks and actual food. The place nor the bar were very busy, so I wasn't sure why 1 glass of wine and 2 vodka/tonics took almost 10 minutes to wait. Aside from that the food was some of the best I have had in my life. We ordered the artichoke hearts for the appitizer. They were beer battered to perfection and had a great dipping sauce.   The pizza was the absolute winner of the afternoon. We ordered the sausage and Guinness pizza because it sounded odd and different, so we thought why not!  Oh.My.God.  Words cannot describe how tasty this pizza was. I shed a tear when the last slice was eaten. It was that good.   Our next trip out we will for sure be back to try other items on the menu. Food, music, funky decor, what more could you ask for!

nV6dST3GW-MPwKvp0Kt6qA.text: The New Yorker is hands down the best pizza pie I have ever tasted. The sauce is sweet yet rich in flavor. All of the toppings compliment each other like a world class orchestra .  I have judged pies all over the world and this my friends tops the Pie Chart Always request your pies "well done"

BFn_dCL63JLIYbsrxATSBg.text: Their pizza did not disappoint. However the service did.   I have visited the downtown location a few times. We wanted to check out this location in GVR.  We had planned it to take advantage of the happy hour specials. It wasn't very busy and were seated immediately.  They have a large dining area with plenty of seating.    Positive points- the Gorgonzola fries are amazing. I love the cheese sauce covering the fries.  And they weren't skimpy on the sauce! The Chicago Cracker Thin Sam Giancana Pizza is delicious. Their sauce has a fresh unique flavor.  This combined with the provolone, sausage and garlic makes it a fabulous tasting pizza.    Room for improvement- service was lacking a bit.  It took a while for him to even greet us.  By the time he came over, we were ready to order.  It also took a while for him to remember drink refills.  When our bill came, the price on an item was higher than states on the menu.  I had to show him what the price should be.   I'll come back for the food. I'm keeping my fingers crossed for better service.

sZrchtdx3cWgK8ClpTKJaA.text: The food was great but the service was lacking. We had 5 different people bring us our items and the only thing our server actually brought us was our water refills. There was only 2 of us in our group and our server seemed more concerned with her larger table in our area. After waiting 15-20 minutes and finishing our appetizer (which she didn't serve us our check on us during) we finally asked the server for the table next to us if she could take our drink order.  When we placed our order initially with our server we asked her if she could give us a few minutes to look over the beer menu but asked for waters while we waited. Our server came and checked on us half way through our main course (that she didn't bring either) that is when we ordered refills for our near empty waters. She jumped right on it and we had those within 8-10 minutes. The other server in our section was in our area frequently. Over all it seemed like poor planning/scheduling for the serving staff. They should have planned better knowing it was MNF and also the promo for the Knights game.

eExFGEIlWEbjso63ncrndg.text: Love love love this place. Amazing happy hour and the truffle fries are great! I really enjoy that there are so many different types of pizzas in several ovens.

CIj48ZmC12jhJg1q23wbhQ.text: Now approaching four years at Green Valley Ranch Resort Spa and Casino it was in celebration of National Pizza Day that seats were taken at Pizza Rock, the same table earmarked for eight guests in April 2016 this time hosting six including a young boy who was kept entertained by an ADHD-inducing stream of people doing stupid things on CHIVE TV displayed across several televisions.  Largely unchanged through the intervening years, Tony Gemignani's team still in charge of several ovens while front-of-house is competent but mostly perfunctory in terms of service, it was following a group of conventioners that guests were seated at 11:30am, approximately 50% of the Restaurant's 200+ seats filled an hour later as Soundgarden, Pearl Jam and R.E.M. played at modest volume.  Spread across a lengthy space with everything from a big truck to bar area, the menu equally expansive with Pizza-styles from New York to California and Naples represented, it was after clarifying both the order and timing that Drinks were filled, Iced Tea for many instead of Pepsi products while others simply drank Water that was kept full across the ninety-minute visit.  Slow to get started, NCAA Basketball plus live NHL action and conversation filling the time, it was after perhaps half-an-hour that two Pizzas arrived simultaneously, an "Old Chicago" baked in brick with gas outperforming any Midwestern "Bar Pie" thanks to unbleached Flour that maintains a lot of tooth beneath piped Ricotta, Sausage and Meatballs while a touch of Cheddar provides just enough Salt to brighten a thin layer of Tomato Sauce.  Not skimping on Ingredients, the $26 "New Yorker" placed on a stand next to its Windy City cousin loaded with Meat and Cheese, guests in search of a great "Slice" will be delighted to see Tony's Award Winning Pie blistered and bubbly, the ability to stand up with barely a fold attesting to quality Flour and evenly heated ovens while housemade Fennel Sausage adds a lingering herbal essence that plays well off the char.  Finishing every bite of round one, specifically requesting two additional Pies be fired twenty minutes later preventing a log-jam previously experienced both at Pizza Rock GVR and DTLV, it was as trays were cleared that Cal Italia and Detroit Red Top were presented, the award-winning former expectedly sweet but brilliantly balanced inside a delicate Cornicione while Mo-Town's recently resurgent style showed Gemignani to be ahead of the curve as he's been offering this buttey pillow almost fully encased in Cheese and striped with Marinara since opening at the Downtown Grand in 2013.  Disappointed to learn that Brunch is only offered on Sunday, the French Toast targeted as Dessert thus unavailable while Pizza Rock's Mud Pie wasn't "ready yet" at 1:00pm, it was in consolation that four Zeppole were offered, Tony's Flour frying up more like a Beignet with great texture and pronounced Cardamom that paired well with both lemony Cream and thick Caramel but less-so Dark Chocolate Sauce.     FOUR STARS:  Every-bit deserving of his myriad accolades it is great to see Tony Gemignani succeeding across multiple Las Vegas venues, the owner's hands-on approach undoubtedly on display in a kitchen from which every Pie both looks and tastes as it should, though the FOH still seems a bit robotic and being "out of" menu items (save for those listed as being in limited supply) is unacceptable.

vO31373BYqnzcQru7-AfLA.text: My first visit to the newer GVR location, but a couple visits to the Downtown venue have always left a satisfied impression.  Pizza Rock is extremely versatile, in that they create multiple types of pizza, all at high execution. No disappointing bite to be had.  You can go with the classics :  New Yorker : Sliced Mozzarella, Tomato Sauce, Fennel Sausage, Pepperoni, Garlic, EVOO, Oregano, Romano & Ricotta. The classic done well, this one with all my favorites on top!  Old Chicago : Sliced Meatballs, Italian Sausage, Ricotta, Tomato Sauce, Mozzarella, White Cheddar, Provolone, Garlic, EVOO, Romano & Oregano. Thin, crispy and again, well done :)  Or you can try something different :  Cal Italia : Asiago, Gorgonzola, Mozzarella, Fig Preserves, Prosciutto di Parma, Parmigiano-Reggiano & Balsamic Reduction. Perfect combination of salty and sweet, with a bubbly, almost hollow crust.  But you'd be hard pressed to find a much better bite than the :  Detroit Red Top : White Cheddar, Wisconsin Brick Cheese, Butter Toasted Corners, Marinara, Garlic Oil, Romano & Oregano. Excellent! Crispy cheese baked under the crust and spilling over edge! Heavy but worth every bite :D  Enjoy!

Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. Cal Italia : Asiago, Gorgonzola, Mozzarella, Fig Preserves, Prosciutto di Parma, Parmigiano-Reggiano &amp; Balsamic Reduction. Salty &amp; Sweet!

PovZnAlbgRudv5RUSQCdHQ.text: Out of all the eatery/bars in GVR, I would have to say Pizza Rock would be my favorite. Why? Well first of all the smell lingering next to and inside this eatery is absolutely mesmerizing. Pizza isn't even my go-to when I buzzed or hangry, but when we initially walked but this place I just had to have a pizza slice for dinner that night. Plus, I loved the hip hop that was blasting through the bass filled speakers- so yes I told myself we were going to eat/drink there after hitting the craps table.  The menu is quite large so they offer basically any combination imaginable. If it's not on the menu then I'm sure they can create it. This night, I wanted to be super basic and order a simple pepperoni pizza. I figured if their most basic pizza was bomb, then everything else coming out that kitchen would be good too. And yup, I was right- this pizza was freakin' delish and had tons of pepperoni pieces all over. Huge plus is that the pizza wasn't that oily after doing the napkin test.   So if you're ever buzzed/borderline drunk at GVR and you're deciding on which place to eat- hit up Pizza Rock.

0JrIgj1qKuoAnW0hjxU3gw.text: We love Pizza Rock! I do the pepperoni and build my own with veggies. We recommend the white sauce too. Good draft selection as well.   During sports events, the TVs can get really loud especially on the patio. It was a little too much. Service is generally good, but sometimes they can get busy so be patient.

oLGe_KkQGOP7vAi7on3_ag.text: My family ordered delivery via Postmates and thought it was decent. My father really likes the pizza so that's why we ate from there. My mom got the bucatini and liked it. But the sauce had spilled all over the bag and box. I had a stromboli and thought it was okay. I don't think I would order it again, however the portion was huge. Also the sauce had spilled all in the box so the dough was soggy by the time it got to me. We ordered two salads, one single and one that was family size and both came as single orders... so that was kinda annoying. I'm down to try Pizza Rock again to give it another chance. In my opinion, you should stick to getting the pizza though from the menu!

FQJg1ty7ZqrqAwRZTqTOuw.text: Like many, I too have eaten at the downtown location. I will say that the pizza quality is pretty much identical to that of the downtown location. What separates the location is service. The service here was subpar at best.  To start, this location is located inside the Green Valley Ranch Casino. We sat at a table that had a roulette wheel in the middle of it. Pretty cool. The layout is very spacious.   Upon our arrival to the table, we let our server know that we would be split up into four separate checks for the eight of us. He seemed to be okay w/ it. As we ordered drinks, we looked over the menu. Since we all knew what they had it was easy to order. By the time he came back to take our food order, one of my friends had finished his Diet Pepsi. The server recognized that and look at him 'Diet Pepsi?'. However another 5-10 minutes went by and the server came to check on us again. He saw that another friend had finished his drink too. He looked at him 'Pepsi?' As he nodded, my other friend raised his empty glass 'Diet Pepsi please?' About another 5 minutes went by before they had their refills. Shortly after the food arrived.   I hadn't tried the wings at Pizza Rock yet. My friend offered me one to try. They ordered buffalo wings. They weren't soaked in it, just enough that you could hear/feel the crispy bite. Def the right way to make them to have w/ an ice cold beer. Pepperoni, Veggie and a New Yorker covered the table. I got the personal pizza.   About 10 minutes after our food came the server stopped by to see if we needed anything. I told the server I wanted to get a personal pizza to go and some boxes for my friends. It was awhile before we saw our server again. When he came back he handed me a box w/ a New Yorker as if to say it was my personal pizza I ordered. Nope. I handed the box to my friends that ordered the New Yorker as it was their slices. At that point we asked for our checks.  Our server was able to split the checks up as requested. There were a few mix ups w/ sodas and booze being placed on the wrong bills. I ended up paying w/ a comp. One to which I wouldn't have used the entire amount. Now in other casino establishments I've eaten in, when it's not all used the server says, 'the rest will go back on your card'. That didn't occur here. Then again I never got my personal pan pizza either.   Food good. Service bad.

uZWZBih2dsF0P5GoZxSMUQ.text: Overall it was good experience. Staff however do not seem worried about pizza orders as much as they are about drink orders. I get it but come on your place is called "pizza rock".   Anyways the pizza was amazing and I will go back again just for the reason.  However the staff were not friendly and it is pretty steep pricing!  Thankfully their pizza cook makes up for the lack of serbice

WO59-I83Z30SOLTvGdAKDQ.text: LOVE this place! I have been meaning to write a review because this place is the bomb! This is our go to place after day drinking at the pond. If we make it during happy hour we get $4 meatballs (3pieces), garlic bread, and the Tony Two Times personal size pizza($7). Today, our server recommended the Gorgonzola fries and they are probably one of the best things i've ever eaten!! Seriously going to dream about them.  Service is always great too, very friendly staff.

_M7loOenwy1OBoi8GDYalQ.text: I've been here many times, to a few of its locations including Sacramento. Today was by far the worst experience ever. The place was packed and I'm not joking when I say there was literally 1 waitress for the whole place. When I asked the waitress about this, she told us that the manager scheduled her but didn't want to call anyone else in because it was a day after Christmas.   We spent over $75. Our New Yorker pizza was so over cooked that it hurt my teeth to eat the crust and there was barely any cheese or toppings.  The garlic bread was also so burnt that my sister cut the inside of her mouth. When we told the manager about this, his attitude was terrible. He brought us a new one and when he did he absolutely patronized us by saying "here's your extra lightly baked garlic bread."  The zucchini fries were decent.  Personal cheese pizza, better than the higher priced New Yorker. I've lived in New York, This pizza was subpar.  My friend waited about 20 mins to receive each beer (he had 2). Our waitress told us there was only 1 bartender too.   The New Yorker and the garlic bread were so bad that I ate my nieces leftover Kids spaghetti and meatballs because she was full.   Sometimes, even though not ok, you can expect a waitress to be short and/or rude but coming from a manger, totally unacceptable. Our 1 waitress even had an attitude herself, granted she was the only one serving, there's no excuse.   I'm actually pissed about my experience today. I will never go back to this particular location, go to the one downtown, don't waste your time or money.  If the owner knew about my experience today and the fact that his restaurant was entrusted to one absolutely rude manager and 1 waitress, I would hope that he would be livid.  Nothing in this review is exaggerated...very disappointing :(

U5m9H11uSrYsRC9531nhJQ.text: Not very good luck at this place. Last time was undercooked, almost raw dough pizza crust. This time 1 entree was brought out 15 minutes before the other. What are we supposed to do, 1 person completely finish their dinner while the other awkwardly waits? Ridiculous! Told the Waiter and he says 'well things get brought out when they are done'. Well Genius, most kitchens AND wait ataff know how to time orders to cook and arrive timed appropriately. Guess not here.   Will continue going to Grimaldi's! Quality & Service!

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. Pretty unappetizing and the smallest Meatball Sandwich for the price that I have seen ANYWHERE!   Wont make this mistake again!
Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. Wont make the mistake of ordering this again!

uU1t8wXMIwQXbKpwGita_A.text: Wings were not very good the service was terrible our waiter disappeared all the time. Didn't check on us to see if we needed anything else we had to hunt him down to get service. When he did come over he was very quick to run . For the price I expected n more and at the least good waiter to take care of us. First and last time I will go there. The restaurant wasn't even busy not sure what the waiter was doing.

PSWvZh7YxAoguLHmnH5voA.text: If you order one pizza and you're into east coast thin crust style - this is the only one you need to get because it is divine! Yes, it is $26 - but the sauce and ingredients were so delicious. It's probably now my favorite pie in the valley. Also note they have a happy hour daily - even at night from 10-close. The pizza is on happy hour but it is not the same crust as the New Yorker. I will definitely be back for this pizza!

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. New Yorker Pizza

gEPWSLH8KKygnHwHPV7e5A.text: Had lunch here for the first time since the Feast Buffet line was too long.  Restaurant is located inside Green Valley Ranch Hotel Casino.  Parking is easy here.  We were seated immediately and hostess and server both very nice and friendly.  The 4 of us shared a New Yorker Pizza (Sausage, Pepperoni, mozzarella cheese);  Pancetta and Arugula Salad; Italian Chopped Salad and an order of Rosemary Garlic Fries.  Food was all very good.  The fries were absolutely delish and cooked perfectly -- fresh, crispy on the outside and juicy in the middle.  Pizza was very good.  Salads not the best (I'm very picky with salads), but still good.  They have Happy Hour here from 3-6 that looks great with reasonable prices.  Next time we eat here it will be for Happy Hour.

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. Italian Chopped Salad
Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. Pancetta Arugula Salad
Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. Rosemary Garlic Fries.  Yummy!

E-9Rja3k9XuAQ4Z6pKl0Ew.text: The pizza is so good and they give you plenty of food. The staff is kind and helpful. Loved the decor inside! Very cool!!! Will definitely be back!

Wi-OY0UQpiW_WPI2pZRDMw.text: PIZZA ROCK Rocks... This place is a must if your a foodie, Or a pizza fan! We ordered Meatballs, a Cheese Pizza, Truffle Fries, Zucchini Fries and The Godfather Pizza, They were out of something so we switched to The Americano EVERYTHING was so good...  Our waitress was awesome (Jen) we were lucky to have her... She made going out the eat at PIZZA ROCK an experience... Thank you!  And Tony... Whoever came up with the idea of turning old albums into...menus... Genius!!  LOVED IT!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. Taps&amp;sports, what more could you want?!
Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. Cheese pizza.... de-lish!
Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. Great pizza&#39;s!

ryXPApwhyGImmLwsMIwO9Q.text: A lot of young people work here from the hostesses to the servers. They really do have good service and our waiter was very attentive. They play music videos on a tv screen which is pretty cool.  Ordered the New Yorker which is what caught my eye and is apparently their most popular pizza. It was a hit! I would totally recommend that pizza, next time I'll broaden my horizons and try another. I would totally recommend this place for the food, service and atmosphere.

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. The New Yorker.

KYzpQRAeMn0fjQDN0rm0pw.text: The dear Detroit PIZZA is an absolute MUST. If you like crispy edges imagine a buttery crust that has been baked in the oven with parm cheese on the crust itself. the crust of so buttery, crispy, and cheesy. Baked cheesy like parm crisps not the ooey crust type. the pepperoni slices are crispy like chips and about 1/2" in diameter. i drizzled alot of their chili oil. I love their green beans. they are garlicky, not mushy, crispy, and sweet. the zucchini fries comes w a cheesy creamy dip and it's excellent. get those three things and a bottle of chili oil to go. i love that detroit pizza. such buttery goodness. staff is very nice.

vGGsU2VUB2I3zFyrCLqmlw.text: We've tried different pizzas here to find which is our favorite and honestly I love the Margherita best. The only reason I deducted a star is because my crust was limp and wet with sauce. Doesn't hold up to the sauce and falls apart as you eat it. Nothing wrong flavor wise.  My husband is a meat lover and his favorite is a pepperoni & sausage on a cracker like crust which doesn't fall apart. Decor here is industrial and it's very loud and chaotic but service has been consistently good. Last night Zach was our server and he was attentive and helpful.

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. Margherita pizza
Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. Industrial decor

WdrilHiovzRI00QlV2okJQ.text: Used to love pizza rock even last night I was there for their late night happy hour sitting on the bar the young lady rocked and gave us good customer service.  It was my friends birthday today and he wanted pizza so we went to pizza rock we got seated right away. No one came by to ask if we needed drinks or if we ready to order. We saw servers walking by us many times and we even saw a server helping the table next to us but we didn't exist. No said I'll be with you or anything. I felt like we were ghosts sitting at the table. After a while with no one coming by or acknowledging us, we walked out. I told the hostess that no one came by as we were walking out, I assume it was the manager he said something along the line sorry we'll take care of you right now but at this point I had enough and it was a little too late. I was already upset and there was nothing changing my mind.   Too bad I was a regular to the Green valley location, now no more. Too many good pizza places in Vegas that I would go to a place that treats you literally like you didn't exist, the restaurant was kinda full but not to the point they we're overwelmed, I got seated as soon as we got to the restaurant. It was bizarre my friends and I wondered why we we're ignored and no one said I'll be with you in a minute, those words  would have been all it took for us to stay and wait longer. But like I said servers walked by many times and no one seemed to care to help us.  We got into my car and took off to another pizza joint down the street.

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. 2 personal pizzas
Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. The personal pizza at happy hour crust
Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. Happy hour menu it&#39;s a record

wkkjXM2dL2MPDRNN7ULmoQ.text: So good! Pizza was delicious, the happy hour prices were good, the portions were reasonable. I'll happily come back and bring friends!   I got the Cal Italia personal pizza happy hour special - it was delicious! It's a little smaller than dinner plate size, so  I'd get something extra on the side to round it out as a meal.

MsMlF3t9RhxOamXk3E5cYw.text: So we were out with a group of people and they decided to eat at Pizza Rock. At first I thought oh no... But I have to say this place definitely got it together. Their food was excellent. Service was excellent. And they changed my opinion, I will go back and have ordered delivery since then using Postmates. It arrived hot and delicious :)

fT48nAgS_g5jXlQtfq-hLg.text: Bad service. We were told at the beginning it is "family style", which means your food comes out to the table as its done. So basically you have one party at your table eating, and she was half way done by the time other food items were coming out. Kids macaroni bland, no flavor. We asked twice for a drink we ordered at the beginning, BEFORE the meal.  Pizza was good, not great.  No plans to visit again.

-s1_5q05XgIGTa7zB9mnMw.text: The service has been consistently great everytime we have come. Nick is one of the best servers I've had; he is friendly and knowledgeable about the business and made some great recommendations. The food always comes out on time and it truly is some of the best pizza in Vegas.

OSXHMJ20_m3k38xpBcSKlg.text: Harmony was taking care of us and she is amazing!!food was great! Drinks were great! And the atmosphere was incredible!!we will definitely be coming back again.

PTFGcZIS15o6MXBHGXrliA.text: We had a reservation for 5 people on a Saturday night, so we got seated pretty fast. We got the meatballs, cal Italia, and the New Yorker for the five of us to share.  They have all different types of pizza to choose from. It was the perfect amount of food with us, and we had a great time watching football there. It's located in the green valley ranch casino, so you can go play afterwards. Would highly recommend this to anyone looking for a good pizza.

xkQonAHALYZAUKws_8vAYQ.text: The meatballs here are amazing!!! Happy hour is even on the weekends!! Even though it's across town for my family and I we will be returning!! Their pizzas rock as well!!

fgEoVx8SV7T0M3-TYFl7Hw.text: We had great food! And our server Nick, put up with our special orders and lengthy decision making. He was great!

uOcjl47EkT1CLPCvxjYLoA.text: The happy hour specials here are unique and really good. The green beans are wow! Yes i said green beans. Pizza is awesome and the best selection of beers in the area inc several with high %. The bar area with TV's is great for watching a game.  Its right in the mix of everything going on.  Also try the happy hour meatballs!

4vNfCClxYXGLkaZ18beP2w.text: #kat at the bar provides great service. She introduces herself and ask your name! Nice! Ordered a glass of chianti (bland) for food I ordered two appetizers; 3 meatballs $5 pretty good and the fried artichokes in tempura batter were light not greasy, you get two centered chokes no leaves to fool with! These are incredible - two slices of lemon and a remoulade sauce (forgot to #photoopmyfood)

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. #3tierchandelier

fwlPAZlqG2kgDYdV9eo0KQ.text: Mob Boss Sicilian Pizza was delicious! Amazing Cesar salad! Also enjoyed the Cal Italia pizza and Montepellier Pinot Noir wine.

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. Wine and Caesar salad

DlBtRsADMbw3z-m5kYskjA.text: Great food! Great service! Rochelle ( hope I spelled it right) went above and beyond to make our night fantastic! Food and drinks were served in timely fashion and we all ( party of 9) felt very taken care of. Food at both Pizza Rock restaurants is always amazing tasting! Meatballs ( of course) quinoa salad- margherita pizza- Rochelle even suggested a delicious beer to try. Never once did she seem overwhelmed by the size of our group plus the other zillion things she was doing. The manager ( Ricky) does a great job running a very busy location and it seemed like all the other patrons were enjoying themselves as well.  HEY TONY!!! Another great eating establishment!!! Congratulations!!

a8M51PBS9oOgtZI-3yXITA.text: My boyfriend and I came here based on the reviews from Yelp. It was our first time here. Our server was Regina. It took her about 20 minutes after taking our drink order to get our food order.. I ordered eggplant parmesan and my boyfriend had the St. Martins pizza. When our food came out, I went to bite into my eggplant and it was very difficult to eat, burnt, and did not have any flavor. After trying to cut into it and failing I gave up and pushed it to the side. I ate some of the pizza but it also lacked flavor. Regina finally came back to check on us and we told her that the eggplant was not good at all and over cooked. She apologized and said "sorry I should have checked on you guys sooner." Although, they took off my meal on our check, the manager never touched our table. I was frustrated with our experience and we won't be returning.

PIuOg9NRNH7pDbVMh2x2ng.text: Best pizza in Vegas!  Been here many times and never been disappointed.  Great ambiance.  Excellent beer selection.  You won't be disappointed. TRY IT!!!  Delicious pizza and appetizers.

QOrbKwd0Dc6OXsH3upSHKA.text: Really good pizza! My boyfriend and I devoured The New Yorker. The decor is kind of bizarre but it's clean and I like the casino that it's located in. I would definitely return.

TY30_yX4JkwEyRQ_VEQApg.text: It's decent.  Chopped salad wasn't amazing, but fried green bean were.  Should have ordered pizza- it looked good.  Waittress was super nice!

kV46Y33X1GVvWQReqh970Q.text: We came in on a Wednesday for an early dinner. My fiance and I are so excited to have Pizza Rock on this side of town. My fiance is from the east coast and he's a little bit of a pizza snob. Its True when he say that the pizza from the east coast is better than what we have here. And we must say, pizza rock quality of pizza is up there and definitely in the top 5 best pizza here in Las Vegas.  The service was great. We came in on a happy hour that we didn't expect. On top of that, we got 10% off for being local with the exception of the happy hour prices of course. The ambience pretty much says it in the name, its Pizza Rock so expect some loud rock music. They got some patio seating and I did notice it being not so loud there, so for you folks who cant handle the loudness perhaps a seat out there is right for you. :)

K-fREbTqFz5C46KDXKfhng.text: Ordered Pizza to go.  We live in the area.  Been to the one downtown and been happy.  Got all the way home to find out they gave me the wrong pizza.  The girl that took the order over the phone did not sound like she knew what she was doing.  I should of known.  The pizza we did end up with was bland... Might give it another chance, but not any time soon.  Hope that it's just because their new.

euOJaG6vnbeXYPeCdCUvIw.text: Love this place! Great atmosphere for big and small groups. They have gravy fries, like poutine that are amazing! All kinds of pizza depending on what kind of crust you'd like.

e1RBoZnT75daxjJDI0ic7g.text: This place has great Truffle French Fries.  It also has pretty good happy hour prizes for the pizza.  This venue gets a 1 star because the service was horrible. The people at the front was too busy chatting it up with each other to notice that we were waiting to be seated. After we got seated and ordered our food it took forever and a day to get a refill. I literally had to track someone down to get another fill of my soda and more ketchup.  The waiter passed by us many times and did not even offer to fill my friend's water which was clearly empty.  When the other waitress came by to give our personal pizza that we ordered; she looked at us and basically dropped the pizzas on the table loudly with a frown. She didn't say anything and just left. I would not go back to this venue again because of the horrible service.  The food was alright for the happy hour prizes but not worth the feeling of "why the hell are you eating here for?" service.  1 unhappy star for this place!

pQEX9b1zUTAj1VJ1gUUg0w.text: Would have given 4 stars but service was given with bad attitude. Found this in several of restaurants/eateries @ GVR. Seems to be the regular type of service @ GVR restaurants where staff are millennials. Noticed their attitude is better towards younger looking patrons i. e. Under 30 yrs.of age. Good pizza though. I recommend going across the street to Setebella for pizza. It's better quality for similar price and without the 'attitude'.

v3Gi8nDTKLilHZFb3OTjpQ.text: We went to Pizza Rock tonight at Green Valley Ranch. We ordered appetizers and a pizza with anchovies on the side. It took about 30 minutes to get our pizza. Unfortunately, the anchovies were on top of the pizza, ruining it  for 2 of the people in our party. The waitress admitted it was her mistake and she forgot to tell the kitchen to put the anchovies on the side. We returned the pizza and the waitress came back out about 5 minutes with a "new" pizza. However, the pizza was barely warm and smelt like anchovies, it was obvious that they had just picked off the anchovies. They did not re-make the pizza and tried to pass it as a re-make. We sent the entire pizza back, paid our check and left.  It will be a very long time before we ever go back to that place, if ever. It was very disappointing, especially when they tried to fool us into thinking they made a new pizza so quickly.

zC3y7rhXB9A-7wUAhmBLHQ.text: Food is delicious but I always have poor service. They weren't even gonna sit us last time because they were filled apparently. My brother and I saw 3 tables big enough to fit 8 of us and when we asked why we couldn't sit there they responded,  " oh we didn't think you'd want to." Seriously?  We want to eat and have been coming here faithfully for over a year. Your food is incredible, if your service gets better you are for sure a 5 out of 5.

N-tPbhvKftj8ZFpqB3YmTg.text: My friends and family come to Pizza a Rock A LOT! Maybe more than we should. There are so many styles that there is something for everyone. The first time we went to Pizza a Rock was at the downtown Vegas location. When they opened up one in Henderson... Well, game on!!  We have tried more than half their pizzas and we are still figuring out which is the best. I also bring guests here and they always want to revisit. Like today, I picked my friend from the airport and came straight to PR. The Napolese pizza, noted as one of Americas top 50 pizzas, is her favorite, ever. Whenever we come to PR we all order different unless it's the very large styles. We even order and pick up.  This place is very popular so make opentable reservations. I always do that especially for dinner any day of the week. We came in for lunch today and the place was not busy. So choose... Lunch or dinner reservations.  Now for my favorites, depends on my mood. Today I ordered the Cal-Italia because I wanted something light. If for some reason I want a pizza with spice and flavor, the picante is the way to go.  My friends either order the Stromboli or Henderson pizza. They swear by the Stromboli.  It's all good. So look at pictures, check their online menu, etc. This place has it for pizza in my book!

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. Dessert calzone
Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. Meat ball hash
Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. Sam giancana pizza... Sausage and different cheeses

rLvRtZPrH7WK6cxkQlHG0w.text: I've been coming to this joint for a long time now with my family..service has been great until tonight. First, girl checked us in said it was a 40 minute wait. It was obviously busy..so we wait. People started leaving. Front desk girls grew to 4 hanging out chit chatting away while people left. 20 mins into our wait, I noticed a tables are being cleaned, figured they would be calling us soon. 10 minutes later, they were still chatting up and 4 of them standing around talking and socializing. Another customer walked up and asked about his table, was told they would have his table ready soon. So I asked about our table, I said I was told it was a 40 minute wait, a long haired, short girl with obviously fake lashes corrects me and said "Actually it's 45 minutes and your time is not up yet". Not the answer I was expecting nor should have been said. I pointed out that there are tables open..to which she gladly said " They are all reserved". I walked away to avoid saying anything I would regret. Another 10 minutes later..we finally got called and was placed at a table that sits 4! We were a party of 5. I politely asked to be seated at a bigger table that is clearly not occupied and available since we had to wait for 50 minutes!!! The only saving grace is the waitress ..she was lovely!  They are in the business of customer service! I was not asking for any special treatment! It's very disappointing to be treated and talked to they way this employee did and to try and sit us at an awful table right on the hallway where people walked in and out! I feel that that girl purposely did that to us! This employee represents Pizza Rock - poor representation. Service Recovery would have been the approach for making your customers wait instead of making me feel that you are punishing me for questioning your obvious lack of good service!  By the way the table that I asked for initially that she stared was reserved...NO ONE ever sat at the table!!!! How horrible is that!

wEjj-Xi69Xd5noebKuuKBg.text: I love the pizza at this place. The Margherita pizza is my fave and I love the thin crust. I ordered 2 pizzas through postmates and even though I enjoyed the pizza immensely the pizza was soggy by the time I received it so I had to reheat it but it was still so good!  Will be ordering again for sure but not through Postmates.

gIGJD8Tl7E1DHzbZPDsI_w.text: We've been here a couple times with friends. The food is very good! There are a TON of different types of pizzas from all around the country. The menus are old record albums, with the actual records in them. Very cool! The Guinness Pizza is the best one we've had out of the several we have tried. That thing is off the chain! Get a couple of pints with it. The service is a wee bit slow and the main reason it's 4-stars is that IT'S SO DAMN LOUD IN THERE!! I get it, Pizza ROCK. But man, the music is so friggin' loud you can't really even have a conversation with people one foot away. Too much. But I'll take earplugs and go back for the pizza.

UWhmxf9cjbbb5Gj4WqoHHw.text: Great beer selections. Really pleasant place to enjoy drinks and its open until 2 am!! But... the pizzas are way overpriced for what they are, scarcely any toppings and thats why I give it 2 stars in my review.

iy3Gh_y4KBDc56YtwBPPhQ.text: Luke warm pizza & poor service. I doubt I'll be back. I told my friends how awesome this place was and I was so embarrassed! The pizza not only was warm, it was soggy like mush! I was so disappointed! The waitress actually brought out our appetizer AFTER our meal was almost over!

VjT1aVACj3WTpFMXjDDhhg.text: I had the Calzone and Italian fries with Gargonzola cream... Absolutely delicious!!! Can't wait to go again and try the pizza.   I had the Resiling and wasn't a huge fan wasn't as sweet as I am normally used to.   Overall great atmosphere and great service!

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States

4XPSQjPUR-V695iM07vN-g.text: Yum! I really love the pizza! The crust is amazing. I also love the crispy cupped pepperoni on top (I think it is the New York style pizza that we get)! I wish they would offer ranch dressing as a side dipping option. Don't know about service too much because we take it out.

xZs3LsvtgNCQqOY1l3SF5Q.text: What can I say about Pizza Rock? It's the best g-damn pizza in Vegas. If you like pizza, then this is the place for you. They have at least 6 different styles of pizza with lots of options. They have a good happy hour and lots of beer options. You have to visit Pizza Rock at least twice to get the full experience.

XtdXYMw87iw7tLl1Kv17_Q.text: Where do i start? Order the meatballs for an appetizer, you cannot go wrong. I looked around and everyone had it on their table. I ordered the Americano pizza and it's huge! Not to mention, it was incredibly delicious. Super fresh ingredients, and they don't short you on toppings one bit. My buddy had the Michigan Ave pizza and it was delicious as well, amazing tasting crust. The hostesses are blah. Not real emotion, just put on a fake smile and go through the motions, but our server made up for it. Janelle is a rockstar! She was working 8+ tables and killed it. I'm a former server so i understood the stress she was under, and she didn't show it at all! She was very attentive, gave excellent recommendations, and super friendly. I will ask for her the next time i go back. Overall, 5/5!

L3Slbh7sB9bRBuRCNHkROQ.text: Have you ever had real pizza not from the freezer?! This is the worst pizza! Don't advertise the best championship pizza if you can't back it up! Yuck. Don't even mention the music.  I thought I was at a pizzeria, not a club. The music is terrible.

wxR6LmzcxvgoRYQM8C-utQ.text: All I get here is the New Yorker.  If you like a killer thin pizza, with great crust, high quality pepperoni, and killer ricotta cheese, and finally a bit of a spice kick, this it exceptional. It is one of the tastiest pizzas you will find.  The beers here are great as well.  I have has the salads and they are good too.  I give this place a SOLID 4-5 stars.

Mjtn0E8abZhmUO5o2zAjZg.text: We've been here several times now and the food is always awesome! The calzone was one of the most amazing I've ever had. My son loves the Calamari. They have a great selection of beers on tap. Their award winning pizzas that I've tried were amazing...although none were quite cheesy enough for me, but that could be because I lovvvvvvveeee super cheesy pizzas. Last time we went they had bottomless mimosas for brunch. Several flavors for $15. Great value if you plan on drinking more than two glasses. Bonus: the decor inside is super cool and the menus are old records with actual vinyl records inside.

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. Just look at the perfect crispyness of this calzone...with amazing flavors inside!
Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. Mac n cheese with bacon and pancetta.
Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. House made ciabatta bread.

GvGLDgTRmrxyaYOqNCtltA.text: We stayed at the Green Valley resort which was absolutely beautiful we decided to go check out the casino we bought by this restaurant decided to pop in to see the menu it looks really good.  The place is really cool actually has a whole semi truck in the restaurant that you can sit in and eat out of.  We were created by the bartender I believe her name is Kimberly she was very nice and super sweet so we decided to stay and give it a shot my chicken sandwich came out under cooked it was really hard to chew I was embarrassed to tell her but I couldn't swallow it it was so bad.  She looked out it felt it was cooked enough so I put a piece in my mouth and pulled on it to show where I can rip it apart she then informed me that was very unattractive when I did that I didn't have to do it she then came kind of snotty said she would take the sandwich off the bill the bummer is she was so nice in the beginning and then just turned on me when I told her the chicken sandwich didn't taste right sense and I've called three restaurant owners of mine and they all told me

rCOQQkx5Pfz6gDk0Og5reA.text: The Detroit Red Top and meat balls are the best in Vegas!!!! Stations suck ass!!...Station f.....heads are fortunate to have a place where someone under 80 yo actually wants to eat!!!!

WLNO-h8GgysHb9Ts7UWmEg.text: Had the WORST personal pizza ever. After waiting for 45 minutes, my friend and I receive a pizza crust with a can of tomatoes dumped upon it and a few blobs of cheese. Terrible!

7FLMLHbWTOwl6CUkA2RRnA.text: This place is awesome! They have a big rig in the dining area! Beer was nice and cold and pizza was great! They have a cool interactive trivia game going on too. Nice place, something different while in Vegas is always nice.located in the green valley ranch casino, which is also very nice too! Will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States

LVSa0uyYCvqebgjkCIpInA.text: Literally one of the best pizzas and pastas I have ever had. The New Yorker and the bucatini are my go tos. We're from the Bay Area, so we were thrilled to find a Pizza Rock in Vegas. We called our order in and picked it up....easy breezy.

u1JthQ0NwwpueBzcsnYieg.text: Chicago cracker thin amazing New Yorker amazing  Truffle fries amazing  House salad amazing   Service very good  Over all price reasonable   Gorgonzola fries not that good  Chicken wings not that good

qColdpOE5ZKt5O03srPUEQ.text: Rudest server experience I've ever had in my life tonight, (Friday night 9/6, at midnight). Not sure what his problem was, but we were the only ones sitting in the back section next to the semi truck so he wasn't busy. He never bothered asking what we all wanted to drink while we looked at the menu, or even at any point of our time there. We ordered our appetizers and entrees at the same time, and he disappeared for 20 minutes. Got our garlic bread, which was very stale, and then we waited and waited. Two of 4 entrees came out, and a few minutes later our server jogged around our table without saying anything. Two people still did not have their food, and we didn't see him again for 20 minutes. He tried jogging around our table one more time when I finally blurted out to him that my friends never received their entrees, but he kept jogging past me and didn't acknowledge I was even in the room. So I chased him down as he was talking to the host, and he looks me square in the face and said "I already heard you, I'm going to get your meatballs.." to which I said "you ran by me so fast you failed to hear that my friend never got their pizza as well." Plus if he heard me, then why would he go chat it up with the host for 5 minutes instead of checking on the meatballs? Then he finally comes over to the table and acknowledges my friend, and says he'll check on the missing pizza and meatballs. The meatballs were an entree for one friend, so she has been waiting patiently to eat for 45 minutes at this point, and the pizza was for another friend. The server comes out and throws the meatballs on the corner of the table and jogs off again, with no apologies to the girl that ordered them nor did he even give them to her. Then a while later he comes out with my other friend's pizza and apologizes to him and said they would cover the cost of his pizza, but never once apologized or comped the meatballs for her. Then when it was time to pay, we pooled our cash in to pay the check, he took it and said he'd be back with our change, but instead vanished and kept our change which we didn't even give him permission to keep.   I come to this pizza rock all the time and I talked it up to my friends from out of town, and it was a huge embarrassment to have a server treat them that way. I would really like to have a conversation with the GM about it, because there is more to this story and I'm positive there is an underlying issue in that server's treatment of customers.

0wREkcGHfO8ZBOqZK1wlZQ.text: Lovely night for alfresco dining at Pizza Rock. Last time we were here I had this great pizza and took a picture of it but could not remember the name. Our server tonight Mike S. was on the ball and knew exactly which one it was from my picture. I was happy to reorder the same one.   My husband had the Margherita. We had both with gluten-free crusts. Mike S. also made some recommendations on which ones work best with the gluten free crust so we will have to try those next time.   The pizzas here are consistently delicious and there  is something on the menu to please everyone.   Thanks Mike :)

xKWZwnwPz1ZOt8okkXaVjg.text: 3.5 stars Came here to give Tony Gemignani, 11 time world champion pizza winner a try.  They have different types of ovens for different types of pizza and also use different types of flour for the different doughs of each pizza.  They have a wood oven, coal oven, regular pizza oven, traditional stone oven.  They make NY style pizza, Napolitano style, Detroit style, Scilian style, California style, Chicago cracker thin.  They are all cooked at different temperatures, in different ovens, with a different fuel source, made the way its supposed to be.  There were a few award winning pizzas that you could choose from, and i wanted to try the Sicilian style, but i went with the Chicago cracker thin, (Sam Giancana) because i have never seen or heard of this  style of pizza before.  It came topped with slice meatballs, italian sausage, and ricotta cheese, and was cut into squares.  No complaints, just not so special.  Personally i prefer NY style or Sicilian style but i was glad to try it, otherwise I'd always be wondering about it.  My friend got the award winning Napolitano style Margherita, which she liked.  I did try it but I'm not a fan of Napolitano style pizza because its too wet for me.  We came during happy hour (3-6 every day) and also got a personal (Tony 2 times) pizza, salami, pepperoni, mushrooms and double sausage and mozzarella.  It was just that a personal pizza rather small, but just enough for 1.  I think i'd get the picante next time.  I also tried the Oskar Blues Death By Coconut porter, OMG so good, very smooth and intense coconut flavor, i think my new favorite beer!  and also $2 off during happy hour!  I thought the pizza was okay, I'm pretty confident i could give it a higher rating if i ordered the type of pizza i actually like, but sometimes you gotta step out and try different stuff when its unique and different.  Im told the meatballs are a must try too.

18PnjvEmoHqh7ohqV-q2kA.text: Finally I'm posting a review for this place. I've had mixed feelings about it.   First Kat. Good person, great conversationalist and has a joke or two. Seriously though - she is the saving grace in this. Thank you for your awesome service Kat!   That's not what we come to restaurants for. Yes, it helps for the experience to be better - however let's face it folks, we come for the FOOD! No amount of awesome service experience can make up for that.   That being said - let's get one thing squared away - beer, wine and alcohol comes from a bottle/keg. A cocktail of course is left to judgement -  my beer however was great. As expected from the draft or bottle.   So, moving on from alcohol... the food. Sub-par and something you could easily expect from a Las Vegas casino (especially the "locals" favorites).   Happy Hour. Cool. I can expect you're not bringing out the big guns here - however, have some pride.   I'll make it very direct;   - Fries - did you reach at the bottom of the freezer bag? These things were like eating shattered pieces of glass. Seriously, fried potato shards aren't exactly enjoyable for anyone.  - "Fried" green beans - I guess I need to check my expectations for these. I think "fried" I assume breaded. That's on me for assuming - because they're green beans "fried" in oil. Which I would say "not long enough, that's for sure". Underwhelming. Lubricated green beans with some fresh garlic and maybe seasonings.   The Pizza. (Oh this is where it gets weird)  Being as the Happy Hour menu really suited our appetite tonight, we decided to tapas style the experience. Pizza Rock is known for their pizza (it's in the name, c'mon!), and we have had their larger pizzas in the past, so we figured why not grab some personals and try some combos we haven't had. Well, let's just say the pizza experience from the larger pizzas doesn't transcend into the personal pizzas. They are poorly topped and the crust is less than desirable. The quality wasn't that much better than what you would find from a frozen pizza at your local store.   Also, being vegetarian, it somewhat cheats us to order off of this menu because they almost 80% of the time cater to the "mass audience", whatever that means, and so we find ourselves usually Frankenstein-ing some kind of "take this off and "sub this" type of scenario, or better yet, just cheese. Oh so fun. Tonight in particular, we ordered one of the more veggie heavy combos and asked to replace the prosciutto with artichoke hearts. The craziest thing happened, which happens often and I am being sarcastic, there's of course an up-charge. Yes friends, if you take the protein off (usually the most expensive part) and add a VEGETABLE, you will be charged more.   We gave up the artichokes, and of course no meat, and moved on.   Alright, so we decided to wrap this meal up, hopefully find salvation, and ordered the mud pie (which is pictured with this post).   This takes me back to a time where I remembered the fantasy of these decadent desserts was ruined when I found out most cakes or ice cream concoctions are stored frozen and then topped and dressed before they come out. (Is that a big deal, not really)   That is, unless it's too frozen when it comes out to eat. And it happened here. We got a frozen mud pie. It's ice cream, what's to complain about right? Well let's just say it took some serious patience, strength and overall after losing a few chunks to it shooting off of the plate and on to the floor (yes it was that hard) - that we gave up and Kat, again amazing server/bartender, took it off of our bill and ended the night.   I gave this experience a 2 stars. Through and through the food is what we come here for and now after having a mix of good and bad experiences, I know now that there's thoughtfulness from the kitchen that's extremely lacking. Owner of Pizza Rock - I've heard your story, I know you are an enthusiast and take your business seriously.   Please take a look at how "automated" your restaurant has become. There's a responsibility to your locals to be A-1 level at all times and your back of the house is starting to roll out to the front of the house.   Truly, I really enjoy your Pizzas - and want to bring this up to five stars. Guess we will see on the next visit

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. Mud Pie Dessert, it&#39;s crap!

BIkPuu0r1FYG5yCsumjXWw.text: I have been to the downtown location a couple of times.  This was my first time at the Green Valley Ranch outlet.  5 adults and one ch9ild gathered for lunch recently.  We had 4 pies and zeppole for dessert.  The pies were:  Old Chicago New Yorker Detroit Red Top Cal Italia  The first three were all very good.  It was the first time I had a Detroit style pizza.  At first, I cut my piece in half because of the large amount of tomato sauce.  It was so good, I returned to the tray and retrieved my other half.  The sauce was so rich and flavorful!  The old Chicago and New Yorkers were more what I'm used to and they did not disappoint.  Of the four pizzas, the Cal Italia was my least favorite.  I'm not a fan of balsamic vinegar and the fig preserve along with the balsamic turned me off.  The sweetness is alien to my pizza tastes.  At the same time, the pizza had one of the best crusts of the four.  The zeppole for dessert were good.  Chocolate and caramel sauces along with the citrus flavored whipped cream made for a very good combination.  I'll have to eat here sometime when I'm at GVR and prepare to have take home for breakfast the next day.

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. Name over entrance.

PzyKeLjgDiIS0hCED9xr4A.text: I give Pizza Rock 5 stars but it ought to be 5 diamonds because Diamonds are forever! Pizza Rock is one of, excuse it is my favorite place to drink beer and eat pizza and watch sports  in the entire universe! Not only to they have great food and beer, but they also have amazing service. This place kinda reminds me of like a real life Cheers in that everybody knows your name and therefore you feel like family and those who know me know I love family like Dom Toretto loves 10 second cars.  Speaking of service and all stars, Josely is like a first ballot hall of fame bartender! She has an amazing personality and when she's serving you, she's very attentive and has a never ending attention to detail. One also has to admire Jo Jo's focus and how she's able to juggle things like dealing with 20 guests, the well area, and those to go orders from grubhub, postmates, etc.. On a side note it's crazy how she can remember your drinks and so I feel like as a guest that's bonus points when your with your friends, I know as a server I too can remember certain peoples order and they get happy.  As far as food goes, Pizza Rock has hands down the best happy hour west of the Mississippi River, and South of Flamingo St.. There's 2 different times one can come in and experience greatness (3 to 6pm daily and 10 to 12am Sunday through Thursdays, 10pm to 2am on Fridays and Saturdays). I love their meatballs and Tony 2 times, along with the Gorgonzola frys. Basically one can order and spend like $30 and have an amazing time and deals like this are find to find unless your a Groupon junkie lol With Pizza Rocks regular menu, this place is loaded with lots of options. My favorite Antipasti~ is the Calamari because they are huge and the Calabrese Aioli is nice and spicy. The Gorgonzola and Apple salad is refreshing and the portion size is generous. There's many of pizzas to try and I would say I truly enjoy their Chicago cracker thin style! OH I forgot to mention, Pizza Rock is also an amazing place to watch Vegas Golden Knights games! If you are wearing VGK attire, you get a free beer and well every big screen has the game on so you can defintely feel the energy especially when they score because somebody will hop into that semi truck and honk the horn, the crowd goes wild! Lastly something I really admire about Pizza Rock is their CULTURE(winner winner chicken dinner). First off they have an amazing concept and I'm surprised there's not like one Pizza Rock in every state, instead of like 3. They play amazing music  and something that is even cooler is that they promote within. Some companies talk about it, others be about it. I've seen first hand over the years, people like Allen getting promoted from busser to bar back, I've seen Billy go from server to manager as well as Paige, I've seen Frankie go from bar back  to server, and so these kinds of moves are amazing because to me its all about promoting from within! The best stories are the ones where you started from the bottom and you climb that company ladder, Bravo Pizza Rock...  I hope you can see I love Pizza Rock and I highly recommend this place but warning you that you will become addicted. Thanks for reading!!!!

ZEe6MpT7LwE5VuqRFkX4fw.text: I stayed in the green valley ranch resort and decided to give this place a try. It was amazing! 9FlukrafZtqnElX1jd-wIQ.text: My husband and I have been to Pizza Rock a million times and I actually used to tell everyone about their amazing Gluten Free pizza. However this past weekend we went for lunch and ordered a Gluten Free Pepperoni pizza, half no cheese (since my husband has an allergy) and the waiter came back and said the chef refused to make the pizza with no cheese. I understand if a chef refuses to cook a steak or burger well done however an allergy should be accommodated. I was disappointed. We closed the check and left.

syik1_wqOtWJyS5UAhHYJQ.text: I've been to Pizza Rock a few times now and it's safe to say the pizza is top notch . I've tried a few different pizzas but the New Yorker is by far my favorite one . The crust is just perfect  and the ricotta adds a nice creamy flavor .   One thing I ALWAYS get when I come is the Honey Calabrese sausage is a perfect mix of sweet and spicy . It's honestly one of this best things I've ever tried .  It was my first time trying the The Fried Green tomato Caprese and it surely did not disappoint . I don't normally care for tomatoes this dish was awesome . I could eat this everyday . The mozzarella was so fresh and the fried tomatoes actually tasted fantastic . The balsamic and the sweet drop peppers added the perfect bite to it .   Also, I did not get a picture of them but we ordered the classic meatballs and they were also very tasty.   On top of the food being amazing , the service is always great and fast . The environment is great for adults and children . They have good music playing and sometimes even a Dj in that cool semi truck they have as decor .   Do yourself a favor and try Pizza Rock . One of Las Vegas greatest pizza joints .

PJTEfslMlWUPuDzKqX9vrw.text: AMAZING. IMPRESSIVE. We came here to celebrate a birthday. Even on a busy Saturday evening with one pizza oven broken, this restaurant rocked! JEx946SFA7UNLQSaArR54g.text: My husband, daughter, son and I stopped in to eat dinner. When we checked in, we were told there would be a 45 minute wait. My daughter and I walked around and played a few penny slots. I won some money plus I got back what I put in.  The restaurant uses text messages to notify the patrons when they're next to be seated. I received a text and we were seated shortly after returning to the restaurant. My husband and son joined us and were handed menus which are real album covers with a album inside. Our waitress was friendly and brought our drink order quickly. My daughter has to eat gluten free: fortunately this restaurant has gluten free pizza that isn't cross contaminated, as they take precautions. I ordered the chicken wings which are not coated in flour but dropped into the fryer and after they come out, they are tossed in either barbecue or buffalo sauce. I ordered mine without the sauce and they were tasty and crispy. My son and husband ordered the spaghetti with marinara sauce and meatballs. Our food was fresh, hot and delicious. My husband remarked it was some of the best spaghetti he's ever eaten out before. My son enjoyed his spaghetti and meatballs too.  The restaurant was very busy. The ambience was loud as they play rock and roll songs over the speakers and they have flat screen televisions that were broadcasting the Golden Knights playing at the T-mobile arena.  It was a nice dining experience. Our waitress Allison was very nice and patient as we decided on what we wanted to order. She was attentive and friendly. We will definitely return in the future.

ZmK9Bj7z7hNmtKcYmnlYUA.text: HORRIBLE hostesses up front.  First time trying this place but it will be my last.  The two little ladies are busy chit chatting, head buried in folding napkins instead of greeting us, not really feeling this place.  There are just way too many other pizza places to choose from that actually appreciate their customers, this place sucks.

3BcEBxg7hAMP5NhUDM9aSA.text: TUESDAY TRIVIA NIGHT YA'LL! Came for the food, left with knowledge I didn't know I needed.  Pizza Rock is located inside GVR, but can be spotted from the uncovered parking area. Easily seen and accessible. Came here with coworkers and their family members. We made a reservation over the phone the day before and was quickly accommodated when we arrived.   We were met with a smile from both hostess and server. Drink orders were filled swiftly and we were closer to filling our bellies. The menu had a variety of different options, but didn't feel overwhelming. Appetizers, pasta, calzones and pizza dominated the menu. We settled on Zucchini Fries and a plate of Calamari Fritta. Fries came with a nice mild sauce that complimented the fried goodness. Their Calamari Fritta was on point with 2 different sauces. One was a bit spicy and the other was the traditional marinara. They have an option for half spicy and half original Calamari. I highly suggest it if you like a bit of spice.   Our pastas arrived first, and from first glance I was worried about the portion. It didn't seem like much, but the more we dug in, the more we realized how wrong we were. We ordered Fettucini Alfredo and spaghetti with meatballs. Holy snap those meatballs were big, AND meat was mixed into the sauce as well, so you get double protein! As a group of 8, we were already half full from the pasta alone! When the pizza came out we steeled our stomachs for the impending food coma. We downed both the Butcher and New Yorker Pizza. The meat on the butcher was absolutely delightful and full of juice (amazing bacon, for the win!). The crust was a bit over cooked, but I've always liked a crust with crunch. The New Yorker had incredible cheese that just melted in our mouths. If I could take all the meat from the butcher and mix it with the cheese from the New Yorker I would be set for life.   Our server, Jenn (I believe), was so patient and great with everything we needed. It was our first time there and she made sure we were happy, full and content. Drink orders were always filled! My girl! Would I recommend this place? Heck ya! Should I practice and brush up on trivia so we don't end up being in 10th place? Double heck ya!

JVniMacwxV2qEpbaW-colQ.text: Let's start with the hostesses. There were three and they ignored my husband for quite awhile while two women cut in front of him. So I used OpenTable to check in. After my husband was ignored I walked over to ask if I should check in or would the reservation be faster. The hostess told me the reservation would be faster.  That was so not True. Other people got in that checked in while we were standing and waiting as we continued to wait for our reservation to be called.  One of the hostesses finally came over to explain after we appeared to become frustrated. I understand the waiting, but they can't seat a reservation early that they know is standing there when a table becomes available?!?  The waiter Vincent was amazing! He was with us in minutes. We quickly had drinks and our order was taken.  He checked on us regularly and kept out drinks full!! He is a 5+ star for this restaurant.
