_oFLz_yGNVzDyDGab8fg-Q.text: basically all the hype is the decorations and the location. pizza is mediocre and service was not good at all... server seemed like she didn't want to be there and was not helpful at all... glad I went but probably won't be back....

NxUhuhOtFnQs2cySAtga7A.text: We found our pizza place totally loved the pizza. This is our second time and forgot to do my first review. So we have tried two different pizzas and they were both yummy. We are for sure going back to try the other pizzas. Omg the creamy Gorgonzola fries are to die for. Now I will explain why I gave it a four star instead of a five star review. We had left over pizza that we had them box up. When we left we forgot our pizza and we realized as we were walking back to the car. My husband went back and they told him sorry that table was bussed and it was thrown away!!!  He left mad but when he told me I was more upset because who does that others places put aside to see if the customer comes back. So I called the restaurant while we were still in the parking lot to speak with a manager and all she could say was they were busy and tables were needed which I understand but why throw away someone's food that was asked to be boxed up because they wanted to take it home. So after getting the manager to see my point that we weren't gone for more then 5 minutes top 10. She cuts me off by saying oh we have your pizza here your waitress put aside and didn't tell anyone! Just a little annoyed by that and then when my husband went back in the two girl hosts in the front didn't even say anything to him they just pointed to the box!! So rude!!

nE5-trzIWsSX2r27Cw_9sg.text: I highly recommend The New Yorker pizza. It was heaven. The garlic bread was great - my kids lapped it up. I can't wait to go back and try something new.

yYQVNepp58MlpTwBoc8Syg.text: We arrived before our party, and ordered drinks at the bar. The craft beer selection is extensive, so if you have a taste for quality beer, this is the place to go. We ordered the Old Chicago while at the bar, and it made for a delicious addition to the great beer that we were drinking. The ricotta cheese on each slice is the equivalent of the cherry on top of a sundae that you save for last.   Once our party arrived, we decided on the Artichoke Joe and Detroit Red Top to feed the rest of us. Of course, the server was courteous and accommodating. I soon had a different brown ale coming, so I might have the opportunity to sample a small portion of their beer selection.   The Joe came first, and it was delish. I had one slice, but the dollop of sauce on top was once again the focus of my attention. Folding the slice in half meant that it was evenly distributed throughout the slice.   Last, but definitely not least, was the Detroit Red top. It's an intimidating slab of crispy cheese, thick dough, and the signature red sauce. I was already full from the previous pizza and beer marathon, but a cohort and I decided to split a quarter. (the whole slap comes in four pieces, which is ridiculous. The damn thing could feed a small village. It should be 8 to 12 pieces!) I was lucky enough to get the corner piece, because the crust and crispy cheese combination around the edges is mind blowing.   Overall, definitely the best pizza place in Henderson. The three different pizzas that we tried all had completely different themes, including crusts, toppings, and sauces. All three were also delicious. I congratulate the chefs. Well done. The service was prompt, courteous, and knowledgeable , and so received a significant tip.   10/10 would bang again.

NvpRlvHr7Wbxn9RCVyQiwQ.text: Very good pizza, wide selection of styles and great service.  Unfortunately all these positives are more than offset by obscenely high prices (it's pizza not steak folks) and music so loud you can't have a conversation across the table or booth.  The next time I decide to drop $100 for a pizza dinner for four and want to yell at my guests to be heard / ask them to repeat themselves ... I won't.  When did profiteering under the guise of artisan cooking and trendy theme become so acceptable?  This is a one and done pizza experience.

nTr9y7-4tYxSq4d35SL4fQ.text: Came here for a lunch date with my husband.  Excellent dining experience.  Our waiter Chris was very attentive and made sure we were well taken care of.  After much debate as to what pizza to try- we settled on the Detroit~ excellent choice! We'll def be back.

Uj2YjQuIGZ2wZNepOR5JmQ.text: Impressive beer list. Awesome pizza. Great service. Cool ambiance for a group, but it's a little loud, so don't go there expecting a romantic quiet time.  Four stars for being a little overpriced and for making me go into a casino. Other than that...great place! Great find!

HA1ty-wXNpbQ7VYSsfwkyw.text: Service is terrible staff walks around and ignores customers. Too many good Italian  restaurants in the area to waste your time on this one!

omadjQDw7xHFTvRV3nKrYw.text: Stick With The Pizza!! Tried a couple of their entrees and they were pretty bad. Sausage & Peppers rank with the worse I've had anywhere. Big plate of  bad tomato sauce with some tasteless sausage. Linguini and Clams were dry  and almost not edible. Calamari Appetizer  was very good. Have had several of the specialty pizzas in the past and they were very good. Should of know better. It's a Pizza place, not an Italian restaurant. Stick With The Pizza.

IQXFZ6lAaSPyiOHU12BZow.text: We had a 7pm reservation for 4 people on Saturday night.  We arrived and were quickly taken to our booth.  The booth was a bit tight for four people and none of us are big people by any means.  4 True pizza lovers would not have fit in the booth.  For starters we had cocktails, nothing special.  Then one of us had a salad and another had the chicken parm.  For dinner we ordered three different pizzas.  So, here goes the review.  The salad came, then about 5 minutes later the chicken parm came, then one pizza came.  Now imagine a tiny table with a pizza, chicken parm, 4 glasses of water, 4 cocktails, their silverware can and spare plates.  We did not have room and the staff just kept pushing the plates inwards until stuff started coming off the table.  Finally we managed it but was not comfortable.  Then the second and third pizza came, one of them was the new york pizza and larger than the other two smaller/personal pizza ones.  We were totally out of room, plus the pizza came out cold.  They said that they could not heat it up and fired another one up.  So far, nothing was super tasty.  The music was blasting and we had to raise our voices quite a bit to talk with our party and it was really, really warm in the back of the restaurant.  We were all breaking a sweat.  Finally, a while later, the replacement pizza came out and it was warmer, not hot but warmer and didn't have the toppings we wanted, we told them and they brought the toppings over in a bowl. .......    To summarize, super loud (pizza rock), food was at best, just OK, very warm, and the accommodations are not built for anything more than one pizza on a table, nothing else.  I do not recommend unless you like to eat with super loud, booming music in a hot restaurant and room temp food.  Bill for all 4 of us was 150.

Lj9RppSIsB6AeQtp1ltH9w.text: pizza here rocks.  can't go wrong.  i am good for once a week.  great beer selection and coctails. one piece of advice.  avoid the tiramisu at all costs.  mushy coconut flavored diarrhea.  Desert Calzone is not good either.  Both too hard and too mushy if that is possible

pdmDeJI2GZibaY2hcS6nPg.text: Hands down- BEST Gluten Free Pizza in town! Lots of other pizza, salad and entree options too! Their staff is super friendly and attentive.

FULju5ZGNG_UI4EYfSJi1w.text: The pizza here is simply some of the best in this humble town of Las Vegas.  I've been here twice and both times we had a great dinning experience. The first time we were in a rush to make it to a movie and waiter was able to accommodate us to get our drinks and food out as quickly as possible. The second time we got to relax a bit more and enjoy the atmosphere. The wine list is good and the menu has a good range for what it is. I ended up ordering the meatballs as an app and they were fantastic. The best part is dipping your pizza crust in the leftover sauce.  The video DJ they had on a Friday night was kind of cool. I would have given this 5 stars but the loudness of the restaurant was overwhelming at times. When you're dining with a group of friends I don't enjoy having to yell to have conversations. Food 5 stars for sure.

RBG9_0WbFCTHEJ7NneMmHg.text: Love Pizza Rock. Henderson is smaller and cozy. Suggest the meatballs as an appetizer or meal with the fried zucchini. All the pizza's are yummy. Haven't found one I don't like yet.

QU5XUAsCaqqf-QeUjAma5A.text: Ordered the lasagna which was flavorful meaty cheesy much better than I actually thought it would be. Will have to hit this spot up again.

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. First time eating at this location, Lasanga cheesy so much meat in this dish looks as good as the picture.

itEs1xkduS8Yy4NdyLe2zw.text: My husband and I had lunch at Pizza Rock, and it's terrible. We ordered a veggie pizza and their classic meatballs. The meatballs were cold and the pizza was burnt. It's not just a little burnt on the side of the crust. The bottom of the crust was black and every bite taste bitter. I should have taken a picture to show how bad it was.

vlCYgkFRT2sd2fA8ci4z7g.text: By far the best pizza here! The cal Italiana and the New Yorkers are must try's. Beats grimaldis and other pizza joints. Also try the calamari here not the spicy one as it is super spicy!!!

-miLTqdxq-U4-jhog58R5g.text: Our Server Rob, was simply the best.  I had the Lasagna was delicious.  My Son had the Quattro Carne pizza also very good.  For Dessert we had Tiramisu, my goodness it was so creamy and Heavenly!  We would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone.  Great variety!

L2YnLybX8wUUByQA0WzbRw.text: Very friendly interactive staff . The waiter explained the types of ovens and pizzas and that gave us some choices weight not otherwise have known .

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. Cal Italia pizza very delicious ! It was NOT your average pepperoni tomato sauce pizza ! Great service by Rob

qmn8nOFRPDxegfsgPVtmMg.text: I've eaten here a few times now while staying at the Green Valley Ranch and it is awesome!  So many great pizza choices, yummy salads and delicious sides.  Tried a new fave...the gluten-free vegan Margherita pizza.  OMG...soooo good!  I am not gluten-free or a vegan, but was sharing with a friend who is and I think this crust and San Manzano sauce are by-far THE best I've had.  Crispy and chewy...I didn't even miss the cheese.  I highly recommend this place!

QsBCa3xGTLx8PpANXaC3mw.text: Pizza Rock ROCKS. I've been there 3 times, twice sitting at the bar and the bar tender was very attentive. Wednesday's offers 1/2 price wine all day and night. That's attractive to me since I'm a wine drinker, and the price list starts at $8 (that's $4 on a Wednesday). I've had the Italian Chop Salad twice and it was large enough to split. It was fresh and tasty and had lots of Italian salami. The price is right for its size and quality. My favorite pizza is the Detroit Red. It is a bit pricey for a pizza at $27 but it is a pizza big enough for 4. It is a rectangular deep dish with buttery crispy edges. All I can say is WoW. It is delicious. On our last visit, there were 7 of us at the table and we shared the pizzas and the Detroit Red was a hit. I also liked the other ones I sampled but unfortunately I didn't order them so I'm not sure what they were.

zPm2UovJ7eHnruliwgSPOA.text: Every time we visit GVR Pizza Rock is a must. Love their salad and pizza! Dined here Labor Day evening and our server Paige was awesome. She brought a couple beer samples and took great care of our needs. Thanks for a great experience.

pyZIjn6AwDqsT9RyIJiN_Q.text: Such a welcome nice addition to green valley ranch where it combines great ambience, service and good quality. Considering the fact that Pizza Rock is known for award-winning pizzas, I unfortunately did not get to try one of their specialty pizzas rather their pepperoni and cheese pizza due to accompanying my nephews. Don't get me wrong, this pizza is still of great quality but I was excited to try some of the award-winning pizzas. I look forward to having a chance to try one of the specialty pizzas for a chance at five stars. The Boss and New Yorker looked insane and as a bonus, those burgers look really tasty also. Welcome to the neighborhood.  (Part of the reason why I am giving it five stars is because of the overall service also. Our second pizza had a small hole that was cut out of the pizza, so they served it but let us know that they will be giving us another full pizza. The size of the hole was no larger than 2 in.2 but they were kind enough to make a call to just give us another. That's the service that they provide here.)

w8A_8CTk2MG6P2NErJW71w.text: Omg. If you like pizza, this is the place. Thin crust, thick crust, normal toppings, exotic toppings, this place ROCKS! We tried 3 different types of pizza. The Detroit Red Top was my fav. We added pepperoni (for a $3 up charge) and it was worth it. The "burnt" cheese edges were a treat in itself. Next was the Old Chicago. Thin, crispy, not overly saucy. Great pizza for thin crust lovers. Finally, the limited quantity (only 23 made per day!) Sausage & Stout pizza. Flat bread type crust with a Guinness reduction sauce. Not my favorite as I am not a fan of caramelized onions and scallions, but for onion tolerators, it was delicious! Service was excellent. Seated quickly and our waiter was attentive and made recommendations that suited our tastes. Granted, we dined on a Saturday afternoon, but I say the staff is well trained and capable of handling a crowd. Try it!! You will not be disappointed.

_FhhmmrsAmLCTg4AD04B6w.text: So exciting to have one of my favorite pizza joints in my hood. We were having dinner with a friend that loves pizza so we recommended trying this location of Pizza Rock. We had been to the location downtown many times, but hadn't had a chance to try the new one in GVR.  I called a few days prior to make a reservation. Gal on the phone was super nice and they were able to accommodate us within 15 minutes of our requested time. Then they called the morning of our reservation to confirm.  We arrived right at the time of our reservation and were taken directly to our table. The location within the casino is nice. It's right on the perimeter near parking so you can walk right into the casino and immediately turn into the restaurant, avoiding the locals smoking liking fiends. The decor is nice, very similar to the downtown location, and they have a patio, which is always a plus.  Our server - don't remember her name - was very nice and attentive. There are a couple of differences from the other location. I usually like getting the Romanos, which are all delicious, but on this visit we kept it simple. We got a regular pepperoni ( I know, don't judge, the kid requested it) and the New Yorker. Both were delicious. We also had the garlic bread, which was good, but nothing spectacular.  I always love the music at this place, but at times it can get loud. Yikes, I sound old! The only misstep this visit was that our garlic bread seemed to take an awful long time and arrived at the same time as the pizza, which kind of defeated the purpose of an appetizer.

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. Keeping it simple with a Pepperoni pie
Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. New Yorker - yum

ZmWDjzjpx6ckdDIjLYNe-w.text: Whether you want your pizza thin and flash fired at 700 degrees or sicilian at 500 degrees, or somewhere in between, Pizza Rock is sure to please.  They have several creative options and their appetizers and sides are excellent, especially the meatballs.Try the burger, it is excellent.    Overall, this location seems a bit off from the downtown one though maybe because it is newer and they haven't gotten it quite right yet. Our pizza was lacking in flavor and the sauce was watery.

k-SNR8Dek38VBHOnnuMzLQ.text: Very poor service, I'd give 0/5 if I could, called up at 5pm to enquirer about happy hour, was told that it ends at 6pm, got down there at 5:45pm sat down and explained we'd like to go for a pizza off the happy our menu, which was $7 for a personal pizza, this is where my taste buds went sour, when asking to substitute one of the toppings for another one, the waitress giggled to us and said "subs aren't allowed", much to our disgusted, we explained that surely swapping mushrooms for jalapenos shouldn't be such a big deal, she stated again that "subs aren't allowed and toppings are $2-$4". As we were hungry we ordered 2 garlic bread's for $5 each which were average to say the least. On the whole a bad experience, not welcoming and not accommodating.

vtap5ZU-cYJWp42tb4K5Pg.text: Had such a great time! Veronica was a great server! So sweet and always made sure we were having a good dinner experience. Will always ask for Veronica next time we are in!

6p2LF_Nq9ce6uX27Or5inQ.text: Worst Pizza we have ever eaten!  We ordered the New Yorker and were extremely disappointed. The thin crust was close to a cracker crust and the sauce(?) was some of the worst ever. It looked and tasted like tomato past scooped directly out of a can on to the top of the crust. The Ricotta seemed to be watered down.  For us we will not be back .

xvdhxNks5KRc68YxmgEWIg.text: Nick was such a great server, he had wonderful drink recommendations. And we enjoyed our favorite Michigan pizza with some additional toppings! Couldn't be happier :) would recommend pizza rock to any Vegas local or tourist!

HxYUmKgTp7xQVcprPRBhoQ.text: I've been here many times and have had excellent service but I went in on a Friday night and it was not so. After taking our drinks our waiter never came back to take our order. We waited 10 minutes for him to take our drink orders then another 10 minutes and he still hadn't returned to take our food order so we had to flag down a waitress to take our order. He still never came back so we had to flag down the same waitress to refill our drinks. Ugh! Don't know if we'll be back.

XtLYAChM1jjL2zx5wyqi2A.text: Slow service. Incomplete orders. Incorrect orders. We had a large group (12) so I know things get confusing but we ordered one at a time and had simple orders (happy hour items, pizza, spaghetti). One woman in our party had to ask for her food twice and most of us were finished eating before it finally came. And it was wrong. (How do you mess up spaghetti and meatballs?!). Then it took a really long time to get our check.   The server seemed way over her head and was disorganized. This seems to be a busy place, I'm disappointed it didn't live up to other positive reviews.   Lot of options here at Green Valley Ranch so we won't be back.

xxgJHWs8Vy9gx7iNLSRp_g.text: Looked this place up on Yelp of course, and I was not disappointed. Had a personal size pepperoni, sausage & garlic pizza and regular & spicy fried calamari. Best pizza I ever had, good quality meat and the crust was out of this world. The mixture of flavors and dipping sauces for the calamari were perfect, not boring or typical. Also go for happy hour as the prices are great.

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. Calamari, both regular &amp; spicy as are the two dipping sauces. Again, yummy, lightly crispy and delicious.
Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. Pepperoni, sausage &amp; garlic personal pizza. Best pizza I ever had, good quality meats and an amazing crust!

Ih9q8s3YaNvHHpVQqQ7-pA.text: We didn't have pizza, so maybe that was the problem. The pasta was only ok. The fried green tomato salad was made with red tomatoes. Service was only ok. They don't accept any casino coupons. There are too many other choices in town. Skip Pizza Rock.

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States

l4IWfvhe7lID9p3dTDA71A.text: Veronica was the best! The pizza is great but I love the pasta. Best in town. Meatball game is tight too! You need to try the spaghetti and the lasagna. You won't even like your own cooking after you try this. Service couldn't be better. The whole restaurant runs like a fine watch. Every employee was eager to help and I never saw the bottom of my drink. A+

WBA_CYWlH6ZRB8EbNCDNDA.text: Extensive beer selection, fresh and tasty salads and outstanding pizzas. Everything you would be looking for in a pizza shop.

fjEoiME2XxE82YU8D7O11w.text: WOW, just had the New York pizza, it had to be THE WORST pizza my wife and I have ever had in our life. Our life consist of 69 and 70 years of eating pizza from the Midwest to the west coast. If this is an example of New York pizza, you can keep it. The crust was hard, no flexibility whatsoever. Very little cheese and we had to hunt for the sausage.  Service was very slow  never received a refill of our drinks  and it took 5 minutes to receive my change.  So much for the PIZZA ROCK, it's yours.

3HTPmDjNscy2S7ZrHjFm2w.text: From the minute we arrived the service was really good. Jesse was our server and he was very attentive. Kept her ice teas filled and brought fresh ones before we were even finished. We ordered the New Yorker pizza and the salami and cheese board appetizer. Salami and cheese board was very good and had a great selection of charcuterie, cheeses, fig jam and candied walnuts. The pizza was cooked perfectly and had that slightly charred finish around the edges. The crust had a great chew to it and it allowed for straight slice eating or traditional folding. The ricotta cheese was extremely smooth I did not have that sometimes gritty texture that ricotta can have. The sausage on the pizza was extremely flavorful. The service and the pizza made us fan. Also, the music and the decor made for a good eating environment.

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. The New Yorker. Pepperoni, sausage with dollops of ricotta.

XsIMzrm9osfld3oW6sOtKg.text: Ask for MASTER Server Paige! We eat out almost everyday from best to average and Paige is definitely one of the few best servers I've ever had.  During a busy Sunday Football Night,  she came to my table of two people at least 20 times,  multiple refills,  napkins,  history of the restaurant, and hot fresh beautifully presented food! !!  Just a flawless experience in a beautiful sports bar environment,  clean,  unique and delicious, great views of all the Big Screen TV'S. Best selection of Italian pizza and pasta,  stromboli is awesome !!!  Desserts are perfect made high quality ingredients absolutely a Happy Ending   Cons: In another nasty Station Casino  :-(

JX5s3M2tCh4xkrQbLBteSw.text: The pizza was delicious i got the meat lover. Best pizza i ever had ever. The environment was nice and friendly. I love the hospitality. Everyone is really nice Im forsure coming back soon with all the family.

QB9G3yd7V7h4kbtmuX0LUQ.text: Went with friends from work,  the menu and all the food I saw (including the food I ate) was amazing. Beer option really good. Price is a little high (But they have happy hours to fix that) Definitely going back.

O2rbATGkgFnPtfTbsr-Eaw.text: This place has excellent pizza!  It's a bit on the pricey side if you are not sharing, but the selection of pizzas with unique ingredients means that swapping with friends is a must.  Our favorite to share is the Sausage and Stout. It's Pizza Rock's unique take on a sausage pizza, and it comes with 2 points of Guiness for $33.  Don't take my word for it, though. Explore the menu & try something new. You'll be glad you did!

9X1Yh5pH5GTerRzwKD4XOw.text: Great NY pizza!!!They have great happy hour prices for pizza after 10pm. They also have $4 32oz PBR after 10pm

WVnVMEc5OlFCK5gShOl5Fg.text: Loved the downtown location and the food is great here too!  Love the setup and that TVs are everywhere.  Fantastic bar, I could easily see myself coming here to hang at the bar for a game in the future.  Minus one star for really bad execution on the service.  Took 15-20m before the girl told us Corona is not available (she brought the other drinks).  Then it took her 15m to bring a different beer while we saw her waiting on other tables.  It was literally 30m before I had a drink.  Seems they need more servers?   Then they messed up our pizza order and had to give us some free food (that we didn't order).  We never received what we ordered lol.  The manager was nice to say another (supposably correct) pizza was coming but even the 2nd one came out wrong.  Give them credit as they did comp 2 of the 3 that were wrong.  Our server was nice, but didn't seem properly trained or to sincerely care that 2/3 of our order came out wrong.  The manager was also nice and seemed to care.  Everything was great otherwise and will return.  Awesome food and place.

OYy5qldYOP2QdoIpnXkFQA.text: Pizza Rock is the bomb! Fun atmosphere, great service and delicious food. I had The New Yorker pizza which was really nothing like a NY pizza but was fantastic. Very flavorful. For an appetizer we had the Meatballs which we couldn't get enough of. Everyone at the table was raving about them. Our very friendly server, Vinny, said the secret is using Ricotta instead of bread crumbs. So glad they now have the Green Valley location as it's much closer to home. Even our 9 year old says this is now her 2nd favorite pizza, right behind the pizza in NY.

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. The New Yorker- pepperoni, sausage &amp; ricotta.

9XGsCb9d8f2THFwj5_Zfvw.text: This place has a great atmosphere but that is its own redeeming feature. The pizzas are mediocre at best and frankly unpleasant at worst. I do not understand the hype. The only place we have been two twice and had to send our pizza back at least twice both times. It's just not good. Try elsewhere.

q5P36VmScc6tbKwGHVlCxQ.text: Been to the downtown location a few times and was very excited to have good pizza closer to home. It took them long enough to open, so I was really expecting something great.   We went on a Wednesday night around 7pm and were greeted with a 40 minute wait. Ok, maybe everyone else is enjoying some seriously great pizza. There is plenty to do at GVR so we left a number to have the hostess text us when the table was ready. After about 40 minutes we make our way back to the hostess to see if our table was ready. She says she definitely sent us a text. Ok, whatever. Technology doesn't always work.  We were seated and put in our drink orders. When we finally started ordering our pizza our waitress informed us that it was about a 40 minute wait for pizza because there are only three ovens. I'm sorry, what? If 800 degrees can crank out a pizza in 90 seconds then surely Pizza Rock can go faster than 40 minutes. Also, it would have been nice to know about the 40 minute wait up front, since our total wait was now pushing an hour and a half.  We stayed the course, however, and ordered two pizzas. Our first pizza came out.  It didn't stand a chance. We devoured it. Then we sat there with greasy hands and mouths, just staring at each other. I think our waitress sensed our frustration and told us our second pie was about 30 seconds from being finished. Ten minutes later the pie finally shows up. It was delicious as we expected, but still completely unacceptable to wait so long.   Our waitress apologized for the wait and said "we'd like to make it up to you with free dessert." When we each tried to order a dessert she said "oh. Just ONE free dessert. So you know." Whatever, lady, just bring it out quickly so we can leave already.   We already knew that the food would be good so I'm not even going to comment on that. Overall this was just a bad experience because of the service. We felt like we were deceived at every interaction with the staff. Even the attempt to make up for every other mistake came with an asterisk. For as long as it took this place to open, they need to get their act together from a service standpoint.

tFBeUiQN5fN6mIohXW9zFg.text: Tried it for the first time... Was really impressed with the happy hour menu!  Everything tastes amazing!  My favorite was the truffle fries and personal cal itlalia pizza!  Meatballs were pretty awesome too!  Happy hour from 10-close is where it's at!! Will definitely be back!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. Molinari personal pizza!  Yum!

6sQEIxktqxCq6XQ6EKGidw.text: Are you looking for a rockin pizza night out!?  Here's the place to go enjoy AWESOME music(a mix of today's hits and oldies but goodies) while eating the BEST pizza in town with friends and family.  "Old Chicago" is where it's at so be sure to try it if you like: **Tomato Sauce Mozzarella, Provolone, Garlic, Italian Fennel Sausage, Sliced Meatballs, Ricotta, Romano, Oregano....Delizioso!    Service was good and friendly.  You can also sit at the bar and watch your pizza while it's being made from scratch;)  Great food and atmosphere!

HBq3OnQOgW_5Hf2HtCoDnQ.text: The pizza was over priced, a burned crust and not very hot. Our waiter was almost not present and we had to wait for drinks for almost everyone. Ironically, the meatballs as an appetizer came before everyone got there! It's a cool place and should be great but the service was poor and the pizza was as if a salad was thrown on top and then the crust got burned...all for $32.00!! Geezer, Judi in Henderson, NV,

K3_jmaS9niu6dDPNgS3ldA.text: The food was really good. Super great happy hour deals !! The service was however ;  was not too great. It took about 30+ minutes for our server to take our order when the place was almost empty. We never got refills on our drinks and we had to ask the bussers for service that was our servers job...

YxD3N3aZ9ASyeifbxRIlew.text: I'm stretching it to 4 stars, but like I said, I'm stretching it. From the reviews it seems the pizza Rock downtown is better.  I thought the meatballs and sauce were excellent, 5 stars.  The margherita pizza was also very good. I liked the fact that it was very doughy. Some people like a nice crunch, I don't. I like pizza saucy, cheesy and doughy. That's exactly how the margherita was like.  Also ordered the big pizza with all the different toppings ranging from balsamic, to pepperoni to olives.   Didn't care much for that one. But like the song by meatloaf goes, "2 out of 3 ain't bad"  Prices were high, tourist trap alert.

DbP9tGTQGZiP4ufDlp_3iw.text: Normally we love this place. Went tonight we both ordered a burger. It was the worst we have ever had! The bun was heavy, the sauce well it was all dried out really. Not much flavor, or should I say bad flavor. I can safely say we will never order a burger again! We told our sever she just replied hmm that odd. Really?? Should have just walked out. They were not busy at all so can't use that excuse. It was the Calabrese burger. Nasty burger!

IgbbBHOEKBo0_fxrpW1-Pg.text: Harmony is hands down the best server we've ever had here! We will be back every Sunday because of her. She said she doesn't always work on Sunday's for brunch, but we all really really hope that changes!! If not, we will be back when she's working! Best brunch in town, for sure!

D7k5SJY0AYme3ZmEgdPgmQ.text: Yummy brunch menu with bottomless mimosas and sangria! The Mexican breakfast pizza and Pizza Rock Benedict were delicious. Can't  wait to check out the rest of the menu!

YmFqkJzCPA49bBS8qufUHA.text: Im a local. I have eaten here several times before but last night was very disappointing. First the music seemed louder than previous times and was hard to hold a conversation. Second my cousin ordered a beer and when beer came she asked for a glass 3 times before they finally brought one to the table. Third, the waiter took our appetizer & pizza order and our pizza came out right after our appetizers were brought out. So we felt very rushed. Food is good but service was poor. Won't be back anytime soon.

DgTTnRaNbK8Zh8bhgey3vA.text: Super disappointing trip here. I was very excite they were putting a location in Henderson, but I would rather drive to the one downtown. First the guy who came to take our drink order was very rude and said if we wanted anything on the happy hour menu we needed to "hurry it up because it ends in 15 minutes" we had literally just sat down, and hadn't even had the chance to open our menus yet. We ordered the Rosemary garlic fries and they were actually pretty good. But that's where the good ends. It took our waiter forever to come take our order, and once he did we didn't see him again. We ordered the three cheese Stromboli. It was just awful. There was too much crushed red pepper in it. Over the course of our meal we had three different servers. And three separate times they tried to bring us food that wasn't ours. Clearly they need to work on their communication. When our waiter finally came back, all he did was drop off our drinks and walked away. He brought me the wrong drink and by the time he came back to check on us it was five minutes later and I didn't even want a replacement drink. I was so flustered by the whole experience that I walked out while my fiance stayed to speak to the manager. They ended up comping our entire meal, but I would have rather had better food and service. Sadly, we will probably not be coming back to this location.

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. Very disappointing presentation for the Stromboli

HRkgmqI1zTjmmR114KoUTQ.text: Had a great time at Pizza Rock! Great time with friends.  The atmosphere is perfect for the weekend with great music. Loved the waiter and staff

PTh_jy8LW8pEGS2tNRkfiw.text: Thoroughly disappointed with the Saturday Night service. I had to ask for refills on beverages, then remind them and then wait ten-fifteen minutes for it to arrive. The food and pizza was mediocre at best.

6sPXwZLfZQx_EErVHVqbLw.text: Went to Pizza Rock on Grand Opening night and unfortunately was left disappointed. I've been to the one downtown but this PR did not meet any expectations. First and foremost don't leave a bad impression on a first date but that's exactly what he had. Waited 60 min to be seated which was expected being the first night but it was all downhill from there. Took us 2 1/2 hours from the time we sat down until we left. Service was extremely slow. Just getting drink refills seemed impossible. Food was ok not great. Kids wanted mud pies but it took them 20 min to tell us they didn't have any. Nothing was good about tonight and I could see other diners having similar issues. Sorry this local will not be back

JhYQ5Vnyu8oZ5PKnbEGlxA.text: Love this place, Love the pizza and Love the Service!!  The New Yorker Pizza here is probably one of my favorite pizzas.....it is the BEST (we get it with just a little extra ricotta)....DE-LISH!!!  This pizza has won awards!!  Seriously!!  Other things to try that are great.....meatballs, Garlic Bread (AWESOME) Stromboli!!  The bartenders, Kat and Channa are awesome!!

Rj2kKMIvQ6vi6VMx2h9tzg.text: Excellent Happy Hour, superior craft beer selection-like a mini Yard House. Pizza lovers will be pleased. Service isn't bad, just a little inattentive. A great go to for Henderson.

7pVdtPQmQiZaUX1yIWN6Eg.text: AWFUL MANAGEMENT! great/awesome Pizza! POOR POOR poor SERVICE AND Waaay below  AVErage MANAGER. Pains me to say from the manager JOhnathon Burrell  to the waitress  JOCELY it's ridiculous....  Great atmosphere Great music, awesome hostess and the gentleman bartender was wonderful! but to have a waitress talk to me like trash and has zero knowledge of the menu or even at least the award Winning pizza... is ridiculous ! She insinuated to me that I could not get the pizza I requested because it's not on the happy  hour. This was strange because happy hour was not my concern. Then speaking to the manger about my complaint against Jocelyn's he defended her immediately before   I could finish exposing the experience  and appeared quite upset that I asked for his card and the GM's card. Unacceptable behavior in The service industry.  I arrived solo and spent most of my time writing the review when Johnathon maybe forty minutes later startled me and requested I pay my bill and leave the premises Customer service is so important.  I will never accept this treatment and will drive downtown before I visit this establishment again, without a apology.  Great hostess, wonderful food, two good bartenders but to survive they will need to make changes

mR2Hkl5JkR_kxsYszyOHmw.text: This place is a must for pizza lovers!  The location is perfect, inside of GVR.  The pizza is delicious. I've tried about 5 different kinds of pizza at Pizza Rock, and I haven't disliked any of them!  -The Coccoli is a MUST HAVE!!!  Order it...You will NOT be disappointed!  The service is great as well. The staff is friendly, helpful with any questions you have about the menu, etc.  Pizza Rock is A+ quality!

fs19l_iQbx0osufJC7bmCw.text: We were seated right away since we got to the restaurant early afternoon. We were excited to try the margherita pizza since they boast this pie a world winning pie. We also ordered a side of meatballs. Our waitress was excellent and very nice. She took our drink order and returned in minutes with our drinks. BUT right after our drinks arrived our pizza came....how can you make a pizza in less than 8 minutes?  My guess...this pie was hanging around for some time because when we took a bite it was barely warm at best. At $17.00 for this small 12" world winning pie this should have been fresh and piping hot!!! The meatballs were not hot either. The flavor of the pie was not bad. To bad it was not hot.

FR3bfKVwAKjNsedIQkTARg.text: Service has greatly improved!  Tommy is awesome manager and deserves kudos!  Great red wine from Sicily!  Caesars salad with anchovies is excellent!

lwLnxpOuktALP2TyOYBqIQ.text: My buddy and I were at GVR last night.  We saw Pizza Rock was having a grand opening, so we decided to give it a try.  There was a 30 minute wait for a table, so we went to the bar and sat down.  You can order food at the bar and it is first come first serve.  The hostess did not tell us this.  She should tell people that.  We ordered an arugula salad with pancetta.  It was very average.  It lacked much dressing so we asked for more.  15 minutes later we got it after most of the salad was gone.  The pancetta was fatty and greasy too.  The pizza arrived pretty quickly.  The odd thing was, it was not hot.  It was barley warm.   We ordered the NY special pizza based on the waitress recommendation.  We both found the dough to be very chewy and not crisp at all.  The toppings were all over the place and not well distributed at all.  I like hand crafted pizza, and it does not need it to be perfectly distributed, but this was a tad much.  One bite you got all sauce and no toppings, and the next bite all cheese.  I have to say the pizza was not that great.  I did not find any aspect of it to be special.  I would take Settebello (in the District) over this any day.    I know it was opening night, so they probably have kinks to work out, but the pizza should be good at least.  The service was so-so too.  This Tony G guy sure does act like he makes a mean pie.  We did see him for like a minute, and he was not making pizzas.  Also, the music is WAY TOO LOUD!  It is not rock music either, it was mostly hip hop and rap.  I am not opposed to some decently loud rock music, but this was way too loud to even hold a conversation with the person right next to you.  They have some work to do here, sorry.

DNVmeGGanfHicMgPb0lMsg.text: Definitely a solid pizza place. The new Yorker is good, as is the Detroit (if you like deep dish). At GVR I like the Henderson pizza. Its a bit on the expensive side, especially for beer ($9 for a 20 oz.?!). I do like the crust because of that charred wood oven. Would recommend people to try it at least once.

gmiDjpdseo-rOdRuaw97Mw.text: I went here on the recommendation of a friend. I knew it was going to be expensive, so I had expectations that the pizza would be great considering the bountiful other options within 10 minutes of this place.  We ordered the Detroit Red Top. The crust was overcooked and had no flavor to it. The pizza did not have enough cheese and was way overdone with the oil. The pizza itself was only 4 slices, which is fine for 2 people, but definitely not 4.  Environment was cool, music playing and sporting events on the TV, but I can think of several places within 5 minutes that have better pizza and don't cost $40 for a pizza and two cokes.

rgTgPqu2NMKzZbkWy6xgtg.text: Let me start out by saying that I am a HUGE  Pizza Rock fan! I used to go to the downtown location all the time and was incredibly excited that they were coming to GVR, which is just a few minutes away from home. So I have been here 4 times since opening, and I was lucky enough to stop in during mock service a few days before opening.  These were the highlights of my experiences:  -The place itself is beautiful! If you can, definitely walk around the whole place to admire all of the little details they put into the restaurant. They even have pizza box art on some of the walls!  -All of the servers I've had so far have been great. On my 3 visits, my servers were Regina, Rochelle, and Paige. All very friendly and helpful with the menu. -We ordered gorgonzola fries and asked if we could add caramelized onions and pancetta during happy hour. OH MY GOSH. These were the best smothered fries I've ever had. You have to pay a little extra than the normal $3 but it's worth it to add the onions and pancetta. So yummy, these alone are going to be my reason for going to their happy hour on a regular basis.  -Happy hour Cal Italia is so so good(only $7), but the regular size Cal Italia with extra Prosciutto is even better! I'm not a huge fan of tomato so I like that they they have such an awesome white pizza on the happy hour.  -the Gemelli pasta is really salty in the best way possible. It has roasted zucchini and squash topped with olive oil and romana. This was the first pasta dish I tried at PR and I was so impressed! It was cooked perfectly.  -One of the managers, Tommy came to our table to check on the food and he was very friendly. Everyone was friendly, no bad interactions which was great. The list goes on with all the wonderful things at Pizza Rock, but you get the idea! It's delicious and you should enjoy yourself some. They are super slow during the day so it's a good time to visit and get great service!

ubASL09Lk--a4fi368wCSg.text: I usually go to the Pizza Rock downtown, but gave this one a try, given it is the same chain. I was very disappointed in the lack of customer service. They were out of certain items, which was a drag and kind of killed the dining experience. To top it off, the server couldn't offer a discount or replacement for our pizza, which was not served correctly. I would have talked to a manager, but my dinner guest does not like confrontation. The pizza was just okay - not nearly the quality of the other Pizza Rock. I don't foresee eating at this location again.

2eA2nF7RcjJdaqTzByjS4w.text: Best pizza around!! Such a fun place to have great food and beer!! We had a Henderson Pizza.  Give it a try!!! Our server's name was Ryan. He was so helpful and gave us superb service! After we finished our meal the manager Jonathan came and introduced himself. He made sure everything was to our liking. He was so nice and knowledgable about the restaurant.  We own a restaurant in California and we know what great managers are about! We come to GVR often and are excited to see this first class restaurant here!!  Keep up the good work!!!

P0boYcr2mY5y9pOVeGz2yg.text: Best pizza you will ever have! Also the service is amazing! My hostess (nadia) was extremely nice and helpful. Let me sit at 2 different tables before finding the perfect one. My server (vinnie) was very nice and told some funny jokes. The man who brought out my food (frank) was amazing as well! Will be returning

dx7ofwGIjoY__x8mdxd1Bw.text: Nailed it with the crust! Decent pizza by the slice. Stop by if you're on Fremont. Worth it

F8YcM8FyjZD-xwKMcK5HEA.text: i asked for extra sauce on my pizza. Got the driest pizza I've ever had in my life. It was the opposite of what I asked for. I'm actually not even sure if there WAS sauce on there... Thanks for nothing! I basically just ate bread for dinner.  If you order take out, make sure to check the box....

qf4nibcXlO_yeJSGBgYqGg.text: Great Happy Hour! My husband and I love coming to Pizza Rock during happy hour. There are lots of beers on tap to choose from, which is a big plus. We also enjoy the Tony 2 times pizza and the meatballs as an appetizer. The staff has also been wonderful on every visit.

VHHX2gQUZpbPaKSfI0vgKQ.text: Pizza isn't the problem.  It's fine. But don't do takeout or delivery.  I ordered through grubhub / yelp.  I called Pizza Rock an hour later and they assured me things were on the way.  I contacted grub hub 30 mins after that, and they told me the food was now ready, expect it soon.  Called again after another 30 mins and I was told they couldn't find a driver.  My lunch guests left hungry.    I suppose dining in is different, but I'll never order from Pizza Rock or Yelp / Grub Hub again.  Just grotesque incompetence that led to a terribly embarrassing luncheon....

yUKP1Wrbd4fOIhupKI_asg.text: Impressive thin crust. Filling, mushy in the middle, crispy where needed, interesting topping options, huge sizes which allow up to 4 different topping options on a single pie.  Great decor.  Worth a look.

7KuaCN1sz_wrXVYy4sr2wA.text: Inside a nice clean casino. Service was good and quick.  Pizza was just average.  Margherita pizza was best.  Liked ambiance, games on large TVs.  Family friendly.

7pRUHjU88pBLadUnrC3utA.text: Dig the Margarita Pizza! Gorgonzola & Apple Salad to start.  Servers are always a lot of fun.  Friday & Saturday nights are a bit loud.  Check out happy hour.

rdD2RDIxFI8YEdOsuDl2sA.text: I ordered the Italian chopped salad. OMG, the best! Lots of charcuterie amid romaine hearts, onions, and a to-die-for dressing. Yum! We'll be back.

bzCtOeWUDW6rUBs4ENABqg.text: A solid 3* spot. We ordered two pizzas and a family style salad to share. The salad was very small and one of the pizza's was burnt (like black and broken crust when they sat it on the table). However the other pizza was great. The service wasn't anything special but they also weren't rude or neglectful. I wouldn't go back.

QvF5ABYY-MCRasasvyYTFA.text: The food is so good, it will ruin Pizza for you anywhere else. Even the more basic recipes are better than usual...please, Pizza Rock, never leave us!

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. Detroit. The best pizza, ever.

z8Yt_1DiBXME7ILk7M-xtw.text: After going to the downtown Pizza Rock over a dozen times, I finally made it to the Henderson location.  As usual, Pizza Rock was outstanding.   The margherita pizza was excellent, but so was the Italian chop salad, and the mud pie for dessert was outstanding.   Pizza Rock knows how to get the flavor just right, not just for pizza, but even for their salads.  I will be back again and again!

Vt9ixYkeQoFD7Ysxcsc5JQ.text: We ordered the "special award winning pizza". It was a tasteless mess. It was the consistency of a booger and had absolutely no flavor. The manager was nice enough to not charge us for it- so 2 stars for that. The meatballs were good too.

ehX75wDMSnASRWmOVf3FLA.text: Savory and Delicious! If you're not looking for your typical fast food pizza come here!  I've eaten at both locations downtown and at GVR. What I also love is they deliver as well! I'm writing this review because I was pleased with the delivery service. I used POSTMATES app to deliver to me in Henderson and my pizza was ready and at my door in less than an hour! It was still fresh and delicious.  **recommended their Cal Italia & New Yorker serves 2-4 people

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. New Yorker pizza! Delicious

XTdf9KdDoNbnhzK-XtP8Jw.text: Dinner here last night was like stepping into a Hot Pizza Time Machine. The massive flat screens behind the bar were playing hit music videos from the 90's--replete with baggy ensembles, coordinated choreography, and fuzzy video quality.  This was not my first Pizza Rock rodeo, but I'm somehow consistently overwhelmed by the menu. I was torn between the California style Honey Pie, the deep fried Brooklyn Calzone, and the classic Italian-style Verdura (Veggie) pie. The bartender broke the tie in favor of the latter and boy was he right. The crust was as fluffy and crispy as promised, dripping with gooey cheese that you would need leonine molars to snap in one bite. I washed it down with a tasty cider they had ON TAP.  Dessert was a *MASSIVE* slice of Mud Pie that my roommate and I could barely make a dent in (though we did just each eat 7/8 of our individual 12" pies). Honestly, it wasn't very good. Drenched in sugary syrup, it had a one-note taste: cloyingly sweet.  My advice: come for the pizza and brews, but you can probably pass on dessert.

qfdsPUWVY6b7o-08ozRusA.text: Pizza Rock is such a Casino type of place. I'm not sure what that means but it felt right at the time of typing this. I came here for a friend's dinner they were throwing and ended up fairly impressed. Great service for large parties!   We received so many free appetizers after our server moved us back inside from the cold seating. We really didn't mind too much, but appreciated the gestures. Some items I personally enjoyed were the Gorgonzola fries, The NY Pizza (not greasy), fried artichoke, & Alfredo pasta (heavy though). They were perfect food for after a night of drinking and celebration.   The coconut cooler, whiskey cocktail, and spicy margarita were all interesting. Not too strong or too sweet, but slightly more sweet than strong. They paired easily to drink alongside the food.   The bill was still pretty pricey & I don't think I would go out of my way to try Pizza Rock, but would definitely eat it if at Green Valley Ranch Casino.

E6YMy-kNP_q2knUR5-Vkpw.text: This place was good! My only suggestion would be to not sit by the door that leads to their patio. Everytime that door opened we got hit with a breeze that had our hair all over the place. Nice place, good food and just stay away from the door and all is good!

KDNFm4WtX2n7ST9Ml2_qcA.text: I have visited both Pizza rocks in the Las Vegas area . My latest visit was to the one in Green Valley Ranch. We ordered the Old Chicago pizza and it was really delicious. The crust was thin and very crispy and the toppings were plentiful. The house salad was a bit overpriced as it was skimpy for three people to share at $11 per Bowl and they didn't have too many goodies in it however the greens were fresh and it was not drowning in the tasty dressing.

tNIu_X6lngH_ejsdh419sw.text: Love the detriot red top pizza. Very savoury with a cheesy crunchy crust and thick dough rectangle shaped pizza. My other favorite is the sausage and stout pizza. Comes with two pints of guiness. Made with homemade sausages and a stout reduction sweet sauce. My family usually orders one of each so you have a sweet pizza and a savoury pizza. They go well together. Also dont miss out on the meatballs! They are amazing!

Pb1lufIs9PR8bOz50MYBKw.text: grubhub hired someone that will claim to drop off the order, not actually drop off the order, and then they don't answer when grubhub calls their phone.  can't get a hold of alexis grubhub deluvery with my food!  somebody call alexis with my food 702-219-0503  pizza rock = no refund grubhub = no refund  alexis is eatin good tonight!!!

2RUZZZWiy0-6r1KzeP6dmw.text: It's good pizza. Happy hour from 3-6 has good prices on both food and drinks. However I have to take a star away for the regular menu prices. We both felt our sicilian pizza was good but certainly not worth $32. We will probably return for strictly happy hour food and drinks but I doubt we'd go back at night.

C7xoNiVykazmiUX86wwg7w.text: I have had my share of pizzas in the past and I am hard to impress.  This place is in the top 3 country wide.  The service was awesome.  The pizza phenomenal.  Never wrote a review before but the experience was so terrific I wanted others to know.  It's a must try.  And kid friendly !

JMLDAApEfDsqjxKdjar4jw.text: Ate there on a Sat. night w/out of town friends.  NEVER AGAIN!!  Music was WAY TOO LOUD!!  We were shouting at each other & was still hard to hear.  Pizza was OK & expensive for thin crust!

GAHa09j2hh6ZTqsXlDOxOQ.text: Wow! The pizza here is amazing! One of the best I have had. Service was excellent minus the sassy hostess. Definitely a must go!

6p1uujQXuNDK6mBfVNbCQw.text: Recommended to me by a coworker. Great server I wish I could remember her name. Very friendly and informative. Pizza was amazing. Only bad thing I could say was the garlic garlic bread was a let down. Other than that great place

8n_O3he3wz6yqHdfetwGVA.text: Wonderful service and AMAZING pizza. Great atmosphere and they have really awesome DJs come in on the weekends. I still dream about the sausage stout pizza and sometimes wake up chewing on my hand. Ok not really but that pizza is incredible. The meatball appetizer also to die for.

4geGqwUYaKfl0gXaJueG-g.text: I can't get enough of this place but this time I was forced to eat at the pizza bar. The food is great but I can only have one server, Vanessa. I always prefer a table but the bar was Vanessa's station. A shame. The meatballs are stupendous, the personal pizza was sausage, pepperoni and black olives. The calzone dessert is worth dying for. Always ask for Vanessa, she's the best there.

IYWvY772z0ypDfOYvPY3xw.text: Great food! We ordered salad, meatballs and three different pizzas. Everything was great. we had a party of 8 and everyone liked the foodThere were a few issues with things coming out slowly and the service. Although, it was only open for one week and we were there on a friday night. Our server Harmony was great. She made up for any problems we had. She did everything she could to make us happy and took a lot of time to explain the menu. She even comped a drink for me because it took so long to get it. I will definitely go back.

TZmkpDVwD04cgW_J-9QLGg.text: Just had a lunch meeting and it was perfect.  Great service,  delicious salad and others had fabulous reviews for their calzones.  Four new fans of the new restaurant.

6VAxc2sdSxFtCDzh89Ra4Q.text: Had the best experience tonight!! The Guinness pizza is amazing. Highly recommend it. Pizza and 2 beers for $30!! Jonathan the manager came over and totally made the night for us! He was super friendly and made sure we were happy with everything. Love this place!!

64-hX6TcxyTGTWozkNz1Qg.text: At pizza rock again love the food and drinks  also atmosphere  once again sat in vinny's section love him  Tommy  manager always comes over and says hi great guys great place

XY81EjXfVbuuD1SAW5lT_w.text: Excellent food and service!! Our server, Paige, was very helpful and friendly. Pizza rock is definitely a weekly favorite!! I highly recommend the Michigan cracker crust pizza and the fried green tomato caprese salad!!

xu1i6rq0K0Wx5M3-Mx5fdA.text: So with every new restaurant there are going to be a few bumps in the road, but my experience tonight went way better than expected. I've been to the location downtown a few times. Always have a great time! Very excited to have one opening in my back yard. Surprisingly I had one of the same servers from downtown, Tiffany or Taylor maybe?? She knows the menu like the back of her hand so all around service was great & so easy with her! Food did take a little longer to come out... But the Cal Italia was  amazing as always! Lasagne was a little small, but still phenomenal in flavor. No deserts tonight??? Apparently they were out?? Odd.. But a new restaurant...things happen. Same great atmosphere! The new place is awesome! I will definitely be back!!!!

lpi_YUEuhhLIbz00Swo79A.text: Went with a group of 12 and what a terrible experience. It started off when I received the wrong beer. I mentioned it to the server but it didn't seem to matter. I never did receive what I ordered. I tried a personal pizza but it came out over cooked. Most in our group also had problems especially with the poor customer service. Servers really should be trained better. But after meeting the manager I can understand the lack of training. Pass this one by.

k3u17EYYHu67K3qXcER5Ew.text: I did not like this place at all. The one star is for being seated quickly. After we were seated, our waitress was inattentive and took a while to check in on us. Granted, the place was busy but we were all tired and hungry and wanted to order quickly. My drink order had been placed incorrectly and it took a while to bring back the correct drink. The food came out with long gaps in between. We waited an hour for everyone's food to finally be served. Upon inquiring if our food was coming, the waitress said its gonna come out "family style and we can share". To share my brothers meal would have been ridiculous considering it was spaghetti. His spaghetti was crunchy, undercooked, and dry. The Mac and Cheese was watery and crunchy as well. The food overall was disappointing. When my mom inquired about bags to take our left overs in, the waitress said we'd have to pack each one in a separate bag and didn't even offer said bags. It would have been more convenient to carry our food in bags rather than balancing the tower we had.The waitress seemed spacey and service sucked. I will not be returning.

SrS4dqtEtk7VkB_w6cTpzA.text: Yes, for Las Vegas, the pizza is above average....but the total experience is pretty miserable....you enter thru a hostess who seats you....much too fussy for a pizza joint (it is hardly fine dining)....pretentious menu....over priced.....i would prefer to just walk in, check out the pizzas and order....actually, they have such service at the gvr fast food court....the ny pizza was good, especially withextra sauce, which the waiter said could not be added to the pizza, but must be brought to the table.....at the fast food, they accommodate such a request....service was amateurish, but well meanin, and the waiter was uninformed about the menu....i will not return ...but i will get a slice or two at their place in the fast food.......the restaurant needs to make serious improvements or it will siimply be a casualty of sloppy, arrogant, clueless mgt which doesn't get it...you are just a pizza joint, i don't care how many awards you have....just serve good food and make the place more comfortable or else you are goind down.....

lWOcl6ZNan7Rq7_U0xlgTg.text: Went here for the first time tonight, and have to say Pizza Rock is an awesome atmosphere.  Some other reviews have complained about the music being loud, but honestly being a local of Henderson and going to GVR a lot, it is very refreshing to finally have a place that is trying to project a much younger and vibrant atmosphere. Most of the restaurants and places are around here attract a much older crowd, but I think Pizza Rock is trying to do the opposite, which I like.  Other reviews also complain about the price?  No one forced you to spend over $50, the prices are actually listed on the menu :) If you are on a budget, their happy hour selection is great and features $3 well drinks, and $3 off all draft beers, with $5 personal pizzas!  The hours are 3-6pm and 10pm to close which is great.  The food was fantastic, we got the New Yorker and it was delicious.  Manager and server were very nice, the pizza didn't even take long, but the manager out of the blue comped us all our beers and gave us a free appetizer just because he wanted to make sure we were enjoying our experience.  Like I said, very fun and LIVELY atmosphere, with a DJ who is inside of a real Peterbilt Truck decor that is featured inside the restaurant.  I will definitely be coming back soon!

y0VgKNTQ0a3G2hD6366YbA.text: Super disappointed with this location.  We had a wonderful experience at the one downtown but this one left much to be desired.  The garlic bread was good and the sausage appetizer was interesting however after get a recommendation from our server we ordered the St. Anthony pizza which was a total let down. It was supposed to have an over easy egg on top with a yolk that oozed out becoming the sauce. However when it came out, the eggs were over cooked making the whole pizza dry and inedible.  We told our waitress and she apologized, but when the bill came, we were charged for the whole thing. When we asked our server, she said "well, I debated with my supervisor" so in other words she told the supervisor and neither of them cared enough to do anything about it. Also, a side note, the waitress did not even mention it was Happy Hour or that there were specials going on. This makes me feel like she was doing everything she could to up our bill. Oh and this location is also missing the fun rock videos like they have downtown. We ended going to the food court and getting pizza there which was delicious and served with smiles.

8JJMB7QxHhzOx-JWBZFOrw.text: So decided to finally check this place out and see what all the hype was about! I'd have to say when I first came in I was not impressed, thought twice about coming in the hostesses were a train wreck and rude didn't get names but they were blonde, however still wanting to try the food me and my family stuck around not really planning to come back to be quite honest. My experience actually turned around right after we had a great experience with an amazing little server Vanessa ,she was so helpful in finding the perfect dinner with each of us took time to go through the menu ands she was on point and consistent in making sure all needs were met just all around made it a pretty awesome experience . The food was amazing !!!! We will be back with friends this upcoming weekend !!! Excited to dine in our new little spot!!! I gave 4 stars because despite our first experience coming in we still had great experience and food!!!!

jda9HGrH0IImFrFSnOcqtQ.text: Giving my 1st visit 3 stars. I do like the atmosphere but the servers seem very busy, and they did their best. I thought 5$ to add 8 clams still in shell to my pizza was a but much, and 9$ for 2 artichokes was pricey as well. My beer was 10$ for a 20 oz. The pizza was good and I will return eventually Im sure I just think its a bit pricey. Oh well

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. Veggie pizza + clams
Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. $9 for 2 fried artichokes...

NwPvlDbVR3UKbNhFWcLhuw.text: One of our favorite places to go for pizza and beer! Sooooo many different options of pies. We love the Detroit Red Top (reminds my wife who's from Brooklyn of L&B's sheet pizza! Cheese on bottom sauce on top!) they also have gluten free options for dough which we love for our son! We like the artisan style pies with figs and balsamic. All pies are great! Great place!

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. Great Togo pies as well as dining in!
Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. Great Togo pies as well as dining in!

l7L_lWJfLRlGn51caIG70g.text: I took my wife and 2 sons to Pizza Rock inside the Green Valley Resort Sunday night.  We had one of the best meals we have had in years   Our server Tony Montana was fantastic.  He was there quickly and was both professional and FUN.  Great attitude and very helpful.    The 2 pizzas we shared were perfect. Perfect flavor, perfect temperature, and the perfect size   I also want to thank the manager of this restaurant Ricky for putting together the complete package of talent that makes this the best eating place in Nevada.

P6x-IhKUaMxx7q41MGrkHQ.text: The American Classic Pepperoni Pizza is one of the best pizzas I have ever tasted.  It's a big pie but it's so good I ate the whole thing myself.

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. American Classic pepperoni pizza

9h59GJQWcOunQ3lQik-niA.text: My family and friends came here to celebrate my nephew's birthday. We were a very large and loud party. Our server was Veronica and she did an amazing job. She was so nice and made us feel very welcome. She took really good care of us and made sure we all sang Happy Birthday. The service was great and everything we ordered (which was quite a lot) was delicious and baked to perfection. Thanks so much.

d1exiF7VhHrp6mw69w4uww.text: The pizza rocks!!!!  Best pizza ever, even better than Chicago and the service is awesome

Lp2drnHqbTUKIeBDwXcp9Q.text: My husband and little one loved their food. Great service and cool atmosphere. The spaghetti pasta was delicious! So much food, we had to take the rest home. Great portions for the family.

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. Eggplant parmigiano.  Yummy! Excellent spaghetti pasta.

Tz0mzQPTZxGPKw29T_60_g.text: I am obsessed with their Caesar salad and meatballs.  I have been here several times, it's my go to recommendation for all visitors.    Pizza Rock does not disappoint.  Obviously the pizza is amazing and extra bonus they have a superb list of beers on tap.   Also some of the pizzas are huge and totally shareable making it a bargain.

08NB_kjogmGJGi8yIzPYuA.text: My wife and I just tried this place. The meatballs are great and the New Yorker pizza was the best we've had. Topped it off with a mud pie dessert that could have fed an army. Veronica was our server. She was friendly and attentive. Our drink glasses were never empty. A great place and we'll be back.

DUaW4lhdDcWBVhoJfCOZSg.text: A poor attempt at reinventing the pizza pie by using a gross and disgusting pita-like crust.  Better start looking for a new tenant GVR, these guys will never last with this gluten free crap they are peddling.    I had the New York pizza, I figured the topping alone could salvage almost any pizza I have eaten, but I was wrong, because this isn't really a pizza at all it's toppings on a pita, and that's not pizza!  I have eaten pizza all over the world and this is one of only two or three places that have found a way to completely ruin it.    I bought mine via Postmates, with tip it was $ 58, it should be a crime to rip someone off like this.  Don't let the photos fool you, it's nothing like real pizza.

7ouowDz6QHmuPkBVt72p5w.text: Pizza and food is solid but the noise from the casino and second-hand smoke that sits in the casino make me visit this place with reservations...

cclyCAJ4xlW14K4PU_SkRA.text: I was really excited to try this place because all the food looks great in the pictures and I love love love pizza.  Place is nice and service was good. I had the VEDURA pizza and it was ok. I honestly thought it would taste way much better. I ended up overloading the pizza with red pepper flakes to add flavor. Because it was lacking flavor I felt it was a little overpriced.   Maybe I'll give it another shot, but it's not happening anytime in the near future.

TKbDWCruvFYlQYJ0H5rWLA.text: We came to pizza rock without a reservation and it was a 35 minute wait.  Okay,  1 hour and 30 minutes later we were seated.  It was a Friday, but their app that you check in with says you're next at the 35 minute point and we waited an extra hour to be seated As we watched people after us get seated.  We were told each time we were next......NOT!!!!!  To make it up to us, they offered to pay for our meal...really not the point.  Very very disappointed in their hostess staff for not being up front about the wait time and what that really meant.

_BLRVyNMfr2B1YRKMnrDtg.text: To those digitally-inclined who use online ordering apps, be sure to call this place before placing an order. I placed an order and got charged for it, then over a half hour later, received a call that the restaurant had no delivery driver and I'll need to call Eat24 for a refund.   Needless to say, hangry, on lunch break at work with no food, and $30 tied up in a 5 day hold. Not cool.

HEjh2o0SY--jzKwlQVWFGA.text: From the pre-grand opening night until now, Pizza Rock has not disappointed me!  The meatballs, ohhhh the meatballs!!  So delicious!! I LOVE the Honey Pie pizza, little spicy, little sweet and so good!  That wood fired crust is my FAV!!  The staff is trying to get their groove and it has changed quite a bit since opening but it has been consistently good with a few outstanding peeps like Jen and Vinnie!  This place can get very busy so try to avoid rush hour.  The music gets better as the night goes on and I love that they play the music video along with the songs.  The semi truck inside is awesome and I love that they made it a DJ booth.  Hop in and honk the horn!   My only complaint: I wish the hostesses had a little more of a personality and would try just a little bit harder as they are the first faces you see upon entering.  They stand in a group looking rather annoyed and hardly smile.  Once, you get through the door and begin eating you do forget all about them, until you see them the next time.
