ff0EWicXrrMkPqAovDjAhQ.text: We went for dinner last night since hubby wanted pizza.  It was about 7pm and the wait was 45 minutes.  Earl and I stood around the bar area and 3 nice gentlemen waved us down to let us know that they are paying for their bill and we can just take their seats.  As we were thanking them, the bartender cleared the bar top and replaced it with a brand new brown paper bag with a stamp "Respect the Class," which serves as a place mat.    Earl order two alcoholic beverages thru dinner.  It was the Basil Basil (Basil Hayden, balsamic reduction, fruit juices), and he thought the balsamic reduction made the concoction tasted off.  The second beverage was just the Jameson with an alcoholic Ginger beer.  This one he enjoyed.  I got a coke.  We ordered the Cal Italia Pizza since it was noted as a "Gold Medal Winner - Food Network Pizza Champions Challenge."  It has gorgonzola, sweet fig preserve, prosciutto, balsamic reduction, etc., so yes, sweet and savory, sounds like the perfect pizza for the night.  However, it was more on the sweet side once we start eating.  What made the pizza delicious though, is the crust.  We loved the crust because it held the ingredient very well while tasted incredible.  We will definitely return to try another award winning pizza.  Earl even mentioned that when he is craves for pizza, we will go to Pizza Rock.

McfpuVlXZORNjGR8ophIOA.text: Delicious. Clean. Great Service. Pesto pizza and salad. Perfect meal after a great day of golf.

xDrF_H_CnIexbZxRLKNYWQ.text: Best service we've ever experienced in our lives, literally. Thanks to Brant Downey and his team! Thanks for the great pizza, beer, and calzone!

p1DRG7Qad2z1wHxXDnelxg.text: The service was good.  I've heard the name so when I had a meeting at Green Valley Ranch I had my hubby and son meet me there.  We ordered the truffle fries because we've made them at home and love them.  We also ordered the garlic bread.  The truffle fries had way too much truffle oil and were inedible.  The garlic bread was really hard do we had to order marinera as it does not come with--also very little cheese on top and I mean hardly any cheese.  We ordered the New York award winning pizza.  Frankly it was the worst pizza I've ever had.  The sauce is thick tomato sauce with not enough spices, I hated the sausage and the ricotta is weirdly sweet.  We won't go back!

igA-ev6Ria007E0qV1Lj1w.text: Had a horrible experience yesterday with pizza rock and it was strictly because the lady that served us was overwhelmed and very rude!  I go to GVR often so of course I been to pizza rock!  Love the calamari so there's where u get the 2nd star but there was a lack of service!  She took our order after about a good 30mins of waiting I kindly asked how much longer will it be and the waitress replied with I have a party of 20 in the back so when ever it comes out of the oven! She then comes back 5 mins later and said she took the pizza from that party to give it to us and ask if we wanting anything else I don't know why I even said anything but I asked for a beer and my brother asked for the Knights game to be put on and I'm not kidding she literally rolled her eyes in front of us!  Pizzas was at about one slice left before she comes back and she said I just put your beer order in so u get happy hour price which was a lie cause we got the check and it was full price.  Oh.. and dirty silverware it's pizza so I didn't say anything about it plus it may have made her roll her eyes again which would set me off.  The fact that I didn't speak to management is to not embarrass my brother it would of been ugly!

WBoA56dMThFqFtfseNHz0w.text: If you are a Pizza fan, then this place is for you. I was very confused and overwhelmed by the menu at first. They have all kinds of pizza styles: Chicago, New York, Detroit, you name they probably have it. We did the Neapolitan margarita pizza which was good, but a little soggy and was hard to eat without a fork because it was droopy. It tasted great though.   We also had the Italian chop salad which was quite good. This is a place to check out.

aYbEyqszKLLwqN9TiOwYOg.text: Love love love this place! They recommend the Cal Italia and I think it is called the New Yorker and they are now my favorite pizza in town!  Oh and they do have happy hour!

Ur78a6_npGrZzljbVQwDwQ.text: I think my hubby may have hyped this place up way too much & you know what happens when someone does that!  He's been frequenting the downtown location since he works close by & has been telling me for months how amazing it is. He said the meatballs rival those of one of our fav hometown restaurants, Westlake Joes in Daly City, CA. Eh, seriously hon?? I thought maybe just the quality/consistency was different between the 2 locations but no, he said they tasted the same as the downtown location. They were alright but def nothing even close to Westlake Joe's. I'm surprised he thought they were similar. The sauce tasted like warmed canned crushed tomatoes, too acidic for a sauce & you could tell the meatballs hadn't been simmered in it which is key to making great meatballs, imo. Not much depth of flavor at all & although the meatball was tasty, it was a little too "meatloaf" in consistency for me.  In addition to the meatballs, we also ordered the truffle fries, calamari (1/2 spicy 1/2 regular) & the Margherita pizza.  The truffle fries were the best part of the whole meal. You could really taste the truffle oil. We had to ask for salt bc they were under-seasoned but they were still really good. The calamari was just ok. They only serve it with a marinara sauce for the regular & a spicy aioli for the spicy. No cocktail sauce. What kind of restaurant serves calamari but doesn't offer cocktail sauce as an accompaniment?! Being from SF, the only way calamari is served is with cocktail sauce. You usually have to request marinara if that's what you prefer.  Now for the pizza. What a huge disappointment. I was really expecting some amazing wood fired pizza based on my husbands glowing reviews. The entire bottom of the pizza was soggy. I couldn't believe this was what they were calling wood fired pizza. They cook it at 900 for godsake! There should be no sogginess whatsoever. I could tell the ingredients that they used were good quality but it's just so hard to enjoy them when served on a less than appetizing vessel.  I'm gonna throw one more thing in bc at this point, why not? My review is already way too long, may as well end it with another gem. When we received the bill, my husband let the waiter know that he works for x-company & that they give a discount to their employees. He seemed confused & said I'm pretty sure that's only for the downtown location. My husband assured him that his company had sent out a company-wide email letting their employees know that the discount was going to be honored at both locations. He said ok, let me check with my manager & I'll be right back. He came back with the new check reflecting the discount & said that moving forward they weren't going to be honoring the discount for x-companies employees at the GVR location, only at the downtown location but that they would "do it this time". *Cue the rolling eyes* Ok, whatever, it wasn't really a big deal & now we knew. We thanked him, paid the bill & got up to leave. As we were just about to the entrance, the manager that our waiter had talked to & had been standing by the hostess booth, physically blocked us from the entrance & went into a spiel about how they would honor the discount this time, etc.. (Yeah, the waiter had already told us the exact same thing!) When my husband mentioned that he  already told the waiter about the email saying the discount would be honored at both locations & that was the reason it was even brought up, he said "yeah, that's something that YOUR company took upon themselves & decided to do, not something we said was ok" Seriously?? My husband works for a well known, very reputable company & I guarantee that if an email was sent out, it wasn't done bc they "took it upon themselves" He made us feel like complete jerks & considering it had already been handled by our waiter & by that point, we already knew what their new policy was for future visits, we both felt that it was completely uncalled for for him to accost us this way. It left both of us with an extremely bad taste in our mouths. If there was any chance of us trying this location again in the future, it was ruined by the aggressively rude manager.

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. Truffle fries (best thing we ordered) &amp; calamari 1/2 spicy 1/2 regular

yvsVjDXY9D5vbPctFryC8w.text: Well, my first time here was MUCH better than the few times I've been to the Downtown location, so that's a good start!  I still think that the menu is a bit overwhelming. Luckily, we were just there for happy hour and didn't have to decide from the bazillion options on the main menu. Most of the menu for happy hour is good (price wise).  We shared the green beans, gorgonzola fries, and each ordered a personal size pizza (I had the Cal Italia). I also ordered meatballs, but never got them. Luckily, we were so full that this wasn't a big deal, and we weren't charged for them.  We were there around 5pm on a Thursday, and it was packed! There seemed to be a wait for a table, so we sat at the counter seating that looks at the wood burning oven.   Our server seemed really overwhelmed, but generally did a good job. The beer selection is decent, but there was honestly nothing that blew me away. However, it is good to see some local beers on tap - although it is not worth it for me to pay a higher price for a beer I can get just down the road, from the source.  Overall, we had a good experience and I will definitely be back.

QHinCXMha_Z8w4-QIHsSVw.text: It was good don't get me wrong, to me there was just nothing special. It was pizza -- it was loud there and there was a NCAA basketball game on real loud. They have like 50 beers on tap, great n cute environment, great for a bunch of guys to meet and watch a game. I personally won't be making any special trips back, it was good but eh .. thanks!

yJXS99FWeKF3OcUcALvmfA.text: First time trying at Pizza Rock. Heard GREAT things about the calamari. And I'm sorry. This sh*t is overcooked. Breeding is MEH. The squid is not the star of this dish. It's alright.  Happy hour drinks were okay. But this place is just mediocre at best. Not worth the hype imho. Okay. f7e7IRd4vxomb7GZPXhd8A.text: I'm typically hesitant to dine at a newly opened restaurant, but I've been waiting ages for Pizza Rock to come to GVR. I've become a huge fan of the downtown location so I was most excited to have it come to my neighborhood and be able to park with ease. We decided to give a go for a late dinner their second night.   Upon arrival, the hostess area was a nightmare. We saw open seats at the bar and opted to go that route. Service was sluggish to start and never really improved. Sitting at the bar with an empty beer and no water is hard to forgive when there are two bartenders and what appeared to be two managers present. Timing was poor, too, it's a pet peeve of mine when staff asks how everything is before you've had a chance to dig in. It feels like such a cop out and they were guilty of this. I will cut them some slack, though, they need time to work out kinks; and the other location typically delivers great service. Although, my last visit wasn't up to par... hopefully, I won't find that this is the current trend.   Anyhow, I've learned I'm not a fan of the pizzas on the happy hour menu and ordering from the menu is the way to go. I love the Margherita and Cracker Thin varieties, and the calzones and strombolis. The Diavola, and New Yorker are good too. This time we switched it up and tried the Detroit Red Top ($27). The meatballs ($8) are always a must! They are mighty delicious!!  The Detroit Red Top does not disappoint. It's a beast of a pizza, even if it is only four slices. Thick dough is layered with Wisconsin brick cheese, white cheddar and mozzarella and then topped with a robust tomato sauce. There are no toppings, but they can be added - next time, I probably will. But this is no boring cheese pizza. It's the crispy cheese edges & buttery crust that make it glorious.   The beer selection is outstanding! It wins me over every single time. I love the variety and the option of getting the best of our local brews in one spot is enticing. I have no doubt I'll become a regular. Hopefully, future service will do nothing to tarnish those plans.

2EjIZPMZe7AhcJleejiRKg.text: Pizza so good we had to go back and get it to go for the big games tonight. Exactly what we expected. Ordered   2 orders of the most flavorful meatballs we ever tasted.   2 orders of perfectly fried calamari   2 New Yorkers which always hit the right #  A MobBoss. Which stole the show with the amount of quality toppings you can taste  St Anthony  which I was too full to try but looked fantastic and from what I heard was just as good as it looked  Henderson - definite must try.   Told the hostess on the phone I wanted to pick it up FRESH. At 6. Get to the location. My pizza is being inspected at 6 on the dot. Perfect service and everyone at home agreed it's definitely the best pizza we've tried and more than worth the price. . Love this place!

rzhgXVP6Nnb1wjbIbuzalQ.text: This was my first time here and I absolutely loved it. The pizza was delicious and the waitress was really fun. They host a weekly trivia night, which was fun to watch, next time I'll participate. I recommend coming here for the pizza and scene.

XkRp8uNbereBEZKX17uqbg.text: I met with a group of friends at this Pizza Rock located inside Green Valley Ranch to try their HH menu and agree with Chris V. that this would be 5 stars had we ordered full sized pizzas. Most at our table have visited other Pizza Rock locations and are familiar with the large pizzas and the larger ones are definitely different from the mini pizzas texture and topping wise.   Pizza Rock Meatballs (3 for $4 on HH menu) - This was ordered by everyone at our table and even some ordered more. Thee meatballs were tender and flavorful and the sauce complimented the balls nicely.   Zucchini Fries ($5) - Fried zucchini with fresh herbs, parmesan and calabrese ranch dipping sauce. There was a good amount for the price and the zucchini fries tasted decent enough, but the sauce was too spicy and had a weird taste to me, though a couple other people at my table did like it. I'd personally like it better with some real good ranch.  Fried "Green" Tomato Caprese ($13) - The fried "green" tomatoes are actually made with brown heirloom tomatoes that top fresh mozzarella, fresh basil and sweet drop peppers and drizzled with balsamic. This was a winner and the fried tomatoes had just the right crispness and paired well with the mozzarella. If you like fried green tomatoes you should give this a try and it's perfect for sharing pre-pizza.   Soppressata Slider ($5) - Soppressata, salami, provolone, mixed greens and balsamic vinaigrette on a baked sea salt bun. This also came with a side of fries which happened to taste really good, but the slider (2 of them) wasn't so good. The buns were so hard that all of us had trouble taking a bite and the balsamic dressing must have been forgotten or at least not drizzled on the slider I had adding to the dryness.   Pesto Paradise ($7 personal size on HH menu) - Pesto, garlic, mozzarella and cherry tomatoes. The menu says this one is made with thin crust. I can't say the crust was much different from the other HH pizzas I tried. The pizza was good, but didn't "wow" me. Decent option if you are not a meat eater, but I'd stick to the Cal Italia or Tony 2 Times.   Tony 2 Times ($7 personal size on HH menu) - Double sausage, pepperoni, mushroom and mozzarella make up this tasty pie. I love mushrooms, but left them off this time since I was sharing with hubby and he doesn't like them. I can't say there was double sausage however there was lots of good flavor going on with this pizza. I'd for sure come back and order a full size pizza of this one.   Mud Pie ($9) - Oreo cookie crust, chocolate ganache, coffee and vanilla bean ice cream that's topped with hot fudge, caramel and whip cream. wish all that it has to be good right? Right! The crust was a bit hard to get my utensil through, but we were all able to hack a piece off this huge frozen treat and everyone enjoyed it.   Currently HH is everyday 3-6 pm and they also have a late night HH that's 10 pm to close.

6wQhMcPORHK5XIVdTdRA-w.text: I was pretty disappointed. My honey got a pizza & I got Alfredo pasta. Very underwhelmed by the pasta- I took a few bites, didn't finish it, & my boyfriend didn't think his pizza was anything memorable. The restaurant's decor is pretty cool & our server was okay. Nothing really left an impression on us to make us go back.

wvWdtrWkjVqliQsmhQv3CQ.text: Positives - Large full bar with 40 draft beers to choose from. - great happy hour every day - numerous styles of pizza to choose from - fast menu of all food types, not just pizza (see menu pictures) - suitable to ages 3+ in atmosphere and food options - great for groups of all sizes or 1 person - fast service - gluten free options - fabulous pizza dough, cheese, sauce, and topping flavor and texture - classic and hilarious music videos playing on the Tv's, very nostalgic!  Negative - I can't find any. Great place!  Great Happy hour and late night happy hour! Every Night! 3pm-6pm and 10pm - 2am (closing) Drinks: wells and 32oz PBR = $4 $2 off all draft beers, wine by glass, and specialty cocktails $7 personal pizzas, or $5 for 1 topping. $4 fries, fried green beans, or meatballs (3 balls an order)  If you are in a munching mood, come here for happy hour for a personal pizza with a lot of dough for a little bit of wallet dough. If you are hungry, come here any time for a massive pizzas. So bring a group of 4 for 1 pizza or come for happy hour with 1 other person for a personal pizza.  Wide selection of pizza types, from Chicago, New York, calzone, classic Italian, American original, Chicago thin, Sicilian, Detroit red top, and even gluten free for those with crohn's disease. The pizzas are gas fired at different temperatures, and the temps are indicated on the menu.  Great, soft dough on the inside and crunchy on the outside, and you get the wonderfully awkward never ending cheese string when you try to take a bite of your pizza because is is of the perfect temperature.  The owner has multiple restaurants in San Francisco, Vegas, Henderson, Sacramento. Thier pizzas have won many awards.   Casual ambiance, good for friends and family.  Classic music videos play on the tv's and on the overhead speakers, along with hilarious Buzzfeed skits.

UIGbaLqxi_IlFMfz8tRIzA.text: Food was absolutely incredible. We got the meatballs as an appetizer and they were delicious! The sauce was to die for! Ordered the Americano pizza as our entree and it was superb !! The flavor was perfect and the pizza cooked to perfection as well. The service could have been better though. It wasn't  terrible but definitely wasn't excellent. We had to ask for water 3 separate times, we didn't get new plates to put our pizza on and the waitress didn't clear out any of our dishes. Hopefully we get better service on our next visit! All that being said we'll still definitely be back though.

We did not like there pizza one bit The Sauce on the pizza was way to Sweet if you could even call it sauce it was just whole smashed Tomatoes We got a whole Pie We both took 1 bite out of each slice & we couldn't even eat the rest also they play some kind of game there with a DJ Well we couldn't even hear each other! lEamGTbRylg37j7ybXfyLA.text: I really like this place. It's on the smaller side. There's a long bar area and then several tables of varying sizes. It's got a nice vibe and ambiance. And the staff super nice, friendly, and attentive!  The beer list is impressive with a lengthy list of drafts, bottles, and cans. They also have a decent list of wines and cocktails. But the beer offerings are the star here.  They have great happy deals on drinks and food from 3-6pm. It's definitely a worthy happy hour.  The food list is yummy. Duh, there's lots of pizza options. The fries are delicious. I'm particularly fond of the gorgonzola fries. The fried green beans are super tasty. The meatballs are wonderful. And so much pizza goodness. I like that they have so many different options of styles - New York, traditional, Sicilian, Chicago thin, gluten free, etc. And the toppings and combos are seemingly endless. Every single pizza on their menu sounds yummy and intriguing. You can't go wrong with any choice you make here.  So in sum, come eat here. The staff will take good care of you and you'll have lots of yum eats.

of4jqDhUmykptkPAmQjN4Q.text: This was our first time at the Green Valley Resort location of Pizza Rock. We've been to the Downtown Vegas location and loved that spot. We sat towards the back next to the DJ truck. We had a large group so this was a good spot.   We ordered a variety of items and everything f was pretty tasty. Truffle Fries, Classic Meatballs, Fried Green Beans, Calamari Fritti, Gorgonzola & Apple salad, Italian Chop salad, Spicy Bucatini pasta, Margherita pizza, New Yorker pizza. The Margherita pizza could have been better, the crust was too soft and the flavor was eh. We needed a crispier crust and more basil. The New Yorker Pizza on the other hand was very flavorful and the crust was cooked just right.  Pizza Rock is a great family spot and for large groups.

gZ7haL8x3C3OfLjsV9rRRw.text: Having grown up in the San Francisco Bay Area, I will have to say that I'm pretty biased towards Tony Gemignani's work.  But at home, his sit-down restaurants are so popular (sometimes up to a 2 hour wait), I usually get slices to go.  I knew that he had opened some locations in the Las Vegas area, but wasn't planning on going out to those areas on my most recent vacation to Vegas.  But, I stumbled upon Green Valley Ranch and was pleasantly surprised that there was a Pizza Rock here.  I couldn't pass up the opportunity to have lunch on a Friday afternoon.  The pizza my wife & I dined on was the Detroit Red Top.  While I've heard about Detroit style pizza before, I haven't had a chance to try it since Tony doesn't offer it as single slices.  The menu says it serves 2-4 people, and it normally comes in 4 huge square slices.  The waitress offered to have it double cut, so it was a little easier to handle.  The pizza came out piping hot, with thick ribbons of marinara sauce poured along the 8 large slices.  When we picked them up off the plate, we wondered on how crisp and firm the bottom was.  Each bite from the middle was very cheesy, but not at all greasy.  And the crust was super crispy and salty, a delight for crust eaters (small children may not appreciate them).  We also ordered a side of fried green beans, which my wife devoured.  Fried really quickly, they were still very firm and had just the right amount of garlic (enough to flavor but not overpower the dish).  In the end, we were super-satisfied with our meal.  We took the half the pizza back to our hotel, which became a midnight snack after a long night of doing what tourists do.  No microwave needed, the slices were still awesome cold.

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. Detroit pizza (double cut)

Q2YZf74GXg28g0eUGSEh7Q.text: Thanks Andew for great service and a perfect Tomato Pie pizza with serrano chilis. Awesome place and pizza as always.

En6aKxQxjaeIURVtK8s8IQ.text: Love this place. We always get takeout as it's a little too loud for my toddler! I love the environment it's nice for a casual date night.  The New Yorker is tasty. I love the Italian chop salad it's the best salad. My daughter loves the meatballs -crowd pleaser. We also get the calamari half spicy and half regular. Love that they have another location closer to our home! Check them out!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. Italian Bloody Mary

E9RM9P0nGMxOPw-oOXi7UQ.text: Don't get me wrong--I usually LOVE Pizza Rock. However, I had never been to the Henderson location before this evening (actually 4:00, so it's not like it was crowded) and while the food was as good as downtown's, my service was AWFUL. I was the 8th to arrive of a group of 10, and it would have been difficult to mistake me for one of the people who had already ordered, as we had to pull up another table for the 3 of us.   The waiter came and took drink orders for the last couple but ignored me, even when I tried to make eye contact. He returned with their drinks and still ignored me. It's True, I was only going to ask for water, which he later told me is only served upon request, but he had no idea if I wanted water or a whole pitcher of beer. Then he returned to take their order, once again ignoring me, and no, I wasn't still looking at the menu. When someone, possibly not the waiter, returned again with drinks and/or food and was leaving, the person next to me asked for some water for me. It was brought, but no query about a food order. When the waiter returned and again ignored me, I got up and confronted him. (Up to this time I had said or done nothing to warrant his dismissive attitude.). Instead of apologizing and owning his errors, he made the above-mentioned excuse that they don't bring water unless asked. Completely irrelevant.   My order was taken  and I received my personal pizza and we all enjoyed our dinner. However some people naturally finished before the last 5 of us but no one was in a rush. Nevertheless, a young lady came to bus the table and took my plate away while I was still holding my last wedge of pizza, although she left some other used plates remaining. This is totally unacceptable. How did she know whether or not I wanted to return my pizza to it's now non-existent plate?  Others were still eating as well and there was no need to rush us.   So my 3 stars is 5 for food, ONE for service, for all 3 of the people that were assigned to our table, and one instead of none, only because I think it was a manager who did bring me my pizza, apologized and said he discounted the bill some. As for the last part, because I was not paying, I don't know how much was taken off.   So go for the pizza, but don't expect great service.

c4e8NfERInQFLWOqW33D3w.text: What happened to the customer service at this place? This USED to be our favorite go to spot for dinner but NOT anymore. We literally just walked out because we were seated and waited for 30 minutes while we watched 2 other tables get served around us. Like we were literally invisible. No server even looked our way so I couldn't get anyone's attention. When we walked out we told the hostess and all she said was omg I'm so sorry. Really!!! This was the 3rd time we've experienced bad service but we usually go back because the food is so good. No more!!!!!!

XNULB8ir9BTKI-_gezQCJQ.text: This is one of my favorite pizza places in town! It's located at the Green Valley Casino, but makes it very easy to find as its right thru the doors from the outdoor parking area.  Every time I come here, there is a little bit of a wait. But nothing too bad, the longest I've waited is about 20 minutes. But I waited at the bar, which was nice and the time went by super fast! They have a great beer selection and wine selection. And a variety of things on their menu! You can choose from salad, pasta, a variety of appetizers, and of course pizza! I have only had about two of their pizzas (its hard to stray away from my favorites lol) but they were amazing! If you love thin crust pizza, then this is the place for you!  Their menus are in old vinyl covers, which is super cool and I loved it. A super hipster vibe to it. It does get pretty loud in there just because it's inside the casino and the walls are open to see out.   If you're visiting, definitely check this place out! And if you're a local, most likely you've been here before because it's AMAZING

xaCBINApYINaIVIy9AZujg.text: Grabbed a quick bite to eat here last week and loved the atmosphere and service. The pizza was really good too. Don't miss this place if u get a chance.

Im7HfheMa_koNIyT3Yfqdg.text: Pizza Rock's food was very good - but their customer service was egregious. I delivered via Yelp/GrubHub. With our dinner, we ordered their local root beer. It didn't arrive with the order, and Pizza Rock didn't bother to contact GrubHub or me to let us know it was ommited from the order. Nor did they issue a refund.   When I called Pizza Rock to find out what happened, this silly girl brushes off accountability--gushing 1 million miles per hour: "Ohwellthat'snotourproblem-youhavetocallGrubHubandthey'llsendyouanotherrootbeer, k?"   So, I call GrubHub, wait for some time on Hold, they apologize for the forgotten root beer, issue a refund, tell me to re-order the root beer because they have to assign a new driver, give me $5 to cover the NEW delivery charge and driver tip, I wait and wait for all that to come through, then order again--15 minutes later GrubHub calls and says "They're out of the root beer. We're so sorry, we'll issue another refund."    I call to talk to the Pizza Rock manager--told him I wasted **35 MINUTES** on this ridiculous root beer escapade because they neglected to simply notify GrubHub *OR* me that they didn't FORGET the root beer, they---as the manager intoned---have not even had that root beer at the restaurant for over 1 month.  He says indignantly that the girl who answered the phone did exactly what she should have---she was not obligated to check whether Pizza Rock actually had the root beer in stock, that it was up to the CUSTOMER to go through the entire refund and reorder process through GrubHub before anyone at Pizza Rock would even check to see whether Pizza Rock even had the desired item.  Wow...  4.5 stars for very yummy, well-prepared food. 1 star for the indignant responsibility-shirking manager. 0 stars for silly tornado-speaking girl who answered the phone and couldn't be bothered to ask the kitchen why they didn't include the root beer--which would have saved me 35 minutes on this abject stupidity.

hHFnAd3Jy_yMUjus1BtCKg.text: This is my go to for a weekday reverse happy hour in the green valley area when i want to throw down pizza and booze late at night.   Hours: 10 pm to midnight  Service: I seem to have a different server every time and they're all solid. Friendly and attentive always.  food: $4, $5 and $7 happy hour menu is #1!  I always go with: the $4 pizza rock meatballs. you get 3 lacrosse ball sized meatballs that are tasty.  Personal pizza with one topping is $5 and is awesome.  The crust and cheese is yum and the perfect size for late night eating without feeling too guilty. I'll just keep telling myself that. ;)  Drink: $4 well drinks are good to go and I'll try a trendy craft beer where they'll knock off $2 at happy hour.   I haven't been here other than for reverse happy hour but they knock it out of the park every time. Food and service has always been on point and I'll be back sooner vs later. Their reverse happy hour pizza is bae af.  hehehe =)

X1gxPlqg3RBDZl3jjfugrg.text: Last night three of us went to Pizza Rock inside The Green Valley Ranch Hotel and had a Great time! The martinis were very tasty and reasonably priced as we were there for Happy Hour. The Rosemary & Garlic fries were flavorful and there was not too much rosemary or garlic. The three of us split the Mob Boss pizza and is was the best pizza! Even had leftovers to take home for lunch the next day. Also, Jen waited on us and provided Great on time service with a smile!

1c_wCuVXkTK8PlQFRwJlQQ.text: There's one thing I've discovered about myself recently (like in the last year), and that is that I LOVE PIZZA. I never quite understood people who'd say, "I love pizza."  I've been doing a pizza Thursdays for a year. That's also probably why my doc is telling me I need to watch my cholesterol. But that's besides the point. I've been wanting to hit up every pizza joint out to compare.  The pizza I had was an OK for me. The breading was not my favorite. I also didn't like the fennel sausage that was in my pizza. It just clashed with the other ingredients.  For me, the best pizza is about the crust and I'm also super picky about the thickness of the crust.   Will not be going back for pizza.

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. New Yorker with house made fennel sausage, pepperoni, and ricotta. I did not like the fennel sausage (too sweet) but the other stuff good.

7HJBBCjYrp7RZXvWBHPFOg.text: Huge beer selection, huge pizza selection, what more could you want? For appetizers the Gorgonzola fries and the Spicy Calamari are my personal faves. If you have enough people, the 3-way Sicilian style pizzas are a good sampling of different flavors. Love the NY style, love the "meat lovers" type one too. The best part is it's always straight from the over to your plate so it's hot and the crust is crispy!

hvmW2jKcKDJN6Q1Fx4IVUQ.text: We come here pretty often and always have a good experience.   They take reservations, which I would recommend on weekends and during peak dinner hours, just to be safe.   The have many beers on tap and bottled, and they have some fun cocktails. For food, the pizzas are thin crust and really good, we've tried a number of them and I just can't bring myself to pick a favorite.   The happy hour menu is a great way to try out different items and share with the people that you're with. They have a regular happy hour and a reverse happy hour which runs from 10-midnight.   If you're at Green Valley Ranch or at the district, this is a great restaurant to try out. After all, who doesn't like pizza?!

3x97rV2oqU1hmZllIIVnsg.text: Ok, there's no other way to say this, so I'll just say it - I got diarrhea twice from this place and I still continue to eat here. That's how good it is!

Jf2k5mGUWyFkwKIHdLQj5g.text: We frequent this location quite often.    The service is usually pretty great.   Frequent refills.  Knowledgeable staff.   The food also usually comes out pretty quickly.   They have a huge variety of pizzas.   Not just toppings but different types of dough.   They separate their menu based on regional pizza style.   I've tried a pizza in every region and my standouts are the new Yorker, the stout and sausage, and the artichoke Joe.   Also, their balsamic vinaigrette on their house salad is amazing!   If you like beer they also have an extensive collection with quite reasonable pricing.   There are some off nights when service is terrible and pizza kind of sucks but those are very very rare and they always try to make up for it.   Overall, great place for good pizza.

QPM1LRxoZwO1f2hIHToXcQ.text: I couldn't celebrate national pizza day without eating pizza. I got off of work a little late and wanted to check this place out since it's open til 2am.  I got super excited about happy hour after 10pm and they even had personal pans!! I just really wished they have a little more options for personal pans but other than that, it was delicious. I ordered the pesto paradise and my friend ordered the cal italia. However, we ended up sharing because we wanted to try both pizzas. I'm not a big fan of balsamic but the reduction on the cal italia was SO GOOD. Definitely ordering that one the next time. We also ordered Italian fries with gorgonzola. I'm not too fond of gorgonzola but we put a ton of Parmesan cheese and it was really good!

_s8zS6nBSVyMrbhweE5ocg.text: Love, love, love the food!! I've been here a few times and have never tried something I don't like!! Everything is amazing!! The only bummer about this place is the service is much to be desired!!   We came in last night and it didn't seem as busy as the lack of service implied it to be. When arrived We were placed on a 10-15 minute wait and they said they would text us, after 20 minutes of the first sent text message and seeing people approach the host stand and seat people before us, we then asked how much longer. The hostess said two minutes, that they would clear off a table for us right now. At this point I'm under the impression that they forgot about us. Once we sat down and got comfortable we looked at the menu! Between 3 1/2 of us we got the New Yorker pizza, the apple and Gorgonzola salad, zucchini fries and beer battered artichoke. I was kinda bummed that they were out of the garlic green beans but that's ok we tried something new!! We also ordered some drinks! The appetizers and salad came out before we got our drinks, at the time it was ok because we had our water that of course we started out with! By the time we got our drinks and our pizza we were low on water. Throughout our whole dinner our server came only twice to refill our water. Once before our main pizza came and once before we left . I think one of my biggest pet peeves, and I'm sure I'm not the only one, is sitting almost your entire dinner without a drink refill. Another HUGE pet peeve that can really ruin an entire experience is when your server tries to rush you and take your plate and fork before your even finished. It was a Whoa moment for me!! After we asked for a refill on water we also asked for the check. As we left there was not even a thank you or good bye or anything from any of the staff including our server or the staff that stood at the hostess stand!!   The only saving grace at this establishment is that the food is spectacular!! I just wish our experience was as tasteful as the food!!

5pqd2j63fOwnPrPQgJdXnQ.text: This is for the beer selection and bar service. Quick order and 40 tap beer selections. In addition, there seems about 100 regular, special and limited release beer bottles. This night and time had a 90's + rap/dance mix,   aahhhh the memories. A short respite from the GVR gambling.   Oh yeah, where I sat, I could see the cooks preparing the dough and they all were wearing GLOVES! Love seeing that. Kitchen and staff look clean and professional.

I munched on them and the next thing I know they were all gone! Lol. Also ordered a pizza that was on the happy hour menu but I cant remember the name, it had all kinds of meats and it was delish. iPJ4eCRM7CP7vBlNBCcszQ.text: The pizza is so good. We usually get the New Yorker or tomato pie with pepperoni.   We had placed a to go order about three weeks ago that wasn't baked to our liking and so we had called in - told by a male manager they'd take care of it form of a gift card on our next visit. On our next visit, the girl helping us looked like we had four heads and insisted she had no documentation of the situation. We paid for the pizza but it was more so the point. We're locals, we frequent and I was a little frustrated.   Moving forward, we will be sure to keep tally time day and person we spoke with since follow through is lacking and service can more times than not be a miss.

x_vveDh3Bv6aCxhSXKcTew.text: Pizza Rock.  I'd eaten at the Pizza Rock downtown, a few months ago.  I had one slice of pizza that was pretty good.   We were looking for a place to host the rehearsal dinner for my wedding this past weekend, and as I was staying at Green Valley Ranch that night, we decided on Pizza Rock.  It was easy to make a reservation, and we had the entire back patio to ourselves.    We arrived at about 6:00/6:15, and were seated almost immediately.  The hostesses were awesome, and very polite, considering when I arrived, I was a little hangry, and was a little short with them.    We had about 25 people in the party, and two main servers, Vinny and Jen.  There were other support staff to run drinks and food.  Vinny and Jen were absolutely incredible.  They were friendly.  They had the party under control.  We had to do the check in kind of an interesting manner (we covered all the food, and drinks for the family, but all other alcohol was separate)...I only had to tell them one time who was to be included on the food check, and they handled the rest.   They both were full of congratulations to my (now) husband and I, and Vinny was even calling my mom "Mom" by the end of the night.  Its been a long time since I've had such personable service.    I spoke to one of the managers, who was super nice, too, to let them know what an amazing job they did.  Oh...the pizza?  HOLY. COW.  Seriously, everything we ate was amazing.  We had a plain cheese and sausage that was great.  The Mob Boss(Molinari Salami, Bacon, Pepperoni, Linguica, Italian Sausage, Mushrooms, Bell Peppers, Red Onions, Black Olives, Green Onions, Cherry Tomatoes, Garlic) and the Old Chicago (Tomato Sauce Mozzarella, Provolone, Garlic, Italian Fennel Sausage, Sliced Meatballs, Ricotta, Romano, Oregano) were the biggest hits though.  Incredible flavor, Mob Boss with thick crust, Old Chicago with thin...I think we ordered 8 of these pizzas on their own.  The veggie pizza was great too, but I ate most of that one. ;)  The rest of the party are huge meat eaters.    Being from Chicago, myself and another Yelp Elite friend (currently in LA) were both REALLY impressed with the quality of the pizza.  And we know good pizza.   Also, can I just say, that any spot that has Delirium beer on draught is a winner in my book.  They had Delirium red, which is my new favorite, and at $8 a glass, I was SOLD.  I had two. :)   So...Thursday night's experience was SO good, that upon returning to the hotel after the wedding on Friday, and walking by, smelling the amazing aroma...my husband and I decided to have dinner there again.  They have a late night happy hour, with a $3, $5, $7 menu...we got two personal Cal Italia pizzas (Asiago, Mozzarella, Imported Gorgonzola, Sweet Fig Preserve, Prosciutto di Parma, Parmigiano-Reggiano, Balsamic Reduction) for $14!!!  We had Jen again as our server, and not only did she remember us, but she remembered that we had gotten married that day.  We were given a complimentary "Tony's Tiramisu" for dessert, and THAT was absolutely delicious.  Morgan isn't a fan of tiramisu normally, but he loved this.    Pizza Rock, you guys are absolutely amazing.  I can't wait to come back to try more of your delicious food.  Thanks for making the rehearsal dinner so easy and stress free, and for making us want to come back again the next night.

C5ST9JyqvjpRHsP3r4AA6A.text: This was foolish. By far the worst meal I have ever had! The service was insanely poor. I have never ever in my entire life wasted my money like I did tonight. I swear to anyone who reads this post. Go somewhere, anywhere else. This place is a disgrace to Green Valley Ranch. I can't even begin to tell you how poor our service and food was. I pray the manager/owner reads this and does something to ensure the garbage served to my table tonight is either donated to the less fortunate or just thrown out.  I can't even begin to say how disappointed I am I this place. SPEND YOUR MONEY ELSEWHERE!

t5M86dobnkUlAg-G8lniqQ.text: I have been a fan of Pizza Rock since it opened downtown and wanted to try the one in GVR. I met a few friends for some NFL games on Sunday and we sat out on the patio. - The service at this location was horrible. I am not sure if it was we were outside but our server was not very present most of the day and we were fortunate enough to have her change shifts just mid way through our time there. the second server was a little better but still it wasn't that great of service overall. -The food was also a little off. Our pizza which had several kinds of meat was greasier than normal. I know meat and cheese can produce grease but it was a pizza I had before and it was more than expected.  - I will go back to the downtown location but will be in no hurry to go back to the GVR location, not with the other food options nearby

9Uhz68xLona9M80mW4914g.text: This review is just for their store in the food court, not the restaurant. Easily this is the best quality pizza I have ever had. Great taste, and toppings, and near perfect crust. With quality, you pay a little more for the slices to go $6-8, but they are large slices.  Please try them and see for yourself!

FhkwMpEe92TUV313i4cMlg.text: This is not hyperbole:  Their pizza might be the worst I've had in my 50 years of eating a lot of pizza.  It was nasty and had this funky taste to it.  And for the price and size of it?  Yowza.  Never again.

5Yay-93PJXboFpUXLaawjA.text: Only four stars because of the service !! Took a very long time in the beginning!! The food was awesome !! The New Yorker is our favorite .... We also had the calamari that is very bomb !!! The GVR location is much bigger than you think !! Great look and place for beers and some of the best Pizza! Highly recommend to all ....

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States

0HK28jaeyKZ9qi6R73DnTw.text: Ordered a New Yorker pizza to go tonight and when I got home found that half the pizza was burnt, the crust was hard as rock and found bits of black plastic in the pizza. Always liked the Downtown location and first time having pizza at the GV Ranch location. Waste of $30 and will not be back.

fNpUovnXs7dNRDOELOVRMA.text: Insane good pizza!!!! The crust alone is amazing! Highly recommended. Cool atmosphere. They have booths to the right when you walk in also. You can't see them from the front. I don't like tables and chairs so I was happy.

b97QGTuH-ccFX02EKzmLTA.text: I have mixed feelings about this place.   I had the Margherita and New York pizza. The Margherita's crust was so thin and yummy, I think it's my favorite. The New York pizza had a ridiculous amount of cheese on it, more like clumps. It was greasy and upset my stomach! The garlic fries I ordered at the downtown location were completely different here. They were hard and tasted like plain fries. I was disappointed because they were so good at the other location.  The atmosphere was kind of obnoxious. The music was so loud we couldn't have a conversation. I felt like they were trying to get people to notice the restaurant and want to come in. Your pizza should bring in customer, not a club like atmosphere lol.  I'm giving it three stars because of the location. There aren't that many choices at GVR. The places are either expensive or fast food. This is a nice in between, so if you're wanting pizza and have to stay in the hotel, I would give it a try. However, if you're able to leave Green Valley Ranch, you have better options!

B9GNkgOWDN7db5cTNRvcyg.text: Delicious pizza! Ordered the cheese sicilian and it was a lot like what I used to have back home in NY, but the slices were a lot smaller. The thick crust was crunchy and satisfying. The pizza selection is just overwhelming... there's too much decision making involved. Everyone likes choices but I'd rather not have to choose. Do one thing and do it well, IMO. Grimaldi's and their thin crust in the Brick Oven; Settebello and their straight up Italian style pizza; etc. What I love about pizza is that every place I go makes it an entirely different meal, but I want it to be a no brainer. There's a learning curve involved here and the prices are too steep to order a little of everything.   Great location in the non-smoking part of Green Valley Ranch. Very cool environment that's dark and casual. Service was OK. But we order meatballs and they never came.   We're drawn in now so we'll be back to taste some of the other styles.

FOVbGKKQeues2iGHtUga3Q.text: Mixed First Impressions Three of us dined, each of us ordered entrees. Waiter (Nick) was good and attentive. However, all three of us got our entrees at different times. In fact after the first entree arrived the second wasn't brought until after the first diner finished. I never received my entree as I cancelled since the kitchen didn't have it ready by the time the second entree was consumed and they were the exact same dish (Gorgonzola Burgers). Front of house service is good but kitchen management obviously needs work.  I can't comment on flavor of food since I didn't eat. The other two with me said it was good so I'll have to take their word for it. I live across the street but not sure I'll return.

Y8yukcKKOi2v9QN9yuwDDg.text: We've been to Tony's in SF and this is a poor, poor namesake. Fake facade, bad choice. Came in at 11:00 on a Thursday nite, a few people at bar, two tables occupied-so basically dead. Slow service and took the guy 20 minutes to start rolling out our pizza dough-he was eating in the back. Pizzas marginal-a margarita and a marinara-nothing like the real Tony's. Settobellos is waaaay better. Won't be back here. P.S.-the music is horrible hear-heavy metal playing so loud you can't even think. Great example of a poorly run, no care business-must be a tax write off.

dqu61nAwGhN6Q3X-r_IYnQ.text: AMAZING PIZZA! Other than the fact we had to find our server at first this was simply THE BEST pizza hands down!!!  We had The Mob Boss and it was over the top good. PR is now our go to  pizza joint in From now on.

_QK2_-7y4yiWdo-Cpamm9g.text: Party of 18 people and the food was great. Veronica, our server, was very attentive and absolutely amazing. Best service we have had in quite some time.

dtKoqi1ISYGkf85slhoXKg.text: Ranked as TOP 10 PIZZA in USA  Rated as one of the top 10 pizza places in the USA this place is awesome and is the best pizza I have had in years!  The quality of the everything was amazing!  This location is better than the downtown location for some reason.  The mud pie is also very very good!!

o3AreTRHqb9xBbaeVdyyjw.text: Soooooo glad they opened a Pizza Rock in Henderson...love the downtown location and now I can get the same great pizza nearby. Located in the Green Valley Ranch (right near the Drop Bar), has similar decor as downtown but a little brighter and louder. They do have the semi (DJ booth) and trailer in the middle of the restaurant, which is cool. The staff is friendly and very accommodating, my brother-in-law asked if they could put the Ducks hockey game on the big screen and the manager obliged...  We started with apps...the meatballs (moist and delicious!), the garlicky green beans (yum!), and added the Mac & cheese at the last minute (with bacon and pancetta, c'mon you know it makes everything better!)...we had trouble settling on a pizza to share, so finally decided to get the Roma #1. It has three different pizzas on one large slab...prosciutto,gorgonzola and fig preserve (my favorite, as I usually get the Cal Italia). Then there's the Sopressata, arugula, parm-reggiano with hot pepper oil (gives it a little kick). And the last part is tomatoes, olives, with basil (really good). We were almost too full by the time the pizza came out (almost ).  In my opinion, the best pizza in Las Vegas, and now Henderson...mangiamo!

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. Margherita. ..
Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. Hey, there&#39;s beer in that truck!
Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. Cal italia, mmmmm...

ncWpE0KjixVIgfN3iiYIbw.text: Every pizza I have had is delicious. Paige was our server and she did a awesome job! Definitely will be back

WyEI2-kkKOQvbxA5UZN1zw.text: I love the tomatoes and the meatballs! Great drink specials and who doesn't love pizza! Various styles made in your face! The cracker crust is so yum. Did I mention the drinks? They have so many beers and tons of liquor. Take a picture in front of the truck.

KH_hKr2NBoairl2I_W2dFQ.text: Wonderful spot! Creative menus - LP jackets with menus printed on the inside covers and on the LPs. Great gluten-free and vegan options. Billie was our server and did an outstanding job. He came apologetically to our table to let us know he had put our order in late and that management would discount our appetizer for the inconvenience. Rare to find this kind of customer service any more. Thanks for a wonderful evening!

BOB3DNQsj2SrS-ZlOacYhQ.text: I love their food! The Chicago style wood oven pizza is the best! Hubby loves the lasagna.  My favorites are pizza and Stromboli, I need to branch out and try something new! There is a DJ in a semi truck inside the restaurant, and while that is very cool, as others have said--it's so loud you can't have a conversation!  There are lots of tvs playing sports or music videos. Staff is friendly and helpful.

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. Pepperoli Stromboli

0wpNQxLEqHDky5Xuh9tzMw.text: Had a ton of fun at the grand opening of Tony Gemigniani's newest spot in Vegas this Monday! Loved the vibe and hip decor of this casino spot and thought it was a fantastic spot to host a group dinner to kick off our work week... The Calamari was delicious and the Pizzas were creative and delicious as to be expected at any of Tony's spots! Would recommend for a fun and upscale-casual carb load should you have a troop to feed!

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. Sweet decor, check out the lighting!
Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. Good times!
Photo of Pizza Rock - Henderson, NV, United States. Decor!

qFSULaF_dAkfqqmDkjxQ7w.text: This place I think is overrated.I had heard it was very good In all fairness I can't eat pizza and am dieting but others in my party didn't like their pizza.They have A very poor selection of healthy and salads and lo cal selections

GiEZb3FH8YugGpr0k2x6Aw.text: Best pizza in town!  Great service, reasonable prices and great vibe.  Definitely going back.

mlVCDVFS2QVZRVC5I4Cx4Q.text: I met my cousin at Green valley ranch for lunch and we picked Pizza Rock. Neither of us had been here, but it smelled great! We were quickly shown to a table. Our server came over to get our drink order and welcome us. I mentioned we were here for the first time and he then explained how the menu showcased several different types of pizza styles and told us his favorite. We got the garlic garlic bread and the Michigan Ave pizza (thin crust pepperoni). He offered a side of marinara sauce for the bread. The bread was great and had a nice garlic flavor. The pizza was AMAZING!!! Perfect amount of sauce, cheese and pepperoni. It was cooked nice and crispy. The atmosphere, service and food are first class. He gladly boxed up our leftovers and brought the check, as I was signing, he delivered a salad and french fries to the table beside us. OMG, the amazing smell from those fries!!! We asked about them and were told they were garlic/rosemary fries. That's on the list for next time!

bdRekh0mlPvR_t1hHudoPQ.text: This place is AMAZING!!  We went for my brother's birthday and we were all blown away.  Our server Ben was fantastic and really made our visit an evening to remember.  The pizza is great, the atmosphere is fun, and I will definitely be returning.  Thank you so much Ben, and  everyone at Pizza Rock...you guys ROCK!!!  We will be back soon.

FOXxKbQRIBXeRKSGD2c5Bw.text: Love this place! We came with our whole family and rolled deep with kids because that's the stage of life we are in. The adults were outnumbered, but we don't get together as a family all that often, because I live out of state. The staff was nothing but kind and accommodating. It's such a gamble going to dinner with kids, sometimes you are made to feel unwelcome. This was NOT the case at Pizza Rock. They were so kind and welcoming. The manager even came over to introduce himself, because we spoke earlier that day when I made a reservation. The food was amazing as well. Huge props and thanks to the staff at Pizza Rock. We had such a great night out as a family. Thank you so much!

OzjvxKGRhHcHdtffVuSHhA.text: My family and I wanted to go to Pizza Rock, since this is in a casino, we couldn't really see fro, the outside that that was the backdrop we went in. I guess it was good to go in the backdoor, that way we saw how empty that place actually was. Well we made our way thru the whole place, just to be told at the hostess stand, that we had to wait 30-40 minutes, and that with little children in a smokey casino, while the place was empty. Well if that is customer service I don't know what to say. You make me wait 30-40 for a empty restaurant. Needless to say, we left!

08JyslP87DKAyQ4dG3YsdA.text: Came to see what there was to offer and found delicious calamari, perfect clams, mega meatballs, and two perfectly flavored pies. We tried the Detroit (my fav) and the margarita (amazing in its own category).  Everything was a 5 star plus: atmosphere, service, freshness, temperature, presentation.... Really all you could ask for in a pizza place is here and more.  Will definitely be back for more-that Detroit is better a few hours later even!

S0OTpMJDJpbeP8CWLHTngw.text: Beat pizza EVER. and they can custom order if you don't like certain things. 10/10 always coming back and always telling people to go (: Pizza and pasta is bomb

btYPlBTB_n1p_l3lEoYLyg.text: OMG!  This was amazing!  It gets this NY pizza-snob's seal of approval.  Given, this is only based on one pizza when this place has a slew of amazing options.   Me and my friends had the Detroit Red Top.    Honestly, I thought it was going to be a boring pan pizza that would taste like Pizza Hut.  Boy was I wrong!  This pizza is so full of flavors it's unreal.  From the buttery seasoned crust, tangy pizza sauce and the edges that were almost like buttery crunchy cheese.    The combination of Wisconsin Block cheese, Cheddar and Mozzarella were perfect!  It's going to be hard to decide on another pizza knowing this delicious piece of art exists.   On a side note: they have a pretty darn good beer list!

qULJodJq9YXveaVD_9Yctg.text: First and foremost, the food is phenomenal!!!  The atmosphere is fantastic, and family friendly.  What made our night over the top.... our server, Billie!  This guy was all smiles, great attitude, amazing with the kids and very attentive!  We will definitely be returning regularly and asking for his section!

6cgL8IdQrNhgIUCG09FzqQ.text: The varieties of pizzas is awesome.  Our group of 4 couldn't decide so we ordered 3 different styles of pizza and all were terrific.  Server was friendly, food was amazing.  Wish we could go more often, but food is so good we could easily become overweight quickly as it is impossible not to overeat at this place.

bld-1MEW7tIg-ZWbtot4qQ.text: Ordered a plate of meatballs--amazing. Ordered clams-pretty good. Ordered 2 pizzas a margherita & a New Yorker. Both were a soggy mess. The toppings literally fell off the pizza when you picked it up. It was complete mush. When we complained the waitress was combative and defensive saying that's how the pizza is meant to be. Regardless, it's awful. And when you order two different pizzas and your waitstaff seems to know they're both soggy, they should have the courtesy to tell you. We asked to speak to the manager...35 minutes it took him to come over. The waitress kept asking "has he been here yet? He said he was coming right over". That pissed me off the most. The fact that we were already very unhappy and that it took him 35 minutes to address our situation. And that he was also argumentative & wanted to give us a rundown of each pizza they serve...little too late for that. So that completely cancelled out the delicious meatballs. The experience was awful. And we are locals. We have dined at the downtown location and the pizza was top notch. My advice would be to make sure the servers are explaining the many different pizzas on the menu. And if a table orders multiple pizzas that are all soggy and wet with loads of sauce, give them a heads up. Can't imagine returning. We probably would be more willing if it wasn't for the combativeness of the personnel. We'll stick to Metro, Grimaldi's & Settebello for now on.

3-N6eiehZAw8HdepWa3MkA.text: Food was delicious and our server Vincent was nice and helpful in explaining the different types of pizza on the menu. Was great about coming back and checking on us and refilling drinks. The only reason why I couldn't give 5 stars was that even though this is a nonsmoking restaurant there are literally people in the casino smoking 5 ft from you. I recommend installing glass between the restaurant and casino so you still have visibility but have a more pleasant dining experience.

hPB5NQv1jFnFBddFauG_WA.text: Decided to try this place too see what all the hoopla is about.  The truffle fries are just snack bar quality - just appeared to have a little crust on them; couldn't taste the truffle.  We ordered two pizzas that were just OK.  They were especially greasy, but they're not stingy with their toppings.  Unlike a few other posters, we had excellent service.  I think they have their niche audience, but, for me, Settebello is more my speed.  The atmosphere and food quality at Settebello is better. They also serve a higher quality pizza, and you can enjoy the company of the people you're with.  But, if you're looking for trendy and loud with OK food, you'll be happier at Pizza Rock.

Xpwn9p4bo9PM4dS4DKIPRA.text: Came here with our sone who are from Chicago . Be prepared - I like my music loud and it's very loud here! Took the option to sit on the patio which was a good choice as it gets you away from the casino smoke. I had the quinoa salad to start - it tasted good but for the price it was really overpriced- I had the vegetarian gluten free pizza which was good but really overpriced as well. My sons and husband had the Sicilian pizza which was supposed to feed 5 - they polished the whole thing off and said it was tasty. Service was okay - overall a good experience but giving 3 stars for noise ( I did read that in other reviews but never figured it would be this loud - we had to shout at each other) and value for price .

9KXkhABSJLq79oPgY_4ABw.text: s l o w  service....kitchen is slow.  if you are in a hurry, this is not for you.  when the appetizer came with the meal, the meatballs were good!!  pizza has a LOT of sauce....just fyi.  more sauce than cheese on the new york pizza.

EnKqjE1A3pfWMzNgVCGrkQ.text: So food as always was amazing and the beer was good, but the service this time was just terrible. If I wanted to be ignored and forgotten about then I would have gone to Applebee's. Our waitress Paige came over only to take the order and drop off the check. The manager on staff dropped off our drinks and food and also checked on us. At the end of the meal I asked a hostess to speak to the manager on staff but I guess she didn't relay that message because she stayed at the host stand. I just happened to thank him for working harder and being better than his staff. All-in-all if it had been my first go around there then I would not be returning but I know better. There are great servers there and an excellent managing staff and atmosphere. Maybe I'll ask for the best server next time I go there. This place still has great food and it's still an awesome brew menu. I will be going back just not the that server's section.

WUCkgKF1odZakiupxuGBUQ.text: Food is amazing! Try the old Chicago pizza. Drink selection is awesome too! I think if they could just turn the music down a bit I'd give it 5 stars. Sometimes it's so loud you can't talk over it (and this is coming from a young guy).

_Iz-iMzLC1BYtcQTDb13iw.text: Decent pizza with an ok price, great selection and quality ingredients. I would eat here again and again. Not your dominos pizza and if you love rock you'll love this place!

eMj-6ZSSlMzDKTSSUYe5dw.text: OMG...This is as good as it gets. This place lives up to it's name. It rocks!!! An enourmous menu with everything under the sun. Service was fast and friendly. (3) of us ordered the New Yorker and a Chicago thin crust Pepperoni pizza. The New Yorker was the best pizza any of us EVER ate. The pepperoni was just OK. Nothing out of this world. But look out. This is a fantastic place that must be visited.

XGM-7hoBavpu3CelJZEG6A.text: This is a pizza place/bar inside Green Valley Resort casino. The restaurant has both pub height tables and regular height tables along with very nice bar seating The staff was friendly and attentive, this was Sunday afternoon 3:30-4:30 PM. We ordered the peperoni classic and a deep fried calzone. The pizza crust was near perfect and the cheese, sauce and peperoni were all high quality ingredients, the crust is what made the pizza stand out. The deep fried Manhattan calzone was also excellent, next time I will order it with a little more marinara sauce. The selection of beer is extensive, I had the Alpine Hoppy Birthday beer, it was a combination of citusy/sour/hoppy making a good summer beer, 5.5% alcohol and it did not taste watered down at all. Overall a pretty decent first meal there. I will try this place a few more times and if its consistent  with the food and service I will add another star or two.

E6XMn0vmFoupcCg-JLDc3w.text: Kids and I wanted to try something different and ended up here.  We get seated, get our sodas and are looking at the menu when suddenly we are hit with a blast of hot air that blew our napkins, placemats (flew up & hit son in face both times)and menus off our table.! A man that appeared to be an employee walks by and says "sorry".  We collect everything off the floor and proceed to look at the menu and bam....he walks out the door and does it again! I decide that this place is not for the kids and I and go pay our $10 bill for 3 sodas that we didn't touch.  I ask for the manager and explain what hsppened and rather than saying sorry, the drinks are on us he just says "you should have asked to be moved".... it's at least 110 degrees outside, I've been running around in it all day.  I sit down to enjoy a nice meal and after what just happened I just want to leave.  Comp my drinks and maybe I'll try it again...or don't and I'll tell at least 10 people how unhappy I was.

fLIQYDWy407Vrm8PKquesQ.text: Terrible service! Just went for a date night, tried to start off with the calamari and ordered our pizza right after. The pizza showed up within minutes....no calamari. We weren't sure if it was a mix up in the kitchen or our server. Pizza was good, not as good as setebello but I suppose you go there for the atmosphere more than the food. At the end we didn't finish all of our pizza and our server said she would pack up the leftovers. Took the pizza and brought us our check. As soon as she came back to get the check she was informed we didn't need change and told us to have a good night and left. She never brought our take home box to us! I'm not sure if the music videos and blaring music is there for enjoyment or more for you to be distracted from the awful service. I never write a terrible review but I think after our dinner it was warranted. Take your money and go across the street to setebello.

_EiY47hWw4mJr2IjiRk8ug.text: Best gluten free pizza in town! Love the white/arugula pizza. Truffle fries are great too.

bBH9UG0A-c-juwOVilarzQ.text: Amazingly delicious - fast & friendly service - even on a Friday night. Definitely a new favorite.

zkeOwfCebFKphaOG8jbGOg.text: We went here with friends tonight. We had heard good things about this place and decided to try it. We ordered the calamari as an appetizer. It was ok, a bit too soggy and too spicy for our tastes. 3 of us ordered the $5.00 cocktails which were very very weak. Ok, don't panic it is called " pizza Rock", so let's wait to fully judge until we have the pizza. One of our friends ordered the Caesar salad. She enjoyed it and it had the wonderful white anchovies. Another friend enjoyed the spaghetti with meatballs. Now my wife and I were quite excited for the pizza to arrive. We had ordered the " chicago style " meat pizza. The description said it had a thin crust, which surprised my wife and I because we have been to Chicago many times and " chicago style" pizza that we have always enjoyed is a deep dish pizza, but we were game and ready to try their interpretation of " chicago style" pizza. My wife and I have had pizza all over the world, and without a doubt, this was the WORST pizza we have ever had. The crust was very similar in consistency to a dry saltine cracker. Very sparse cheese and even more limited meat. The total bill with tip came to just over $100.00 so the food wasn't bargain priced. The awful pizza was $23.00.  Will not be going back. Pizza rock....sank.

kPNSYuHPSp5WmRNt0BBrBg.text: We went here because we liked the downtown Las Vegas location which has great pizza cocktails and service!!!! This location on the other hand was a horrible Father's Day Dining experience... We waited 20-30minutes to get served water at 2:45 pm. We specifically asked  for our NY style thin crust to be cooked lightly not burned at all!! The pizza came out burned loaded with sauce and no mozzarella cheese.. My GF complained and the manager said it was impossible to lightly cook the pizza with that crust type... Yet my son sitting right next to me had same pizza cooked perfectly.. The Moscow Mule was terrible and the manager came back and said they would cook us a new pizza and not charge us.. Well the second pizza was miraculously and shockingly cooked perfectly.. Manager said we would NOT be charged yet we were charged for both pizzas and were given total without itemized bill... We were there for 2 hrs  for pizza and salads!! Stay far away from this pizza place!!

ntien2kGhgzo0OshIFL2Gw.text: Visiting friends and we are here twice in a week. I tried the stout pizza and it was awesome!

jMvd-_EFoXD69fEamBYLfQ.text: If you are looking for just Doug u will like this place it was crazy not worth the money . I'm from Chicago I know good pizza this was not worth the money 3 beers 1 pizza 75$ I think it's ridiculous.. You are paying the rent for this place if you want good pizza settebello in the district is best!!

pZyfdhAK7Hnb6_HPS58_cQ.text: This was our first visit to pizza rock. We visited the GVR location and my husband and I were beyond excited as we have heard so many great things about the place. We made reservations which I recommended as they get super busy. Once we were seated the server came by quite quickly to get our drinks order and we order the meatballs as an appetizer. The meatballs were amazing. Next we order the Margherita Pizza which I was especially excited about and the sausage and peppers. My husband and I were planning on sharing the dishes s that we can get a taste of different things. As we placed the order our waitress pointed out that the pizza will be out before the sausage and the peppers as it only takes 6 minutes to make. We were more than ok with that since we were sharing. Well the sausage and the peppers arrived, which we thought was interesting since the comment previous about the pizza. The waitress came by and asked any thing we can get for you, I had asked about our pizza and she is like oh yes he is very behind. Ok we understand but the problem was that when the pizza came out it wasn't even hot and they use to are sauce instead of fresh tomatoes which was kind of disappointing in the Margherita pizza.  It was an ok experience. We may or may not be back. Haven't decided yet.
